reviews.review: best bit was the gong!. we went here as part of a half day trailfinders tour. our guide su was excellent and took us here as well as other palaces. this one I would leave out. there are a lot of steps in the heat and the temple at the top distinctly average. my husband loved the mighty gong at the foot of the manmade hill which su encouraged him to use! We have a small one at home now!

a good 1-2hrs to spend you day in Bangkok!. I went here last july 2016 with my fiance. This museum narrates the colorful and wonderful culture Thailand has to offer. The place is accessible. It is hot though and revealing clothes are not allowed but a good 1-2hrs stay will do. Instagram worthy photos can be taken here!

A nice evening view of the city. We ended up getting to the temple prettying late and weren't sure if they'd even let us climb up but not only were we allowed to enter, but they let us pass for free. Up top we got a beautiful of Bangkok at night and got to see some nice Buddahs and a really interesting statue that exemplifies how they used to dispose of their dead and the problems that arose because of it. Super interesting

Climb the highest mountain of Bangkok. Even if you're coming for religious purpose the Golden Mount is a place worth to go. Hard to believe that this was the tallest landmark of Bangkok before skyscraper popped up. Enjoy the nice walk way with some nice city views. The place is perfectly connected via boat to the city center (eg close to Central World) or the Chao Phraya River. Also the surrounding is worth to explore. A great place also for Non Buddhists.
nice place for prayer on a small hill. Its a nice place for family and present in the Bangkok. It has a coffee shop and some flowers for sales to present Buddha..
Very nice. I went there by myself. I liked it. There is a good view from on top. The Wihan is very beautiful. i was there last year.

just another temple from dozens of them in bangkok. being a muslim tourist from iraq , i really did not see anything there. got my ticket and climbed the stairs to the top of the hill.taking some photos at the top. there is really nothing to do their for any tourist except a buddist one.

Its worth a trip. This temple is nowhere near as impressive as others, but what makes this temple worth the trip is that it offers fantastic views over the city & doesn't have the crowds.Only thing you need to be aware of is, there are 350 steps to the top, but the steps are not steep, so most people should be able to reach the lookout...and there's large bells to ring & gongs to bang on the way up to take your mind off the steps.

Old and new Bangkok!. As its name suggests, is a temple on a mountain. Take into consideration that you will have to climb several steps in order to reach the "golden tresure". Because on the top of the mountain you will be given with my favourite view from Bangkok, the old city with traditional red-roofted buildings, narrow streets and green-coloured, and in the background, the new Bangkok with the new sky-scrappers, most of them renamed hotels. The temple is not bad but nothing espectacular. As always, you can get a blessing by buying stuff to the monks. Water, which you will need after all the climbing, is being sold inside the temple. The roof-top is the most interesting part of the temple with its golden pagoda. How to reach there: tuk-tuk from royal palace 100 THB (after a tough bargaining with several drivers). Tuk-tuk to silom road 130 THB
Interesting temple. Not a typical Thai temple. It was not easy to find, it took me two attempts, but it was well worth the effort.
Very impressive beautiful place.. Fantastic city view from the top, especially after dark. Peaceful and beautiful in the evening. Under construction but still amazing.

Indeed Golden Mountain !!. As the name suggest it is on mountain, so be ready to climb the stairs. Though the stair way is no boring so you could stop many times for different views of city and to take pictures.The entry is not costly and the temple is crowded like other overrated temples.At the end when you reach the top you will feel that this is the best of the temples and the 360 view is great.Tips:- No dress code here but wear modestly.- Go here early in the morning to avoid heat and even little crowd.- Stairs so carry water with you.- Don't listen to scammers saying it is close.Reaching here:- Go to any canal boat stop (Google for this)- Take Canal boat (Long tail) to Phanfa Bridge (7-Eleven here)- Walk to Wat Saket (Short distance)

Amazing Temple. Absolutely amazing temple and one of my favorite attractions in Bangkok. The entry fee of 20 Baht is very rectified and their souvenir shop prices are very considerable as well. It is a little bit difficult to get there but it is not overcrowded which makes the experience even better. All employees and monks are very nice and helpful and the view over Bangkok is one of the best you will get for this price!Afterwards I recommend to walk trough the surrounding area and to visit the much underrated King Prajadhipok Museum which is right next to the hill. Afterwards you can take the water bus back to the city center which is an amazing experience itself and a nice finish to the visit. (The station is a little difficult to find, ask locals or museum staff for the water bus station!)

Nice View but Nothing Spectacular. It's a very nice temple on a hill. It's true that it's quite easy to climb and the view from the top is quite good. The temple itself is quite pretty, and the entrance price is very cheap. One other advantage is that there were very few tourists there. Perhaps the reason for this is that the temple is a bit out of the way from some other sights, certainly not walkable from any form of public transportation. While it was a very nice experience, considering its location and the number of other impressive temples in Bangkok, I wouldn't rank it a 'must-see' sight at all.

Nice view. As the name suggests: the wat is on a hill. From there you have a very nice view on Bangkok. At the foot of the hill is another wat. Not a 'must see' but if you have time to spare, very nice.

Beautiful view from the top of beautiful temple. When you will be there, you will see a beautiful view of Bangkok. Also temple is the one of the most impressive temple in Bangkok. Highly recommended:)

Different from the other. This temple is so different from the others, we really liked it. Entrance fee is 20Baht, the 344 steps are not so steep, was not hard to climb. On the way up you can ring the bells and water mists cool you down....such a lovely panoramic view from the top... can purchase cold drink on the top as well.

classic view over BKK. After the visit of Wat PHRA KEO take a walk to the Golden Mount. You can see many beautiful and historical sites on the way. Phu Khao Thong is artificial and steps lead to the top.100 years ago it was the best view over BKK

Interesting place with a hint of Tacky in places. It is worth coming here to climb even if it is just for the view from the top. You get panoramic views of the city from here and there is beautiful a Stupa at the top. Like a lot of temples the steps are there for a reason, not just get there, they are like a discipline, a hardship to make you grateful once to reach the top.There are water features around the hill as you climb, but some do look a bit tacky but I enjoyed being here none the less. If you have already seen several Buddhist temples you may not want to bother. There is a coffee shop about half way up that does a lovely coffee.

Takes You to the Top. Easy climb to get to Wat Saket. Entrance fee THB 20. Walking distance from the Panfa Leelart terminal pier of the Khlong Saen Seab canal boat. Quite a nice view from the top; supposedly the 'highest' spot in the area. Go in the late evening for sunset; if you're lucky to catch it!

Amazing view. A nice tranquil area, and taxis can take you right to the foot of the steps. The walk up is great, there are loads of very interested and beautiful statues and gardens on the way up.The view from inside the temple is great, it also has air conditioning, a shop and free wi-fi.The view from the top is great, a superb view of Bangkok, however it can get very, very hot.Well worth a visit.

Great "escape" for busy Bangkok. Small oasis in the middle of hectic Bangkok. Tickets are cheap. Afterwards take a walk around the neighborhood, where you'll meet many average Thai-people who's eager to help you on your way

Nice view, but.... Easily accessible place, recommend tuk-tuk to go there. There is a nice view once you on the top, but besides that the temple is not that nice as other temples around Bangkok. Very easy to climb (not that manny stairs). If you asked me if I would go again, the answer is no.

Great views from a man made "mountain ( a hill) " in the middle of the old district. Great views from the top.Go early because its much cooler walking up the MOUNTAIN.....after 12noon, do not bother---too hot.
Nice views. We have been here several times. I like the atmosphere. Nice views, some tranquility in busy Bangkok. Close to other must-sees like the palace and kao San Road.

Nice temple with a great view. Walking up the stairs can be exhausting, especially when it's hot.Once you get up there, there is a temple and within the temple you can take a little stairs up on the roof. The view from the roof is nice and 360 degrees.

Great views of the city. While we were waiting for a restaurant in the area to open for dinner, we stopped by The Golden Mount completely on a whim. The climb to the top is not too strenuous, (but definitely not wheelchair accessible) and the views are very rewarding. While I wouldn't recommend it for a rainy day because the best views are outside, we did spend some time inside the small temple area waiting out a downpour.
Beautiful!. Its a very nice temple, it looks hard to climb, but its quite easy, even under the extreme hot weather. Also, it has a nice view of Bangkok.
waste of time, money and energy for non bhuddists. entry was 20 baht, the temple was ordinary, there were renovations going on, the views from the temple were ok. very disappointing.
Great views. You can tap the gong three times for good luck. Ring the bells, climb the stairs for a great view. Worth the visit.
A Must Visit. There is always some time to visit the top places that are part of the culture in Bangkok, and this is one of them. A Must
loved it. This was interesting and nice and peaceful after the craziness of the Grand Palace. Easy walk to the top for some great views and had a nice coffee there. THB20 entry. Get there by taxi.

Love this temple!. It's quite a hike up the stairs, and there's currently some construction work going on at the top. You can take a break on the stairs as they have natural rest areas. You can get a drink and ice cream at the top too and enjoy the views of Bangkok.

Wat Saket, or The golden Mount, a place I visit every time I'm in Bangkok. A beautiful temple with a long history, tranquil, (very hot on the upper deck), but the most advantageous spot for photographers who want to get a panoramic view of the whole of the Bangkok skyline. I visit every time I'm in Bangkok, and I would have to say it's my favourite place in the Bangkok. I've been there on relatively busy days, but it's never overcrowded - and I've been there on days where there isn't another soul in sight. A wonderful place. It's unlike all the other temples, and situated within walking distance of Town Hall, numerous other wats, and the Khaoson Rd precinct. I always enjoy riding the ferries - and there's one right next door that I take to Asoke, which is near where I usually stay.
Worth while.. We came across it by accident. Wonderful structure, great story, next time we are in Bangkok ill go a night time.

A standard "go to" monument. This appears to be one of those "go to" places that are on many tour Operators lists. It takes around 300 steps to climb and frankly the view and the monument is not all that impressive.

Lots of steps but great views of Bangkok. Its an interesting story of this man-made hill and the temple on its top. Its quite a climb but if you're fit its fine even in the sweltering heat of Bangkok. Really fantastic 360 degree views of the city.
Magnificent Place. Definitely a must see place in Bangkok. Absolutely breathtakingly beautiful Wat. Once you get up there you can see the most spectacular 360 view of the endless Bangkok.

See panaroma of Bangkok for free, Legend of Deadly Vultures in the time of Cholera. Bangkok has not so many points where you can have a panorama of the city. Most of them requires fee like the Vertigo or Hotel. But The Golden Mount offers you the best view of Old Bangkok for free. This area is not allowed to build high rises. So you can see the full panorama of temples and old buildings. Of course, there is no elevators. You have to climb the stairs yourself but don't worry. The stairs here are not steep. Even old and unsporty people can make it. There is also a small coffee shop on the way. Wat Saket has many holy items and interesting legend to share such as Hoads of Vultures in the time of cholera will bring you back to old Bangkok, when death took hold of the city.

View at the top. We enjoyed our visit the first time and had to come back for the views. The climb up 318 steps was worth the views at the top. On the way up to the Golden Mount, on one of the platforms, there was a line of large prayers bells which we strike producing a melodious tone. The Wat Saket temple itself is at the base of the hill.

great views. Get a tuk tuk to take you to the bottom and wait for you- not dear and worth it as you can save your energy in the heat to walk up to the top. Views across Bangkok from there- well worth a visit.

Easy climb to a nice view of the city. As far as the other temples in the city, this one is less impressive. The best part is climbing to the top (not steep and fairly easy) and getting a view of the city. If you have a short time in the city, this one could be skipped.

Traditional. Huge place.Very beautiful and the view from the roof top is amazing.
The visit was worth climbing 300+ stairs.

Not the most visited temple but well worth a visit. Not the most visited temple but well worth a visit. During our trip we met a few other tourist but we did not encounter the large tour groups you see in some other temples.
After climbing the stairs, the views from the top are very nice.

Gorgeous temple, stunning views. A bit of a climb to get to the top but well worth it, as the views are spectacular. We were there on Mother's day, which was special - many people brought gifts for the Monks. Right outside the temple enclosure we found a great little restaurant, nothing fancy but they serve amazing food at a great price, and with a big smile.
An excellent temple with good views. This is a temple on a mount which is well worth the 344 steps. Best late afternoon or early evening.

Get your merits here. I enjoy visiting this temple. it took three generation to build and is much larger and complex than I first realized. I have been at least 4 times and enjoy the views of the palace and surrounding area.
High climb but good view. The view on the rooftop is amazing. The sunset if not hidden by the traffic pollution is beautiful. The temple itself is not one of the better ones but the view is.

344 steps and more..to the top!. Based on the previous reviews, I knew I had to see this temple. This place is peaceful and only has a few tourists. After hustle and bustle of the grand palace and the watpho and emerald Buddha, this location is an oasis. Do not be intimidated by the stairs, there are a lot of places to rest and take pictures. Midway there is a café for cold drinks and ice cream. Once you reach the top, this is one temple that they are not that strict with the dress code and you keep your shoes. Go around and enjoy the smaller images then take the wooden stairs to the right tucked in an alcove and go to the rooftop to enjoy views of Bangkok and see devotees offering prayers. On the way down, you can take another route and see this giant Buddha inside a smaller temple with glass walls. Trying to get to Wat Ratchanada also known as the Loha Prasat, we got detoured and stumbled on an empty temple with a wide plaza...golden buddhas in a straight line surrounding the main temple....all to ourselves as this was already around noon. We got here by taxi from Wat traimit, cost us around 40baht. There are so many taxis in Bangkok, might be a good idea to have the hotel staff to write down the places where you want to go in Thai, so there will be no misunderstanding. They will try to negotiate price, just say "meter", they say no, close the door and flag down another taxi.

Quite an interesting place - with a view over Bangkok. Jumped a tuk-tuk here, skilfully negotiating a return price with the driver and paying upfront (a rookie mistake, I now know, but I like to trust people). After a driver-induced detour to a tailor-made suit shop, we arrived at the attraction. I had resisted a purchase of their finest evening wear fearing that it would be destroyed by my intended vigorous prance up to the Golden Mount. Upon arrival at the said attraction, somehow and sadly, our driver had managed to forget all of the English he had learnt in his lifetime, and couldn't communicate with us - he needed a fellow tuk-tuk driver to interpret his words to us - detailing a sudden plight that had afflicted our driver. We were advised that the driver had gone blind and needed to go. I couldn't imagine what illness had struck him to deprive him of his English and his sight - the world can be such a cruel and merciless place. With no cure to hand, we set off up the steps anyway and at one point turned around to then see our driver driving away in his tuk-tuk. Maybe it was the power of the Mount. Didn't mind being ripped off, though, due to the insane nature of his deceit. Anyway, the Golden Mount was alright - worth double the cost of a journey to it.

A golden view. The 344 steps may seem daunting but don't be put off - there are places to take a breather on the way up and it's well worth it. The golden peak, like so many temples in Bangkok, offers amazing views across the city. Inside is beautifully peaceful and not aimed specifically at tourists. Well worth a visit!

Worth the 300+ steps to the top!. Beautiful views of both old and new Bangkok, well worth the many steps to the top. Its a beautiful place, well kept with lots of photo opportunities and very peaceful too!
Would definitely recommend a stop here if you're doing a tour of all the sights, do not forget this one!

How to get here by Bus and Khlong. Why is there so many description about the temple but so hard to describe how to get here ?OK. .here goes. I took 2 mode of transportation to get to Wat Saket (went by bus and returned by Khlong River Boat)I took the BTS all the way to National Stadium. From here I walk towards the entrance to MBK but took the stairs down to my right where there's lots of Tuk Tuk and motor taxi (con men and vultures) waiting for tourist. They quoted 150 baht just by motor taxi to Wat Saket. Those blood sucking worms. Walk further down to the bus stop about 60 meters from the National Stadium. Look at the Board at the bus stop and make sure it says and point to the INBOUND direction. If it says OUTBOUND than u are at the wrong side of the road. Wait for bus number 15 or 47. (I took 15) and it will drive u all the way straight near to areas near Wat Saket. I had my Google Map ready and even if ur GPS shows detour, DONT WORRY. the bus drove pass by Wat Saket (you can see it with the Golden Stupa about 15 min from where I took the bus). The nearest stop there is the MAHAKORN FORT. How do u know if u have reach MAHAKORN FORT ? Look to ur left. It is the only building with cannons sticking out of it. That's when u press the bell to get off. Wat Saket is just 7 min walk to your left as u got off the bus. Follow the stupa. Bus cost me 11 baht.Another easy way which was the easiest is the Khlong. I took the MRT (not BTS) to Petchaburi station. Follow exit number 2. ASOK PIER and once exit follow right. Walk and the Pier is just 1 min from the Exit 2 of Petchaburi station. Take a 10 baht (yes...10 baht only) river boat and make sure you ask if the boat goes to Pratunam. Pratunam is the last stop. Once u get to Pratunam, get off and cross the bridge to the other side of the river. This time get on the boat and follow direction to PANFA LEELARD Pier. (All boat here stops and Pratunam, that is why u have to change boat). PANFA LEELARD Pier is also the last Pier and this is where Wat Saket is located. Just a stone throw away. It's another 10 baht so total you spend 20 baht.So very easy. Last station PANFA LEELARD for Wat Saket when you get on from Pratunam and last station Pratunam when you get on from ASOK Pier. The best part is once u r done with Wat Saket, you can get back on the boat and stop at Pratunam to do shopping. After that, back to the Pratunam Pier and on the boat to the nearest MRT which is ASOK-PETCHABURI pier (some people just call it ASOK Pier)Please try this and don't get cheated with taxi and Tuk Tuk. The boat was much much easier.This link below helps to explain each station pier where the boat stops at. Use this.http://khlongsaensaep.com/lines-route-map.html

nice view. the stairs are worth the view. we were there on one of the Buddha days and loved the atmosphere. Flowers, nice bells, a big gong, incense smell and lots of devout prayers. It's worth a visit!

Golden mountain, happened to be walking around and found this Amazing place! Be sure to take a look a the temples!!!. Incredible place! I spent some time drawing the temples next to the location.A must see for all of you who need a bit of a break from the delicious chaos of the city!
Nice view over Bangkok. I walked from Koh San Road to Wat Saket (which was a long walk!).The view is great (when there are no clouds).

Well worth a visit!. Just looking for things to do on our last day before our flight out and this was on the map. Although it was a chance visit, it was probably our favourite temple! Much quieter than some and the views from the top of the mount were super.

beautiful place, nice walk and a great view. The Golden Mount is worth a visit. I would recommend taking a Tuk Tuk because you'll be probably driving through china town and other great suburbs which is best experienced while driving a Tuk Tuk. Don't get screwed over by the driver, always negotiate a fixed price beforehand. The stairs to the Golden Mount are not very steep and easy to handle. At the top you will be rewarded with a great view over parts of Bangkok with the Skyline in the background.You are able to buy water and ice cream at the top as well.Don't forget to bring your camera, the view is amazing.

Great view, beautiful walk. We hadn't planned on going here, but we ended up here when a man outside another temple began talking to us and recommended it. (It turns out the man was part of a local plan to steer visitors into buying a suit, but it turned out well!) The walk is uphill, not too long or strenuous, with plenty to look at and enjoy on the way to the top. The view from the top was likely among the best in the city. We had a lot of fun here!

Above expectations. This place wasn't on my top list. After walking some backstreets, we came to the entrance. From there it was a pleasure of walking up the stairs. Partly between trees and running water. The view (and windchill!) from the top was amazing.

A beautifull look-out all over Bangkok!. Take an early morning visit! In the afternoon the heat is a bit much for your walk up the stairs to the top of the Mountain. The view is your treat after your brisk walk up the stairs but they sell cold water en icecream at the top. It's a nice tranquil place in busy Bangkok!

Worth the trip. if your looking to take amazing scenic pictures of the city and have a little fun while doing it. This is the place for you! This great temple is not for the faint of heart there is an incline walk that takes a little time but not too bad. While walking up to the temple you are greeted with amazing bells and gongs that you can ring. When you reach the top you have 360 view of the entire city and the temple is great to look at as well. The cost is only 50THB which is nothing compared to the others around. PLUS....not very touristy so its not busy!!
The view is the most important part. Nice exercise to go to the top! But.. the view is excellent. Clean and with nice gardens all around to rest a while before visiting the nearby temples and museum.

Excellent 360-degree view over the city. An absolutely wonderful place to get a nice Impression on Bangkok with a complete 360-degree view across the City. Do this when you have fine weather as otherwise it will be a pity not to see enough of the City.
Quiet. We were able to see this from our hotel's balcony and managed to walk to it during a fairly quiet time. The surrounding streets were also very quiet, so it was a relaxing place to visit.

Top of the temple in Bangkok. A really nice place to climb and the view is fantastic. The Mount is decorated all throughout the climb, and you can ring huge bells and gongs if you like. Once at the top, enjoy unobstructed views of Bangkok, and all the other temple roofs in the city. There's even free wifi at the top - which isn't surprising since so much money is donated on site by locals and tourists alike (but that's the case of all the main temples in Bangkok, it's a great business plan;-). The entrance fee is cheap, and there's only one main entrance, don't try to take shortcuts, they don't lead anywhere. In any case, a must-do for the view of the city.
Great view . The highest temple in Bangkok apparently, very beautiful and great view at the top Got the river taxi back to the centre which was an experience!!

Monks bowls at Ban Batra. Here , just down the same road from Wat Saket you will see some of the manufacturing aspects of a dying art - handcraft metal working to make traditional monks bowls.Don't be put off by the obvious tourist show by a bloke who claims he is the last of the trade with his nicely positioned shop right on the corner with his average quality products at tourist prices.Make the effort and walk another 100 metres further on and look for the large street positioned sign identifying the BanBatra community ( Soi Ban Batra) and have a look at the last of their kind. You can even pick up a nice hand made sized bowl with lovely finish for ~ $30 A. and enjoy the friendship of a few in that alleyway.

Not Touristy Yet!!! :). Definitely a must do in Bangkok.. It's not too touristy yet, and has a few other wats around it to check out! The views from the top of the Golden Mount are amazing.. great place for sunset! There's wifi throughout, and a cafe and bathroom about halfway to the top. It's 20 baht to get in, and worth every bit of it!!

Most peacefull temple in Bangkok. Each time I vist here I feel peaceful. In the middle of Bangkok, but serene. Just to see the water flowing down the mountain, smell it, forget about the busy city. Great vuew over Bangkok from the top.
Nice. Nice view over the city. The temple itself was not that spectacular. It was a very hot climb to the top as it was directly in the burning sun.

Impressive temple!. The Golden Mount temple is huge and impressive. Love the beautiful architecture. Only thing is there are too many tourist and too hot outside that I could not concentrate:) Still a must go in Bangkok!

Worth a quick visit. A nice climb up the hill is full of bells to ring and places to pray. Once at the top, the temple is pretty nice but nothing to write home about. The best part is the 360 degree view of Bangkok from the very top as there are no high towers close by to block the view. If you have some time, it is worth the quick visit.

Great for kids!. The Golden Mount is an easy climb for children and the view of the surrounding area is worth the visit. The Wat is visited by tourists and locals with plenty of friendly attendants around. Our daughters, ages 8 and 5 enjoyed the climb very much and loved the view at the top. Definitely worth it.

The Golden Mountain. Very nice temple with an original location at the top of a hill. You first climb the hill, hearing prays, and enjoying the view on Bangkok. there are some bells along the way that you can make ring. The temple is very nice and is one of the rare ones where you can keep your shoes in order to be able to also visit the roof top with an amazing golden bell shape. We really appreciated the walk up and down around the hill.

Beautiful View of Bangkok. The panorama views from the top of the Golden Mount are breathtaking! Recommend visiting approximately 30 minutes before sunset to stake out a great spot. Another piece of advice - Beware of scammers in this area who offer to take you to see the Lucky Buddha. There is no such place!

A little bit difficult to get to but the views are nice. This is a little bit out of the way from the other Tourist attractions. The best way to get here is via ferry beneath the Hua Chang bridge. From there, just take a ferry and disembark at the last stop. The fare should only cost 8 Baht.Wat Saket will just be a short walk from the last ferry stop.It is recommended to come here during early morning or late in the afternoon it could get really hot getting to the top.

Great history - this Wat was used to cremate epidemic typhoid victims in the 1900s. It is reportedly built on a log raft. This is one of the best temples in Thailand. It is the only hill in Bangkok giving panoramic views of the city. It has an interesting story and includes a trip to the top of Golden Mount and several very well preserved temples at the foot of the mount. The food shops outside the temple are rumoured to be some of the best in Bangkok for local street food. Nearby is an old fort and several superb temples. Also less than 5 minutes away is the palace. You can catch a water taxi there along Saen Saep klong, very cheap and convenient if you are based near Phetchburi Road, Pathu Nam or Ramkhaenghe

Great history and amazing views of Bangkok. This is one of the best temples in Thailand. It is the only hill in Bangkok giving panoramic views of the city. It has an interesting story and includes a trip to the top of Golden Mount and several very well preserved temples at the foot of the mount. The food shops outside the temple are rumoured to be some of the best in Bangkok for local street food. Nearby is an old fort and several superb temples. Also less than 5 minutes away is the palace. You can catch a water taxi there along Saen Saep klong, very cheap and convenient if you are based near Phetchburi Road, Pathu Nam or Ramkhaengheng.

Nice Walk and Great Views!. The walk up is a really nice pathway with misting and bells lining the way up. From the top you can see all of the main temples, and the Golden Mount itself is worth visiting
Beautiful Temple. I think it is one of the highest temple in Bangkok. So i have some really great views from the top of the Temple. It was amazing.
Great panorama view. The temple is located on top of a hill. The roof of the temple offers a incredible view of the city during sunset or sundown. It is a temple so dress appropriate.

Great View and more relaxing than other tourist spots. We too the local boat from our hotel to the temple which was fun in its self. The boat staff are very helpful and the ride gives a unique view of the city. A short walk to the temple complex and at mid morning we found no crowds or queues. No long pants or coverups needed at this temple we would visit in what t shirts and shorts which was great as it was in the mid 30's. Very relaxed atmosphere, half way up the mount is a great cafe which made a very good latte ;) At the top of the mount very good city views and even wifi, yes wifi! The whole complex is very calm and very beautiful and well worth the visit. Compared to the other attractions such as the palace and Emerald Bhudda this place is an oasis, the others being swamped with noisy tour groups touts tacky shops and petty thieves.

Peaceful Experience. The walk up the mount is as much part of the charm here as is the experience at the top, and the coffee at the shady stop on the way up was one of the best I've had in Bangkok. Arrive by water taxi on Khlong Mahanak and combine with a visit to the completely different, but equally enjoyable Metal Palace opposite (brilliantly described by Lawrence Osborne in 'Bangkok Days') for a great half day out.

Lovely views of the city. The tranquil temple provides one of the best views upon the city. The temple is located far away from the BTS or underground stations so be prepared for a longer walk, or grab a taxi, but the view from the top of it is definitely worth it!
Walking. I never been there, I walked here from Asoke. It was worth it? Yes, discovering a new piece of the Bangkok puzzle is every time amazing!

Beautiful, worth the climb to the top.. Lovely, very peaceful. When we went, there weren't many people around, compared to other tourist hotspots. You can buy a bell and write your name on it, and tie it once you've climbed to the top. It may be the last thing you want to do on a hot, humid day, but it's definitely worth the climb. The views are stunning and it's all gold at the top.

Amazing views of Bangkok, well-kept grounds.. Next to a street of woodworkers and literally around the corner from a couple of famous local eats (Thip Samet and Jay Fai) Some major renovations were underway (July 2016) but the whole temple was still accessible. Gentle climb up some landscaped areas adorned with relic bells and other decorations before you get up to the actual temple. Areas for offerings and prayer indoors, and somewhat narrow, steep stairs to the top where you have the main dome "guarded" by the four statues, and some of the best views of Bangkok.
Impressive especially from outside. Worth a visit if in the area. Near to canal boat service and about 15 walk from Samsen road. Impressive golden dome.
A nice temple, an interesting location. This was an above average temple given the many we visited. It's location up on a hill yields some nice views as well.

Very beautiful. I love it. the golden on the moutain and i can see beautiful places on roof top.
You should come here.

Off the tourist trail a little but enjoyed it here. We arrived by canal boat and walked across the bridge. In the dry hot season it is a difficult climb for older overweight farage but at the top there is a pleasant breeze and drinks/ice-creams. It is attractive interesting,all whitewash, gilt, flowers,, views.

Tranquility and peace !. This is one of the best relaxing place inside the busy and crowded Bangkok. We were so amazed at how the greenish and beautiful of Bangkok up on the top of the Mount. The golden mount is a good place for worship and viewing Bangkok in a 360 degree !
Great view.. Not on a rail or ferry line, so either taxi or tuk tuk. Climbed many stairs to get to the top, but worth it for the views.

Great views . Best site we've been to in Bangkok. Lots of awkward spaced steps but well worth the short climb.
Nice looking coffee shop 1/3 of the way up but we didn't go in.
Great views of the old and new.
Views. This place has amazing views all over Bangkok, lovely temple really enjoyed our visit here. Would recommend going at sunset for an even better view
Beauty at its best. The sleeping Budda is my favorite-On my half day city tour -I took video of everything.my dream holiday

Serenity in busy Bangkok . It's amazing that after all those great reviews and it being placed so high on the things to do list in Bangkok we still were practically the only people at the golden mountain. A lot of nature in the steps leading to the temple and at the top a great view. Only thing I didn't like were all the tourists banging the gong and playing with the bells. Come on guys have a little respect you aren't at home.

Will become popular. Wat Saket with its 334 steps is totally worth the effort but not disability friendly. We walked up on June 26 after paying a 20 baht entrance fee and found scaffolding around the top. You can still visit and walk around the temple. The 360 degree views are unimpeded but remember it is a temple not just a tourist site.

I good experience . With a minimal entrance fee, you really do get a cultural adventure worth a lot more. If you're into climbing stairs then this is for you. On a hot day you get a sense of victory when you reach the top, and a beautiful view of the city. I would go again.
Great view. Nice hotel with an great view from the top, over Bangkok. I just think it's a little to much tourists that don't respect the dress code. But beautiful temple and worth an visit

Nice views not touristy. I read about this place in a guide book. We got the local commuter boat from near Jim Thomson's house to a stop on the river not far from the golden mount. There are numerous steps up to the top of the mount but well worth climbing for the views.

This was a great unplanned visit. One of the best places to visit in Bangkok. Almost no turists visit this place, all u have to do is pay 20 Bath at the entrance and get ready to walk up the 369 stairs to reach the top of the mountain. The view of the city is great and you can buy water at the top.

Worth the Steps for some greaat views. There are a number of stairs to climb, but they are worth it for the great views. We went up in the afternoon and really enjoyed beautiful views over that part of the city, along with seeing the lovely temple. There are many spots along the way up (and down) to stop and take a breather and even play games or have some fun (cymbals etc.). Well worth visiting in Bangkok.

High Way Temple. You need extra effort to reach the top. But its very worth to do. You need to climb the stairs. When you reach top, you have to take off your shoes but do not leave it. Just take it inside and if you want you can pray. You can go upstairs again to see the Golden Temple. The floor very hot, but you are not allowed to use shoes. Just bear it and find some place that have shadow to take rest. after that you can go down but in different way than you enter it. You can go down by the different stairs. You can enjoy the view from the top while you going down.

Wat Saket, Bangkok. Wat Saket is a fascinating site that has been developed over time. Originally it was a temple known as Wat Sakae in the Ayutthaya period until Rama I moved the capital to modern-day Bangkok. The hill is artificial and based on a former structure that was abandoned in the era of Rama III. By the early 20th Century a chedi was constructed and reinforced by concrete in the 1940s. Today the chedi overlooks the Pom Prap Sattru Phai area and gives an impressive view of the city. Wat Saket is in itself an impressive site, however, there are some caveats. Be aware of the 300 or so stairs; it is not easily accessible by the elderly or infirm. Also, the site is generally swamped with tourists during peak season, usually coming within an hour after the opening time of 8:00. Prepare to be asked for the entry fee of around 20 baht, especially during the middle of the day; it may have gone well up since then. The surrounding complex is nothing special other than a few bizarre statues. The attraction is really the large chedi and the great view of the surrounding area. Definitely worth a visit.
Quick and nice. Takes some 364 steps to get to the top of this temple plus some more stairs to get to the roof. Wifi is available. Pleasant compound where monks stay as well.
Peaceful place in the city. This is a very peaceful temple and not overly crowded. The climb is a bit strenuous in the heat and humidity, but the view from the top is worth it.

First visit . This place was recommended by our taxi driver who brought us there. Prepare for the climb to the top but you will not regret. Nice view when you reach the top. Need to be careful if the floor is wet as it will be slippery when you are climbing up.
Very cool. Check this site out to get a good view of the city and to see another temple in Bangkok. Close to the canal boat.

Great little temple to check out!. Loved the long walk up a trail of stairs that wrap around in a spiral around the mountain he temple lies on top of. Interesting things along the walk up too but definitely expect heat. The top has a nice view and is a simple temple but loved all the beautiful bells along the walk up which it is tradition to ring everyone. Very close to the red swing.

Interesting and peaceful. An interesting temple with lots of bells to ring as you walk up the stairs to the temple. There is a good view of Bangkok. We took a taxi from Victory Monument which took a long time and caught the klong boat back. This travels past the Central world stop, making it very cheap and accessible.

An interesting climb up the mount.. Had an interesting climb up the golden mount with a view of the city from the top and sighting of the many Buddhas, life size figurines of warriors and people, tombs and the mist like atmosphere that made it mysterious.This site was in Life Magazine in 1950 and entry is only 20bth and well worth it to help maintain the place and keep it in good order. The site is easily accessible by the river boats stopping at the last stop at one end at the Phanfa Pier.That alone is a river cruise but without the tour guide.

A must see. Despite visiting Bangkok 3 times, it was not until our third time that we managed a visit to the Golden Mount. We were staying in the Sukhumvit area and used the BTS and canal ferry to get there, quite an experience but really easy and fun to do. The actual golden mount is so tranquil, we were lucky and the place was really quiet and we could take our time going round. Ringing all the bells and gongs all the way up. The views form the top are fantastic, gives a great perspective of Bangkok a true city of contrasts. Don't be like us and leave to it to your third visit.

Nice Temple!. I like this temple better than the other as it is not as crowded! The climb going up to the temple adds more allure to it and you get rewarded with the view of the city. I like it that they have the mists spray going up, its really good that they have it considering how hot and humid it could get. I'd totally recommend this place if you like visiting temples!

Used to be free! But the view is stll great. Wat Saket used to be free (I was here in 2011), but now non Thais a.k.a tourists have to pay 20 Baht to get in. Even though, the view is still great from up there. The walk up is fun. So do not let the entrance fee scare you away!

Best temple in the city, what a view!. This place is like a little mountain oasis in the middle of Bangkok. The grounds are really night, a lot of water falls and streams and thick dense growth. Huge bamboo all around and keeping the walkway shaded. When you reach the chedi there is a nice little coffee shop you can grab a strong coffee and enjoy some history of the building. When you do get to the top of the chedi where the stupa is located, wow what a view! Look out over Bangkok's amazing skyline. Great place to visit.
Good viewpoint and peaceful. It's worth a visit for the view and a peaceful haven to sit down and relax for a moment. The kids loved hitting the gong (not so peaceful then!)
Nice view. A must see in Bangkok. The Golden Mount is one of the cheapest tourist attractions at 20 Baht and offers and incredible view of the city from a historical part of town.

lovely views. a lovely walk to the top with plenty of shade on the way up which made it easier in the heat! very scenic lovely architecture , really enjoyed it , although once on the very top its too hot and completely in the open so didn't stay up there too long! lol

Good views of Bangkok.. This has free entry which is always a bonus. To get to the top you have to climb a fair amount of stairs. The views from the top are pretty good too. There is a little shop inside selling drinks and ice cream.
Nice view. A nice place to be. The stairs to the top are very high but the reward is on the top. A nice view over Bangkok and there is always on that hight a nice wind.
A long climb. A lot of steps & not a lot to see when you reach the top. Suppose to have a relic of the Buddha!............................

Mainly logistics advice. Wats are not for tourists and, I think, beyond tripadvisor judgments. This is a fantastic place also, views, setting, architecture, so certainly, go, if you appreciate temples and would like to join the devotees. How to get there: I recommend taking the BTS to National Stadium, taking exit 1, and then taking one of the many tuk-tuks there (less than € 2.50).How to approach: The steps are easy if you are at all mobile, there are excellent handrails. You do NOT need to remove your shoes, and although this is a Royal temple, knee-covering non-long pants are fine. In fact, if it's wet, you definitely shouldn't; this is slippery. You may use your parasol as well.Once there: The main Buddha shrine is one floor below the terrace. The terrace features the golden stupa itself. There is an astroturf walkway around it; for this, remove your shoes and circumambulate clock-wise (say, three times) if you want.Just after and before closing and/or during or after some rain is the best time to go here. But again, slippery when wet!

One of the most beautiful temples. I have been there as part of a tour in a small group that was run by a local ppl and if non for them I would have missed it!such a view!and to see the locals pray and all the Buddha sculptures wow!i really loved it

great experience. after a long walk from grand palace, we went up to the golden mount to look around see the big pagoda up there. The place was huge. High above the city, that where I saw the place that keeps the ash of buddha wit hwonderful city view, its one of the highlight of my bangkok holiday. we rang the bell three times for good luck. When I reach the top we prayed for different spots we were so glad to visit here.

Favorite temple in Bangkok. Favorite temple. Climb a few stairs through cooling mist, stopping at a coffee shop in the middle. At the top, there's a beautiful view of Bangkok. No dress code like many of the other temples.

Very good view of Bangkok!. This is a pretty site, a short walk up the stairs brings you to the temple at the top. Make sure to go up the stairs inside the temple in order to get to the very top and you will have a fantastic 360 view of the city. It's not crowded at all so a good thing to do after experiencing the mass of tourists elsewhere.

Saw it at day and night. This is a beautiful temple on a mountain. it is located within bangkok. bring shade and your camera. Although the inner structure is closed at night, you can still walk around the outter structure. We walked around and took pictures. Be sure to ring a bell or two.

A haven of peace and silence. Wat Saket or the Golden Mount is a must see in Bangkok. To enjoy the amazing view over the City of Angels you have to climb the 318 steps to the top first. But the effort will be rewarded by the stunning 360° sight over Bangkok. There is a little shop in the Tempel on top of the hill, so you can buy some refreshments....

Climb the steps...ticket to heaven. Wat Saket is also known as the Temple of the Golden Mount. I asked and the Mount referee to the mound that the temple sits on. The Temple is located in a park like setting, there is an entry fee of 20 baht for non-Thais. My friend and guide told me that it was guaranteed that anyone who climbed the steps to honor the Buddha would be admitted to heaven. I figured this was one of those chances I should take! Well, it was a hot day (103c) but the air was somewhat cooler as I reached the top of the 300 steps leading to the golden stupa. There was serene feeling as I took in the iconography and looked over Bangkok. On the way down, one passes the Wat's vision of hell with various suffers being tortured (statues of suffers, that is).

Nice walk up a misty mountain. We are travelling with a family with a eleven year old and a fourteen year old, it was a nice walk up a mountain half of it was shaded with mist spraying at you to cool you down. There is a drink shop half way with reasonable price delicious drinks although no meals. Reaching the top was not a serious effort and definitely worth the climb. This man made mountain (check out the interesting history) gives a spectacular view of the city. Take your camera. Wear modest clothing as this is a religious building and take good walking shoes.

One of my favorite places to bring friends visiting BKK. This is a beautiful temple, which has incredible views from the top. It is a must see in Bangkok. Remember to dress appropriately and respect those coming to worship here. Also, it is not required, but nice if you give a donation to keep the place maintained.

UNIQUE TEMPLE WITH A GREAT VIEW OF BKK. To get to the top requires a climb up some 318 steps, which encircle the chedi like a loosely coiled snake. Walking up the 318 steps is no joke especially if you have BIG FOOT. But nothing beats the magnificient views you get to see , it's all worthwhile. We spend about 1hour and we even follow the local, walking rounds at the chedi.
Soothing place. Temple was clean, quite and feels good to be inside this temple. Statues were big and were beautifully crafted.

Unique Temple Stop. Golden Mount was the last stop on our tour and one of the highlights. The short walk up to the top has an enchanted forest theme that was very beautiful. Once you get to the top you will see amazing views of the city. Bring water and ring the bells for good luck!
Great view. Worth a visit only for city views . The entry is cheap and not crowded because lots of steps to climb

Not crowded, 360 degree views of Bangkok. Nice walk up to the top, nice planting. Nothing really spectacular, wouldn't compare to the Grand Palace or Wat Pho architecturally - highlight is the view from the top and less tourists - peaceful in comparison. Bus ride away from MBK/National Stadium.

Get your cardio on . The hike up to the top in Bangkok heat and humidity is not for wimps. Once you are up there, however, you're rewarded with the most spectacular unobstructed view of Bangkok. It is located in the Old City part of Bangkok, take MRT to Hua Lamphong station and from there just a short cab ride away.

Calmimg with Character. The site which is a combination Wat and Garden provides beautiful flora and views. You need to climb over 330 steps to get to the top. There is a small but gorgeous setting when you reach the top which provides information to learn about the site and pray. The view of Bangkok is awesome.
Nice place and great view. I went there yesterday, the entrance fee is 20THB. It is good and you should go there as you can learn a lot from the culture and the costumes. It worth!
Great city view.... I loved this Wat! You must climb 300 steps to the top so try to go in the morning (opens at 9am) It's very peaceful & you can take some nice photos.
Nice view. From this place you can have a nice view of the entire city. The temple and the area around are very nice.

Nice to walk around temple.. Mention they have around 344 stairs. At first I don't think i can make it, while we walk we always find something new such as statue, bell or nice scenery. Once you at top, you can treat ur self an ice cream or cold water then after you can pray.
Nice and quiet. Not easy to get to unless you are at Khao San. Quiet and peaceful if you are not going on special evenings or religious festivals.

Best temple in Bangkok. In my opinion of course. This is because you're not stuck within scorching hot white walls but, walk around the "mount" where is lots of green and shades. Nice for a walk around and full of atmosphere.
My tip: Take the canal boat on the back of the temple to the Jim thompson house
Great view of Bangkok. A must see, this easy climb up offers a great view of Bangkok in a nice area. We enjoyed the hour we spent there. Nice café on the way up too.
VIEW IS OK WHEN YOU GO ON TOP. Lovely environment friendly background with sprinkling water systems brings you cool atmosphere even in very hot sunny days.

Splendid view of the city. Climb a few stairs, ring a few bells on the way and there you are. On the top of the Golden Mountain.The view is all. All the contrasts of Bangkok at one glance. Modern skyscrapers, ancient rich temples, shabby houses.The temple itself is not extraordinary, also you can buy some drink and ice-cream inside, so one does not really feel the sacrum. :)On top of the roof, just above a beautiful old gong, somebody proudly announces about Golden Mountain Free Wifi.The symbol of our times. ;)

A temple away from the crowds. If you see one temple in Bangkok, make it this one. It's as beautiful as the main tourist temples but without the crowds, so you can look around in peace and really take it in - plus once you walk up the 300 steps there's a panoramic view of the city.We saw lots of locals and some monks going about their business - all in all it seemed more like a temple than a tourist attraction.
Nice view. After paying 20 THB you have to climb around 300 steps. You will find a nice view on Bangkok's city, but that's mainly all. Do not expect too much of a temple.
Brilliant!. Thoroughly enjoyed this experience of Bangkok to see the amazing view after the climb up. would recommend this to everyone.
good view of Bangkok. Wat Saket is a small gem on an hill top. It should be on a one day itanerary. On a beautiful day 360 view over bankok

Can't believe I have not found this gem earlier. One of my all time favourite temples. Man made hill but the way its done with a rain forests.. waterfalls..and mist all the way to the top.. it is magical. Not to.mention for coffee lovers a fancy coffee shop with a spankin new shining expresso machine.. Loved it..Keep up the good work guys get good positive energy and the Lester will win the epl :-)

Perfect sunset spot. You will have an amaze balls view of the city and the sunset. It is not crowed with Chinese tourists, people in elephant pants and selfie sticks. You can enjoy the sunset in peace and quiet.
good place, high enough. good place to visit when you are a tourist in Bangkok, beautiful landmark if you look from the top, must visit

A must visit atleast once when you are in BKK. Wow place and a must visit to see the beauty of Buddhism and feel the oeace inside when you close your eyes in front of Lord Buddha for few minutes.You feel attached and peaceful.
Gotta see it if your in Bangkok. One of the classic tourist sights to see, nice, but crowded and hot. Watch your belongings for pickpockets

Nice view point and very well maintained temple.. Comparatively cheap entry ticket. Stairs shaded with trees, small fountains and sprinkler fans keep it a cool place in the summer. The temple is very breezy and offers a nice view point. Idols are similar to other temples. The roof top is super hot though.
Absolutely free entrance. Unforgateble view from top of the hill. Bells by the way up make the way easiest and funny. No lift.

Panoramic View of Bangkok-Golden Mount. It’s a remarkable experience for me visiting the Golden Mount of Lord Buddha- Wat Saket .I visited the shine at noon hours when the sun was high above. It has been built on the only manmade hill in Bangkok. After climbing 320 stairs I reached the top of the shrine and enjoyed the panoramic views of the Rattanakosin Island and the Bangkok City around. Monastries and pagodas can be seen around the mount . The relics of Bhudda have been enshrined in the pagoda on the top of the Golden Mount.i saw many locals worshipping in the shrine at the top. And after tiring in hot sun I walked down the mount . The entry ticket is 20 THB .
Nice to see. This was wroth the stop and very nice to see. You get some great views. Add it in to your sightseeing around the city!

Uphill to great views. I climbed the stairs up to the Golden Mount on a second time now. It was worthwhile to do it again, because the view from there is great and even on a Sunday morning it is not too crowded such as other places in Bangkok.
The best Sunset experience ever!. Beautiful view and strongly recommend to go there to see sunset, magical view :) :) I can't remember how much was the entrance but very cheap.

Great view. The climb up to the top of this temple is beautiful in itself, with overhanging blooming plants, large bells, and an increasingly beautiful view. At the top, you have a 360 degree view of the city. Go around sunset and you will enjoy both the beautiful colors, a slight breeze, and less crowds.
A nice temple in the middle of Bangkok. Wat Saket is a nice temple with good views from the top. Good views of Bangkok and is relatively easy to walk up despite being on a hill.

Wow.. We heard about this sight from a local Thai student and it is well worth the visit. It costs only 20THB to visit the temple and it provides one of the best views of Bangkok. The walk up to the top of the mount is stunning with simulated rainforests, statues and bells lining the walk up. Then, at the top, you are impressed with a stunning 360 view of the Bangkok landscape.

Beautiful temple and view. The temple is beautiful. It's only 2Baht. There are 344 steps to go up but it's not tiring at all, steps are very small and on the way you'll stop looking at beautiful flowers, view and singing bells.Not to be missed.You can buy water but it's not food anywhere around unless you like the street venders.Place of peace.
Nice view. A nice view of an older part of Bangkok from up top. In my mind, not the most extraordinary of places but you get karma points for climbing up to the top!

Go at the end of the day, near Sunset. I think the key attribute of this Temple is it's high vantage point to see more of Bangkok from above, on top of it being very nice to see.Go at the end of the day, near Sunset would be my suggestion.
Get ready to climb over 300 steps.. Wat Saket or The Golden Mount is beautiful. Worth going up the 300 plus steps. The view of Bangkok from the top is great!

A Must Go to feel the breeze of Bangkok. We went there before sunset and stood on the rooftop of it to feel the every breeze of Bangkok, it was so wonderful and very hard to describe in words. Highly recommend!

A Must See - At Sunset. We arrived just before sunset and the view from the top, top was remarkable. The sun was setting and the sky was pink. The walk up, around the wat was pretty benign that included the option to ring many bells / gongs on the way up. Lots of room to walk around and see a 360 degree, panoramic view of the city.

Worth a visit. Small hill with a temple on it. There is a winding path that leads from the base of the hill to the top. Good views across Bangkok from the temple. The walk up the hill is not steep and takes less than five minutes. There are some bells along the way you can ring. They're very picturesque, but also attract obnoxious tourists who continually slam them. If you're unfit and can't handle heat - don't go. The hill is bloody roasting.
Nice view of the City. There is a very nice view of the city from the top of the Mount. They had hands on bells to ring. Lots of climbing to get to the top.

Oh the beauty of the bells. This Wat is up a hill and you will have to climb over 300 steps. But they are shallow and it is pretty easy. It is completely worth it for the view from the top! My favorite part though is all the bells. I love the sound of the temple bells in Thailand and this temple was the most musical, perhaps because you are high up so you are catching a lot more breeze. Lovely!

Yes, take a trip here. I recommend a trip here, preferably when there isn't a festival on, because then it will be very very busy. Off peak, however, and you can be almost alone, perhaps with a few other brave souls who have read their guide books. You get some idea of how important a place it is as you approach and start the spiral walk up. There are lots of stalls on the way, all closed up, but you know they will come alive at the right time. It's a medium length walk up, not steep, with things to see and bells to sound on the way. At the top is a large gold dome, called a chedi, decorated with flags. You get a great view from here.

TripAdvisor page updates. Users should be allowed to edit the full page details rather than the address, phone number and website link. So for the administrator the opening hours are: everyday 08:00 to 19:00. The admission fee is 20BHT and there is free WiFi at the top. Also there is a nice café halfway up so to have an ice coffee or a refreshment especially if you have been walking under the sun visiting other sites in the Old City.
thailand. you get very good views of the city and not many tourists go there. Its very nice and popular with the locals and there is a steep climb up..

Saved my day in Bangkok. After having spent a lot of time at the Grand Palace and being very disappointed there and at the Vimanmek mansion, the Golden Mount saved my day in the evening.We were there shortly after sunset with the rest of daylight and found the place almost deserted. But the illuminated mount and temple as well as the amazing 360° night watch were really great.We were free of charge at the evening because we wer that late but we would have spent the 20 Baht. 20 Baht here is worth the little money (compared to the horrendous 500 Baht at the crowded Palace)Cheers

I am well enough to Climb Stairs. To the top of Golden Mount, you must be prepared to climb the stairs up to the top. But take it easy, the climb is quite flat and not steep. While climbing up the form you can look around the beautiful views of Bangkok. At the top of Golden Mount there is room for Buddhist worship.

Very good at sunset. This temple is amazing if you go just befire sunset. You will avoid climbing the stairs under the sun, and you will have a beautiful view of the city with a nice orange sky. I have had the chance to go there during the festival and it was trully howesome.

Beautiful- nice views from top. 20baht to get in, 344 stairs to the top. Don't take your shoes off- AGAIN- don't take your shoes off- this is per their request. Various gongs to hit along the way. Great views of all of Bangkok from the top.

Worth the trip. Good value for money and very easy climb despite the intimidating number of stairs. Beautiful inside and great view from the top overlooking the city. Not overly populated with tourists either and less then $1.00 to enter.

great views serene location. a nice hike up the hill gets you in the mood to be introspective. at the top the mount provides great views. Also fun was the chance to ring the long line of huge brass bells - this is the tradition after you have made an offering .

Excellent!. This is a unique treasure in Bangkok...get ready to climb a few stairs, enjoy the lovely templs and take in panoramic views of Bangkok. Site is clever by offering a place to grab a cold drink with washrooms. Definitely not a site to miss and not very busy compared to many of the other spots in the area.

Peaceful place in Bangkok.. I went to the Golden Mount & it was a good thing. The entrance is 20THB & you can go up the stairs to the top. It is a great view point for the city. You can also make an offering. This is one of the few Buddhist tmeples/places where you won't have to take your shoes off. There is a few other places to visit at the Golden Mount where you can mke an offering to the Monks.

Nice Temple. It's a nice temple if you are in that area. It's not a difficult walk up the stairs and it's a worthy view from the top. Been here every time when I was in Bangkok. It's nice to escape the noisy streets and just admire the view .

The view of Bangkok is worth the climb. We arrived here on a warm and sunny day, to start with we were going to skip and move on but read a previous review that said the view is worth it and after 344 steps I had to agree the view out over Bangkok is pleasant and allowed to see a fair bit.Unfortunately a bit cloudy on the time we were up there but extremely warm and worth it. Fully recommend picking up a bottle of water half way from the cafe.
Good view if the city. Center of town attraction and possibly the most elevated structure in Bangkok apart from the high rise buildings.

A great view of the City. If you can handle the 300 steps to the top then this is a great vantage point to see the new and old parts of the city. There is a small fee and not much else to see other than the view.

A must visit. The Golden mount is a must visit. A very enchanting place. Great view from the top. There's a small coffee shop half way up. Also if you're a fireman like me, pop into the fire station next to the Wat, they're a friendly bunch and will take pride in showing you their station. No matter where you go in the world Firemen are firemen.
Lots of steps good views of Bangkok. Worth a visit if only for the city views. Entry is cheap at 20 bat. Not many people about no queues.

Much better value than the Golden Palace. For 20baht (40p) you can go up to the Golden Mount and get incredible views. I imagine that, if you went at the right time, it would be incredible to see the sun set from that height.
Walk upstairs. Walk all those way upstairs, enjoy the view and don't forget to cover your head if you visit late morning or afternoon.

Magic,. When we were there around noon we were among the very few tourist there, you could feel a certain "holy" feeling in the atmosphere. The view is amazing and it is a nice quiet little getaway from Bangkoks noise.

Dfferent and in a part of Bangkok tourists often don't visit. This temple is worth the effort it takes to get there as it's a bit off the usual tourist trails. The walk from the boat is interesting through streets where traders still sell things like house doors that they are making as you pass - no mass manufacture here!The way up to the temple is quite steep but the walk is worth the effort when you reach the top and get good views around the city.
The only hill in Bangkok. Nice view.. I climb it every year. It is a little exhausting during hot days, but the view of the city is worth it. Use canal boat to get here.

Panoramic view of the old town in Bangkok. With 20 baht, you get to have quiet and peace plus a wonderful panoramic view of old town Bangkok, also see the beautiful huge golden bell on top. Prepare to climb 300+ flight of stairs!

Nice views of Bangkok. The golden mount is not one of the premium places to see, but if you have time try and combine your visit to the Royal Palace sand Wat Pho by coming here first. The lovely tropical feel to the gardens on the climb up is very nice. I love the gentle climbing steps up to the mount. It's not a steep climb so don't worry. Also there is free wifi available at the top which is nice to take and post your images to your favourite social media site! The views over Bangkok are nice, the day I visited there was an impending torrential downpour which made it very humid but the view was great.

Not bad but not convinced of the top! . As soon as you get here and pay the 20 baht fee, it feels like it's leading to something spectacular as the walk up is pretty beautiful. The most sprays are adding to the mystique of the area as are all the long dangling vines from the trees and water features etc. Unfortunately it leads to anti climax I'm afraid. Once you reach the top you're straight into the Golden Mount temple, inside there is a big drinks stall, some golden Buddhas in the centre but not much else. There is no outdoor viewing area but you can see the view through the windows. Sad face.
Bangkok from the top. You want to have a view over Bangkok? A visit to this Wat on a small hill is then a must. Don't miss the top.
Holiday in Thailand. Major attraction in which we enjoyed and was worth a visit and all in our price of the agenda for the day, great Temple and good views of Bangkok.

Looking for a temple that has it all? This is the one!. There are with no doubt many temples in Bangkok, but for us the time was short so we could only visit one. The Golden Mount is a very beautiful temple at the top of the hill. There were of course lots of stairs, so if you have back or leg problems, this will be a hard one. But when you get at the top, besides the beautiful temple, you have a fantastic view of Bangkok which is worth the effort. So if you are a healthy person with good physics, don't miss this temple.

Golden Mount with great view of Bangkok. Mountain in Bangkok, everythink is possible in Thailand. Because it was day of Buddha, i was there for free. But still it is not expensive and you will have awesome view from there. And the atmosphere of the temple is great.
the golden mount. he Golden Mount (Wat Saket) is a major attraction that we have quite enjoyed during trips to Bangkok. The temple is worth a quick visit but the real star .

Worth the climb!. We visited the Golden Mount close to sunset, and it was great way to wrap up our day's adventures. There was a nice breeze, a great view, and an opportunity to take a break from the hustle and bustle of the city. We admired some of the details at the very top, but there is relatively little to see here compared to other locations. Even so, enjoy the experience for the peace and quiet it provides.

Climb for the View!. We enjoyed visiting Wat Saket in the evening, as the view was really lovely at sunset. This is quite a climb to get to the top, so comfortable shoes are a must. There are some interesting Buddha and other sites, but the best part is the view over Bangkok from the top. We did this with our children and they did not have any problem with the stairs and path going up.

interesting place.. There are so many temples to visit in Bangkok that you can get overtempled. A lovely building and the there is no special feature except the climb to see the view. Many of the high rise provide you with better views now. Still visit the 20 baht entry fee.
Excellent and MUST VISIT TEMPLE.. A must visit Temple. There is FREE Wi Fi at the top!!!!!" Great views and a great Temple although it caters mostly for tourists. You will enjoy this Temple.

Amazing views and cheap! . The best part of this temple is the chance to walk up the 300+ steps to see the amazing 360 views over Bangkok. It costs 20baht per person.
You can hear the gongs, see monks, ring bells. Not very touristy.
We went around 5:30pm to watch the sunset!
quick stop is ok. its a nice place to see but nothing special. The hike up is not too bad. Decent views. I'm glad I saw it as we had nothing to do at the time :)

Great temple with a great view!. Not as touristic as the Grand Palace and Wat Pho, Wat Saket is beautiful and offers amazing views of Bangkok. It's super cheap, close to the other temples and it's very peaceful!

Nice view on the top!. For some people, Wat Saket is just an ordinary temple to visit but for me the best part of this temple is you get a chance to go to the top of the temple and see Bangkok on higher level.

Fabulous view. This is really worth to see in Bangkok! You can see all the Bangkok area and the view is the most beautiful at the sunset if the sky is clear! And at the bottom of the Mount there's lots of pathways to look at. Interesting and versatile place!

Must See. Great place to visit, very spiritual, the walk to the top not so bad and great views when you get there.
This is a must visit in Bangkok.

Totally worth visiting. Wat Saket doesn't get the love that many of the other Wats get and that is unfortunate. It doesn't have some well-known buddha to draw tourists but, to me, it offers a more peaceful experience as well as this incredible 360 degree view of the city. It only cost 20 baht to enter and this involves 300+ red steps that wind up to the top. The steps are not steep and as you climb you can ring the bells along the way as well as enjoy the tone of the gongs. There is nothing fancy here but once you duck your head and climb the last steps up to the open-air top you will appreciate the effort it took to get here. The gold top with its lavender ribbon surround looks better close up than afar. Soak in the view of Bangkok from each angle, smog or no smog. Enjoy the easier journey down the steps and at the exit (different than the entrance) there is a large gong that absolutely beckons your involvement as it bellows out this wonderfully low vibrating song that will draw the attention of anyone that has passed it by. Of all the Wats i would return to in Bangkok it would be Wat Arun and Wat Saket. It is not located in such proximity that one could easily figure out public transit though there is a specific water taxi (sorry i don't know the name of it or the particular canal) on a canal directly north of Wat Saket that ultimately gets you close to the Jim Thompson House and the National Stadium BTS (Skytrain) station. Of course there are always taxis and tuk tuks.

Best Spiritual Experience . We visited many temples in Thailand, but this one was the best. Although this temple have been open for tourists, it doesn't effect its meaning as a sacred place. It was quiet, peaceful, and people still able to do their spiritual activity and it was a beautiful scene as well for me personally. Compared to the other temples which were too crowded. A bit exhausted to reach the top, but it was worth it. You can see the city view from the top of the temple.
Beautifull quiet place.. Really beautifull looking like all temples in Thailand, but not so much crowded like all of them. Very good view to the city from high point.

Wat Saket. A Temple you have to visit by going around and up the hill where it is located. The place is well looked after and it invites meditation. There is a kiosk for cool drinks and some benches to rest.

Climb, stairs, climb. If you're willing to climb a few (or maybe a lot of, depending on how fit your are) stairs, this is a good place to go. The entrance is 20thb and there is a good view at the top.

Great temple away from the masses. After going to the Grand Palace and Wat Pho, I felt like I had left Bangkok when I visited here. A lot fewer visitors and much more peaceful than most of the popular temples in Bangkok. You get a great view of the city from the top. Definitely worth a stop.

Good view from top. There is 344 steps to the top but they are not steep. Good handrail all the way. There is a coffee shop halfway and some interesting waterfalls and landscaping.There is also some seats along the way.100 B to go in.Plenty of Tuk Tuks outside

Easy walk to the top. 20b entry. Busy on the day we were there as it was an important Buddhist holy day but whilst very busy it did make it more interesting and colourful with garlands of flowers on statues etc. Not a taxing walk to the top just a pleasant incline or steps. Very good views of the city.
Great view. 50 baht and many steps to climb but worth it. Gives a great view of the city and the temple is quite nice too. Make sure to fibd the staircase to the upper level

Excellent view from the top, well worth the climb. This is a great quiet and peaceful place, even more impressive when you consider that there are no natural mounts or hills in Bangkok, it's totally flat. This mount was made by hand! Nice nature on the way upOnly tourists move around mid-day and there are very good reasons for that. Do not go mid-day... :) This attraction is best visited late afternoon for the sunset or early morning. Entrance fee is cheap, 50 baht I think it wasVery nice view indeed from the top, definitely recommended

One of the most pleasant temples . After plenty of Wats (temples) we decided to drop into this site and didn't regret. If you come there you will need to climb quite a long stair but it is worth doing. There is a nice view from up there, refreshing wind, small shop with drinks and benches to have a rest. If you want to visit caffe placed near the stairs do it on your way up because accidentally you can choose the wrong ladder for going down.
Nice view from the top. It's a little bit of a hike up to the very top but worth the view. Watch your head in some areas, it's kinda low going thru some of the stair areas.

Worth to be seen, great sights from the top. I am not really fond of temples but this place is very nice as it has really beautiful views over Bangkok. I also loves the way up which leads first through a miniature rain forest then alongplenty of bells. Lots of nice flowers and little water fountains around. Very good Coffeeshop on the way up!

Lovely views over the city. Standing underneath the mount, we were told by a local that the temple is closed. Probably was trying to distract us and send us to different place, where they get commission from. This kind of scenario happened to us few times on our trip in Bangkok. Still we decided to give it a go and walk towards the mount. No surprise, it was open. Climbing 344 steps will get you to the temple on the top, beautiful 360 degrees views of Bangkok skyline and free wifi :) definitely worth it!

Lovely spot. The site has two temples to visit and the mount. Both wat are nice enough to make this stop worth going to, add the mout makes this an excellent stop. The climb to the top of the mount is not bad at all the steps are low rise and are broken up with areas of activities or overlook that give a bit of a break on the way up. The view from the top is more than worth it. One nice addition was this sight was not over run with tour groups.

An interesting and different style of temple, close to the Panfa Pier (canal). This temple costs only 50 baht to enter. There's a lot of history to read along the entry area. There's shelter from the hot sun amongst the fernery/little waterfall area. You walk around and around the outside of the temple area (spiral), and come across huge bells, which you can ring and a super big gong at the end. Inside the temple is interesting too. A very good view from the top. Walking distance to Khao San Road....about 15-20 minutes.
Every step is worth it!. You may have to climb a series of stairs but once you get at the top, you will get to see Bangkok from above and realize that Thailand is really amazing!
Golden Mount. Lot of steps to climb, but you get to ring all the bells along the way so it's kinda fun! Get to the top and take some great scenic photos!
great view at a top. In a middle of no where...but totally worth it.You have a great view from Bangkok city, while enjoying the peaceful budha mountain.

Great spot to get an overview of Bangkok from above. Initially I really thought to skip it, because it didn't sound that impressive in reviews... however I'm glad I didn't! This place is really, really amazing and nicely design from bottom (with a lot of tropical vegetation), continuing with the way to the top (nicely decorated with Thailand motives, including bells and gongs). The overview from the top is overwhelming and you can easily spot the difference between Bangkok neighborhoods. Best time to go there is on sunset (around 6 PM o'clock).

Amazing View. The Golden Mount as name suggests is a mountain. A small one but with breathtaking view. They have made small small temples of the surrounding areas so you dont hear noise of cars, or people. Just wonderful silence.
