1,2, 3, ...346 steps!. After visiting Wat Po, I took a tuktuk to visit this temple. Entrance fee is only 20 baht per person. Sign at the entrance says 346 steps!1. Steps are not high, one can do 2 steps at a time.2. There are. 2 rest areas along the way: one has a coffee shop and toilets; the other one has big bench to sit down and several big bells to ring. 3. Top floor - confusion whether to take one's shoes or not.A taped oral announcement says to take off shoes, another announcement says otherwise.4. There are 3 buddha shrines for praying. Views of downtown Bangkok is beautiful at the top. It is cool there, with some breeze and air con.5. Descent is quicker. Take the short cut near the second rest area for faster way of going down. Toilets are located at the end of the descent.Tips: Enjoy the street foods offered by vendors. I bought 2 items in sticks, very delicious for only 20 bahts each.Walk back from this wat back to Khaosan Road and visit other attractions along the way such as the fort, wat llsa. (?), gardens, and Democracy Monument.

A must!. I loved visiting this place. Super cheap at only 20THB and worth every penny and more. This attraction provides views of all the city and is fun climbing to the top. One of my favourite places to visit in Bangkok.

Climb to the top for a great view over Bangkok. We started out one morning with a visit to Wat Saket. The temple sits atop a hill in Bangkok, accessed by a set of stairs winding around the hill, with large prayer bells along the route. While it isn't the oldest or most impressive temple, it is worth the climb for the view.

Spectacular views once you climb the 300 steps. Well worth a visit if you can face the long climb up of 300+ steps. It's broken down into sections so you can rest at intervals on the way up and down.Many bells line the path producing a cacophony of sound during busy periods. Once the summit is reached there is opportunity to buy souvenirs or drinks and take panoramic photos of the city if it is a clear day.

Be prepared to walk to the top for a great view. This temple has a great view from the top but it's a climb, there is a cafe through about 3/4s the way up where you can grab a coffee or cool drink well worth the climb for the view.

Not to be missed!!!. We hadn't planned to visit this temple but are so glad we did. While the other temples are more decorated, this feels like a real experience. The climb is gradual and you get to ring numerous bells and gongs along the way. The view from the top is totally worth it as well. Highly highly recommended.

Really wonderful. We didnt have much time left to spend there but walked all the way up and enjoyed the views and the many bells and sounds. Its a lovely place to relax with waterfalls and plants and birds singing. From the top you have a nice view over the city and the air is cool and windy. It wasnt that busy which was also a plus as I got a bit nervous about all these huge asian tourist groups. Go see it, you will like it!
Peaceful and Wonderful. Another beautiful temple in Thailand. When you reach up and entering the temple, you will feel different vibe. So amazing!

Excellent views from the top and even a cool breeze can be enjoyed. After walking from the pier there it was in all it's glory. Truly lovely. The walk up to the top was a bit steep for oldies but quite do-able and the breeze standing by the chedi? was lovely. Really glad we made the effort.

VISIT IN THE MORNING. We went recently again with family members visiting us in Bangkok. On a sunny morning day around 10 o'clock, there were few tourists and we could enjoy the mixture of a Thai Buddhist temple with the enjoyable and interesting walk up to the temple proper and down through elements of Chinese mythology as well as Buddhist religious symbols.There is a good 360° view on Bangkok from the top terrace encircling the Chedi.

The way is the destination. This temple is located at walking distance from the terminal station of Saen Saep Khlong boat line. The ascent through a long stairway is a little bit arduous, but beautiful. On the way up you will see a lot of Antique Bhuddhas, small waterfalls, old trees etc.. From the top you will have a nice view over the old city and its main attractions. On some special events the temple is also open in the evening providing an even more impressing view.
Another Day another Temple. Another beautiful temple in Thailand. There are no shortage of temples to see in this country but this one is worth seeing.
Wonderful. There are so many great places to visit in Thailand. These statues were one of the best visits I did. Highly recommended for art lovers.

A Highlight of my Trip to Bangkok. I had been wanting to visit this temple for some time now, and when i arrived very early one morning on my recent trip to Bangkok, i was not dissapointed. This is a truly beautiful temple, and i was treated to the Monks chanting, which i found to be a wonderful experience. The Monk's were also very friendly and posed for photographs. I will return to this temple next trip, as it was really one of the most beautiful and interesting temples i have been to in Thailand.
bring lots of water, it's a long climb up and down. Great view of the city from the top of this mount. Worth the climb. Ring the bells along the way. Recommended!

Amazing view!. Golden Mount is the perfect place to go if you want to see Bangkok from high up for miles! Temple's, monuments, buildings, and city!city!city! The view from the top is incredible along with neat, beautiful statues and shrines on the way up. Totally recommended for a great sunset view! :)
Worth every Baht. She was having her feet done when I visited but there was still plenty of her to see. Impressive to say the least. A definate must see if in Bangkok

A wonderful respite in the city. The temple is simple but beautiful, and climbing up while ringing the bells was both a spiritual and unique experience. You certainly don't have to be Buddhist to visit, but if you are, you will get a lot more out of it. Regardless, the view at the top is great and it's worth a visit either way.
Nice view. This wat is the crown of Bangkok. It was not very crowded when we were there. Just down the street on Baan Bat you can see men making amulet bowls in the ancient way.

Great view from the top. I visited the Golden Mount as part of an Intrepid Urban Adventure so had my own private guide to explain the history and cultural significance of this site. It is an easy climb up 344 stairs to the top where you will be rewarded with views around Bangkok and free Wi-Fi.....

Great View. I've been here a couple times. It is a nice place to visit if you don't mind some steps because you really need to go to the top to take in the view of the city. There are a few tours that will take you there, but it's best to just catch a taxi as it's centrally located and won't cost that much. Just don't bother telling the driver to take you to the "Golden Mount" as he will not understand. Tell the driver Wat Saket and he'll take you right there!

Great place to end your day of touring in Bangkok. We had toured all day with Mandy Smile tours (separate review) and ended up here last. This place is a great way to end your day, with a beautiful and panoramic view of the city from atop the mount. It's quite a bit of stairs walking up, so not for the fragile needing assistance, but the view is so rewarding from the top.
Great view of the area. Always head for the Golden Mount at some point when visiting Bangkok. Great views of the area & very chillled

No other Wat or temple like it. If you can hike all the steps as you circle around it and you like interacting on the temple scene then this is for you. It is about 354 steps. You have plenty of bells, gongs, and chimes to ring. Unique buddhas at the top with unique view points of them. Great views on the top. If you are in the city but east of it, and near the Khlong (Canal) Mahanak, say in the Phetchaburi area, you can take the water ferry at say Asoke Pier and go all the way to the end, to Tha Phanfa Lilat, with one free boat transfer, and then go out to the bridge, cross it and go down to the Golden Mount Temple, just a few blocks along Boriphat Rd. You hike down via another stair case, with has vulture statues relaying a sad tale of past cholera outbreaks in the city long ago.

Lovely Wat (temple) on a mount in Ratanakosin. This temple is unusual in that it is sits on a small mound at a busy interchange and the view from the top is wonderful. Good to visit in the late afternoon close to sunset.
It's okey. Just another Buddha tempel, sure nice walk up and a great view over Bangkok if the sky is clear. Anyway just do it otherwise you will regret that you did not make a visit.

Watch out for the vultures!. ALTHOUGH I have been to Bangkok many times this was my first visit to the Golden Mount or Wat Saket as it is known.I was staying in Sukhumvit so I hailed a tuk tuk and then just sat back and enjoyed the ride to the Mount for 200 baht or about £4, watching all the traffic chaos and sights along the way.You need to be on your toes when you arrive since drop-off points for taxis and tuk tuks can be away from the main ascent of 350+ steps which is awkward because steps are not very wide.Entry is free but you get a shock very early on when you reach a display showing a group of vultures eating a human corpse! This is actually a bit of a history lesson about times gone by when bodies were laid out for consumption by vultures in order to clear up the dead and prevent the spread of disease. Still quite a startling sight to come across. Not your usual statuary!I followed the steps up circling the mount, birds calling sharply in the trees below, and eventually reached the top where there were various prayer points, stalls for offerings and a few souvenirs.Climbing up to the very top, I stepped out on to a square terrace with various statues where I learnt that the Mount was ordered built by King Rama III and was completed under the guidance of King Rama IV and King Rama V.The views over the nearby city were good although conditions were a little cloudy and hazy.The descent also allowed more appreciation of my wider surroundings since I’d really focussed on the steps during my climb up.Back at the bottom I browsed a few stalls and then realised I’d made a big mistake. I’d paid off my tuk tuk driver and had the devil’s own job finding another. Anyone visiting the Golden Mount might do well to negotiate their tuk tuk driver waiting an hour for them since the climb up only took about 15 minutes and the climb down about the same leaving half an hour to stroll round on top. An hour is plenty for what is here.Also, those visiting can move to the right of the entrance and find public toilets there which are best used before starting the climb up. They were clean and well looked after when I was there.
Nice view. And for free.. Second time in Bangkok, second time visiting the temple. When you climb the stairs it offers you a nice view over the city. Loved the bells all over the place!

Great place if you go in the evening.. I was here in the evening and it provided a good panoramic view of Bangkok. I would only recommend this place in the evening since there aren't many place with shades. It isn't difficult and the steps aren't wide and easy. There wasn't a lot of tourists here unlike the grand palace, so you get to take your time and enjoy the night breeze.

A Man-Made Mountain in the Middle of the City. A relatively easy 350 stair climb to the top of a man-made mountain offering a great view of Bangkok - on a clear day - with several items (Buddhas, bells, statues) to see along the hike.

Beautiful site, few tourists. A friend who lives in Bangkok took me to Wat Saket. It's part of his standard tour for friends and family visiting from the US. It's a beautiful site with good vistas of the city from the hill. There are also remarkably few tourists there. It was a great visit.

Fun outing with a boat trip up the khlong to get there. The walk to the top was pretty easy - my 2 year old insisted on doing the whole walk up and down by herself with no trouble. We didn't stay long but really enjoyed it as a tourist outing with friends who had done most of the BKK attractions already. We caught the chilling boat from Wireless Road which added a little adventure to the trip - definitely easy if you have at least as many adults as kids as it's pretty hairy getting on and off the boat!

Great experience with a great view. This is a great place to visit. It has a 20 Baht entry fee but well worth it. There is a good 350 odd stairs to climb but has flat areas which breaks the stairs up. Half way up there is a shop/café which is reasonable priced. At the top there is panoramic views of the city which is breathtaking and they even have free Wi-Fi at the top. Fantastic statues, gongs which you can strum and waterfalls make up this mount. I found this to be one of the better attractions in Bangkok. It is in a good, central location too with lots of other attractions nearby too.

Very good view of the city.. You can take a taxi to go to the Wat Saket and to return take the boat service (Khlong Saen Saep) to Siam Area. The boat service pier is very near the War Saket , is very cheap and you can get back to Siam area (Pratunam Pier) in a very unusual transportation.
A top temple. Thailand has approximately 250 temples so it's important to narrow the list down. This is highly recommended for it's many individual statues of Buddha.

Great exercise, great view. The climb of 344 steps to the top is quite a bit of exercise, but one can go slowly and enjoy the beautiful garden on the way to the top. Great views of the city from up there.
view. You can climb, you can see the city. You make fortune. The outdoor stairs are air-con. It is odd. I like it.

Beautiful scenery from the temple. A beautiful temple but have to climb up lots of staircase to reach the temple. However, there was a cafe half way, so can take a break before continuing with the climbing. Once on top, we got a nice view of the surrounding areas..

Good views of Bangkok.. Good place to visit on your first day in Bangkok as you get a very good view of the city.
There is quite a few steps to go up so make sure you are hydrated and have comfortable shoes.
You may enjoy the Wifi at the top and upload some of the pictures from your trip.

Worth the quick climb. About 350 steps will get you to the tip top of this man made mount. Mostly very small steps, actually. The entire grounds, gardens, and adjacent temple are all serene and lovely. I think entry was only 20 baht. After a few steps, there is a cafe for cold water, and they sell those refreshing, cold, scented washcloths to wipe the day's grime off your face and neck before proceeding.  Along the way you pass a small waterfall and many bells you can ring to announce your arrival. Before you know it, you are in a breezy shrine, there are a few more steps in the corner to get to the very top. There you are rewarded with a great view of old and new Bangkok. There is a huge spire and it is a holy place. Imagine my happy surprise to see they had free wifi up there! So I skyped with family from this amazing place.  It felt like an oasis, and a bit of a pilgrimage. Worth the visit.

Great temple with nice view . If you are looking to visit some temples this temple should be great one of them because convenient to visit and nice View on top. Not great only for tourists local people too! Just 20 baht to entry for foreigner. Check out!

Great for an afternoon trip with a nice view of Bangkok . After visiting dozens of temples in Thailand, I think I can say this is one of the nicest ones in Bangkok. The main reason is of course the great view of Bangkok and the unique structure of the temple on top of this small hill in the middle of the old part of the city. However this is also not a typical Thai temple and it has adapted clearly to the needs of tourists. Nevertheless a great place for a half-day visit especially, if you stay around Khao San Road.

Nothing really special. If you're in the area and not really tired - go for it.Things you can see:1. there's a coffee shop midpoint of your climb2. panoramic view3. bells4. on the top there's a small shrine and these old thai tradition where there's a cup with sticks and you shake it and your fortune comes out (did that make sense?) hahaoverall, if you want touristy destinations this can be skipped. ps. i like touristy stuff

Beautiful temple worth seeing.. Get there by river taxi and then hop on a tuc tuc to get to this beautiful temple, called the Golden Mount. Wonderful views from the top. Easy walk up, not hard at all.

Not to be Missed!. I decided to visit this Wat at the last minute and glad I did. There was so much to see. There is a beautiful view from the top. There are many steps to the top but the steps aren't steep. Manageable for those who aren't physically challenged. Inside, off to the corner you can get your own so called astrology reading by shaking the bamboo container filled with 31 sticks until a stick falls out. Read the number on the stick (mine was #22) and look on the wall for the number that matches. My reading was very accurate. You can walk to the top for a better view. What's interesting is that above the big gong, there is a sign advising you there is free WiFi with a password posted. You can even send a selfie to your friends.I loved the walk down to the bottom as there were bells of all different sizes and shapes that you can ring. Some had a very different tone from others. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit here. I visited on a day where admission was free. I was told it was Buddhist Day.

Golden Mount, Bangkok. I came upon this by accident near where I'm staying. You are warned that there are 344 steps up to the top, but the steps are quite low and it isn't in fact a very arduous climb. However, there is a splendid view at the top over 360 degrees of Bangkok. The entrance fee is 20 baht - small enough not to be a problem for most. There is a large golden structure at the top, but the main value is for the view rather than the buildings - there are plenty of temples nearby if that's what you want to see.

Simply amazing. This place stands out elevated over the city. Very beautiful, especially at night when it is lit up and shines in the dark. Amazing view of the city. I paid only 20 baht to get in. For me this is a must place in Bangkok.

My Bangkok highlight!. We went about 9.30am with a guide, which meant a) it was still fairly cool at the top, and b) we had the place almost to ourselves - just us, three Thai school girls and two Buddhist monks at summit! Definitely the time to go.Great views over the city, chance to ring the bells on the way up, and strike the "drum"/cymbal three times too (to ask your ancestors for peace, health and happiness respectively, I believe), up close view of various statues and the buddhas for offerings of gold leaf at the entrance to the summit, and then the spectacular bell-shaped, gold summit itself.A very peaceful, spiritual atmosphere, as you'd perhaps expect from a working temple. If you only visit one temple in Thailand, make it this one.
Wonderful. This is one of my favourite places in Bangkok, wonderful grounds and very rewarding views at the top of all the steps. It is worth the (very moderate) effort of going all the way up!

High elevated buddha . It's a high elevate buddha in Bangkok and you can look around it when you goes on top elevation.It has 365 short step to accessing top of construction.There are restaurant ,coffee shop ,survivor shops .In top elevation there is some point to free wifi .It has good view to Bangkok and river.
The View!. Loads of stairs to the amazing view on Bangkok. Smaller than other temples, less people and 360´degrees view. Nice to sit on the top and just chilaxing and enjoying for a while
NIce view. A good place to spend an hour or so. The view is really amazing and it is cheap so I recommend it. :)))

Worth the climb!. A great way to see the city from a lower elevation than Vertigo/Moon Bar but still quite impressive - you get a much better appreciation, and view, of the older parts of Bangkok. Not too tiring, even under the hot sun, but it might be slippery during/after rain - there are warnings to that effect on the steps. One can buy refreshments at the top gallery, and can climb an extra level for open-air views. Wifi works fine from the top - can easily send photos/videos on WhatsApp. Do not miss the "sacred vulture" display on the way down from the top - a right turn just before the final row of bells- maybe not for the squeamish, but historically accurate.
OK to visit when you are nearby. The climb up the 344 steps is challenging when it is hot and humid. Some nice vice along the route but the small temple at the top was unimpressive.

good view of the city. its not far away from city center and the stairs are easy to climb. you will have good view of the city.
ticket price is also cheaper than other atractions.

Impressive temple and collection of artifacts. A really interesting attraction in Bangkok, totally worth a few hours of your time. Cheap entry too and very pleasant to wander around, even if you're not exactly sure what is what.
Nice. This is very beautiful and nice. My husband not really into history sights but i found this interesting.

Great place to visit. go up on 344 steps ( not stairs :D)
on the top there is a temple, and n the right corner there are the stairs up to the chedi...amazing view, and really great experience.

Definitely worth a visit for the great views of Bangkok!. Wat Saket is an artificial hill, build by people, with great views for the whole Bangkok. The temple is not interesting (modern one, with plastic Buddha), but for the great views I would say it is a must see place! Near the Wat Saket there is a stop of the water tram – you can have a great canal trip for the low price (tickets sold at the boat).

Its a highpoint of Bangkok - literally. Wat Saket needs to be on the "to do" list of your visit. Go in the evening when the crowds are less and the lights of teh city start to come on. Quite a sight to see. Lots of stairs to climb but well worth it for the views. After you can pop over to either Kao San road or China town for dinner. Have fun!

Very atmospheric. You enter the temple by circling around and gradually ascending. Puffs of mist swirl into the air and cooling the air. There is vegetation on both sides and statues. Along the way there are many bells to be rung and gongs to be sounded 3 times each.The temple itself is awash with flakes of gold leaf that have detached themselves from the statues, where they have been placed by the petitioners. All around, the views of Bangkok are stunning. There is lots of birdsong and a nice little bar which serves coffee and juices.This is a very nice temple.

Go at sunset.. Last entrance is at 5:30 so go just before that. Don't worry about the steps, over 300 but not steep so not difficult (I've had knee surgery and all okay). Go to the top and wait for sunset. It's beautiful and you will get great pictures. There's even wifi at the top although I'm not too sure how I feel about that?!
Good. This is one of the many temples here.A beautiful temple.This temple is quite old compared to the other ones around here.

Peaceful. I found this temple peaceful and relaxing compared to the others we visited.Don't let the stairs scare you, they are made in a way that are simple to climb and there are stations to relax before continuing to climb to the top. As you climb there is a mist that keeps you cool.

so lovely. So lovely, so huge!the day we went even other monks were sightseeing there! (maybe monks fromanother country and their family). I enjoyed watching their excitement. I, myself am always in awe when I enter any Wat.The walk was nice. the steps short. Towards the journey up, there's a cafe and also more drinks, Ice cream, etc. towards the top.
If you're a buddhist you should come. I've been there when I was quite young to pay the respect of this temple and you can see the birds eye view of Bangkok

great experience. It was great to have this experience together. We were looking for this Place nearly the whole morning by feet. And then hat to climb the over three hundred steps to the top. But we enjoyed it and had a lot of fun. The sight on the roof top was great. If you are in Bangkok you have to visit tis golden mount.

Wonderful views all around. If the sky is (relatively) clear, make your way here about an hour or so before sunset. Sure the view of Bangkok is nice, but it's just as wonderful to see the glow of the evening sun off the golden chedi.

Good Views, Temple is Touristy. It's a hot, sweaty climb to the top, but the views are pretty good. However, the temple leaves a little to be desired in my opinion when compared to the others you could see in Bangkok. I wasn't that impressed but the view was worth it.

Special place with great views of Bangkok. This is worth experiencing as it is a very revered temple. The walk up the steps is very nice as the views change as you circle the temple. You can see much of Bangkok from the top of the temple. It is a little hard to get to; take the Skytrain to National Stadium and a taxi from there. Bring a map to show the driver.

Beyond expectation. This spot was one of the best we visited. It was very pleasant walk up to the hill. The entrance fee was also very cheap. I had the best cappuccino in the cafe there. Try it if you go there
Beautiful . Lovely place to go and visit whilst in Bangkok, we went to the top with a group of friends to watch the sunset which was beautiful, only a short 10 minute walk to the top!
The temple!!!. we visit all places which one of the tourist attraction...if you plan to Bangkok you need to see the Golden templ

344 steps (mini ones). Follow the path between the bells and small statues to the top for a lovely view.
It's not a tough climb up the stairs, they're only about 4" tall.

Great view of the city from here. We liked visiting this Wat. It's a peaceful complex to walk around and the walk up is not bad. Not quite halfway up, there's a small coffee shop. Once at the top, you have a great view of the city. Inside, the Wat is pretty small, so don't expect to be totally vowed like others in the area. For us the walk and view was what we liked. My girls enjoyed it and didn't complain about the climb.

Nice walk and view of Bangkok. We enjoyed the path up to this temple which was filled with bells, lush trees, and dragonflies. The temple at the top offers a nice 360-degree view of Bangkok, and the golden temple at the top is quite a sight. We accidentally participated in a ceremony that was happening at the top, involving flower arrangements and a sash that was draped over the tower. It was a nice experience and both the monks and other people were quite friendly.If you're coming from Jim Thompson house and want to visit Wat Saket, take the river taxi! From Jim Thompson house, walk east along the river until you get to the first little dock. It's super cheap and goes directly between these two spots.

Touristic atmosphere. If you go to Bgk you will probably decide to visit this site, since it's quite an important temple. And it's ok, on a touristic point of view. But if you are looking for a true, spiritual atmosphere, this temple will probably disappoint you, with tourists coming and going and hardly stopping with respect in front of the buddhas (you are even required NOT to get rid of your shoes!!!). The sight on Bangkok from the top is amazing, so this is a good reason to face the 330 steps to the top.

Something about this temple. Not the most spectacular of temples but this place has a nice calmness about it. Although a lot of steps they are small ones and it very easy to get to the top with a lot of shaded areas on the way up so you are not in the blazing sun the whole time. Best way to reach it is by the local canal boats.
Good views. It was a nice walk up to the top of the Mount to see the layout of the city. Other than the view, the top wasn't that exciting.

Decent attraction, great view. The Golden mount is situated exactly 344 steps up a hill and offers a good bird's eye view of Bangkok.The attraction itself has two parts, a shrine at the end of the steps, and a big dome on the roof. Both are equally important from a religious view.

A "Must Do" on your Bangkok Itinerary!!. We visited the Golden Mount on our last day in Thailand. After 2 weeks (and many visits to temples!!!!) we would rate this as possibly our favourite temple in Thailand. We visited with young children and it was interesting for them to ring the bells as we slowly made our way up the 300 steps to the top of the temple. Spectacular views over Bangkok from the top of the temple and far less crowded than many of the other Bangkok attractions we visited. Low entrance fee was also a bonus. A "must do" on your Bangkok Itinerary!!!

Good Temple to Visit . You can see the view of Bangkok from the top of the Golden Mount. It is good if you go early in the morning so it is not too sunny. The temple is more than 100 years old. Very historical buddhist place. It is good to pray for the good luck and safe trip for your journey. You are required to ware a proper dress to the temple. No shorts or mini skirt. Sleeveless shirts considered inappropriated.

Go for the view. We went during the early morning and the city was just waking up. It is a little gem which not too many tourists get to see. There are many steps to climb so its not for the faint-hearted but it is really worth the trek. It is a buddhist shrine with gongs and bells along the way and also shady trees and man-made water features along the climb.
Good views, but poor European interpretation.. I really liked this shrine, but it lacked some interpretation for Europeans. Super views over the city. Busy on a Sunday.
gfabulous. Very ornate with loads to see and great photographic opportunities. Inside really quiet, serene and relaxing. We spent an hour their. Lots of tourists alongside Thais. We loved it
underrated temple, great views. it is a bit hard to reach but once you got there you will be pleased that there are not too many tourists. the view of the city from this temple is nice.

a beautiful view and a serene atmosphere. You have to climb some stairs, but it is not difficult. and than: bells, bells, bells. the wind blows through the small flags and the little bells are clinging softly. a beautiful view over Bangkok.

worth a visit. I've been in Thailand in 2010 but there was not enough time to see everything. So this time I wanted to see this place really badly. And it was so worth it to come back to Bkk and visit this place. Amazing, peaceful, with lovely views on the city.
Well worth the climb. A very interesting and less crowded temple in Bangkok. The views from the top are well worth the climb. A spiritual experience even for a non Buddhist.
Peaceful and Worth the Climb. Lovely temple with a great view of the city. I like the cooling mist as we climbed and ringing the different bells was fun.

If you don't visit the golden mount you would be sad. I don’t write reviews often, but when I visited the golden mount, also known as wat Saket. I felt strongly that I should mention that the golden mount is free to enter for thai people, but 20 baht for tourists. The #1 thing you absolutely must know about the golden mount is that the scenery is very beautiful at the top so be sure to bring a camera.If you like temples,beautiful sceneries or thai attractions then you will love this place.In case you are hungry on the way to top of the temple you would pass by a café called”Golden mount café”. This temple isn’t like an ordinary temple because of the miracles that happens here.The miracle that happens to me is when I let my aunt took a photo of me with the top of the temple, there is a green light.I know that people would think that it’s just the iphone’s case reflection, but it’s not. My aunt’s iphone case has a turquoise color but the light is bright green, who knows maybe it’s the gods that came here to pray too. I would definitely visit the golden mount again who knows maybe there would have more miracles happening.

Absolutely Beautiful. We saw a photo of it and knew we had to go there. It was a great walk up there, the view at the top was amazing. You could see the whole of Bangkok from there and there was barely anyone there too. It was a really relaxing visit.

Nice Scenery. Worth the walk of 344 steps up to the top. Easy walk with steps and along the way there is mist spraying to cool the temperature. Entrance fee at 20Baht. You will get nice scenery from the top of the temple. Able to get there by the river taxi that the local use. Stop at PhanFa Leelard pier, once exit the pier, turn left and left. You will see the temple and just walk straight to your destination.

Nice temple and a great view. Be sure to bring you camera to capture the view from the top. You might also want to bring a bottle of water because even on a not so hot day in Bangkok you might find it hot getting to the top. But it is well worth it as the view is great.The entrance is a few Bath for foreigners and free for Thais.Deepening on where you start form the boat on Saen Saep might be a good way to get there.

Nice attraction to see on a free half-day. We were able to get there using a taxi-metered. At first, you can see all the vegetation around. Which is good since you are still in the middle of a huge city. Getting all the way up is a not effortless but accessible for most people. Once on top, make sure you can access that hidden little stair to really get on the top. Stunning view of Bangkok is up there.
Stunning to say the least!. A sublime looking Wat (Temple) and fairly easy to access. I had a good view from my hotel on Khao San road!
Great view of the city. Nice climb to the hilltop and views over Bangkok. I liked the arrays of bells on the way up. Don't forget to right both gongs when you are at the terrace :)

Great views of Old Bangkok. We visited towards the end of the day which probably is a good thing as the 320 steps to the top could prove quite taxing during the mid-day sun. Access by canal boat is easy and cheap max 20baht. Get off at the turnaround point (Phanfa Bridge) and walk down past the fire station and the Golden Mount is on your left. Admission 20 baht closes at 5.30pm whilst there bare in mind that all of the items you purchase at the top have to be carried up by hand.

Must Place to Visit to take blessings with Panoramic Views. We went on 1st January and it was way too crowded. Its easy to reach there by Taxi Boat Near Jim Thompson House. Last Station of Taxi Boat is Wat Saket only.Ticket Price of 20 B is reasonable and they have cooling system throughout on the way up to Golden Mount. I didnt went to Grand Palace but did went to Wat Pho and found Wat Saket is a better place.
A must not miss sight. Not only is the temple [wat] itself very impressive, but the view from the top level is worth every step of the climb. Try to go near closing as sun is setting in the west.

Bird's Eye View of Bangkok city. There are 344 steps, but each step is not so high so it is easy to walk. A few steps from the ticket booth there is a coffee place, and it is a neat place, and worthy especially if you walked to reach this place, and I can find my fave drink in Thailand - the famous Thai iced tea. Dont forget to find the small staircases that will lead you to the roof to see the Bangkok view. If you are in need of a free wifi, find the big gong and there is a wifi password :). Yeap, the wifi is working pretty good.
Nice place to visit. I traveled in December, it was really hot. But they gave a water cooling system though out and was very refreshing. Good food for reasonable price.
Panoramic Vews. This is a great way to take in all of Bangkok with 360 degree panoramic, unobstructed views of the city. Just make sure you are careful traversing the 344 steps to the top.
Loved the hike up. Little bit of a hike but beautiful views and lovely place to just sit and relax. It is hot anytime you go so get ready to break a sweat walking uphill.

What a nice place!. The Golden Mount at Wat Saket is a very beautiful and peaceful place. You have to go there in the afternoon and see the sun come down! The view is stunning! We spent more time than we wanted.

Worth to visit, not too crowded !. If you dont wanna go to the crowded temples with many tourists, come to this place. As you climb to the 318 stairs, you can see the panoramic view of Bangkok.
And from the top level you can instantly upload you picture to the social media, cause they provide free wifi ;)

Why? Why? Why?. This was without a doubt the most disappointing visit in Bangkok. One overpaid taxi later (he took us around in circles on purpose) this is as underwhelming as underwhelming gets. You go up the stairs, see a few Buddhas, and then go back down. Not that in and of itself it is not pretty. There are just other sites in Bangkok worth more the effort and time.

Walking distance of khao san. The top gives a great view of the city. The entrance is 20 baht. It is suitable for kids. When you finished the rounds around the mountain. Enter the shop and go direct right. You will find a small stairs that is easy to overlook. The stairs will bring you to the absoluut top of the mountain. Watch your head when you go up ;)

Panoramic View of Bangkok. This provided me the sacred atmosphere I was looking for in other temples I visited in Thailand. You climb several steps on your way to the temple and experience many interesting sights on the way: statues of dieties and animals, man made smoke amidst the greenery and stairs which makes for nice photos, and bells of different sizes. When you reach the highest portion, you can see Bangkok cityscape. Prayers by monks are heard over the microphone as you approach the peak (there is free wifi at the peak). Overall a wonderful experience, and all for 10 Baht entrance fee.

Great view and nice athmosphere. 344 steps to the top and the climb is worth it. On your Way up you will see hundreds of bells hanging. In the Middle is a coffee Shop to rest and on the top the view is just breathtaking.

Nice hilltop view. Took a local boat for 10 baht/pax from Hua Chiang pier (near to Hua Chiang Heritage Hotel) to this final stop. A slow stroll up the hill is simply relaxing, a good bird-eye view of Bangkok city from this beautiful temple.

worth the walk up the steps. A charming place situated on the top of a hill. There are a few hundred steps to overcome on the walk up/down but they were not a problem.You hear chimes&bells ringing during your visit-the visitors ring them to give them goog luck.If you see a toilet sign on the way down,don't follow it!!!!! It leads all the way down to the exit!!!!! My girlfriend used it and had to walk all the way back up to me to collect me!!Also,as with most Thai toilets,there is no tissue,so have some handy somewhere

The Golden Mount is worth a visit. Have a níce and relaxing walk uphill to this temple. On the way to the top, there are plenty to see, and good photopportunities. It is more easy to walk up, than you might expect, and probably nice for younger children too.The temple itself is nice, many buddhists will probably John you, and there is of course a skylineview, that is actually better seen elsewhere, but nice anyway.
must do. a nice Little walk up the stairs brings you a great view over bangkog as well as an beautiful temple

Worth the climb for the view. We visited on a festival day so as a bonus entry was free and there was a fair at the bottom. Fantastic 360 view of Bangkok from the top. It's not normally wrapped in a red cloth at the top.

Great. Worth the 360 plus step to climb it.
Views from the top spectacular and worth it.
Ring the bells in the way up or down and bang the drum 3 times for luck.

Getaway in city center with nice lookout. Just a few minutes away from Khao San road, this temple offers peace and serenity during the visit. Furthermore, once you are at the top, you get a great 360 degree view from the town :)
Worth going

A beautiful must see temple in Bangkok. It has been one of my favorite temple in Bangkok cause of a sort of magic atmosphere that I felt in there.
The 360 degree view on the top is fantastic and the sound of the bells is really touching.
I recommend to visit it!

Beautiful cityscape views. Ideally try go up just before sunset, we were a little late but the night time views of the city were still great.
Short walk up a staircase spiralling around the outside gets you to experience an elevated view of old Bangkok.
Open at night.
Beautiful, compact and interesting. Wasn't crowded, more interesting than the Grand Palace and only 20 THB. Lot's of nice photo opportunities. What more do you want?
A must visit when in the city. The day I walked up there were very few tourists. The view of the city from the top. Fabulous facility and you do not have to take off your shoes to go in.

Budget tourist attraction . It's a good location for a 360 degree view of Bangkok, not like there is much to see, apart from a typical city skyline. Temple at the top of the hill is small and is packed with tourists and worshipers. There is nothing really special to see inside of the temple either. However, it is a cheap way to waste an hour between other attractions in the area.
An excellent stop on your tour. This is one of the better temples in Bangkok. Lots of gold, clean, full of tourists. A nice place to spend some time. CLose to other attractions. Well worth a visit.

Happy feet after 318 steps to get the top for an amazing 360 degrees panoramic view.. Wat Saket Ratcha Wora Maha Wihan (usually shortened to Wat Saket) is popularly known as the ancient Buddhist temple (Wat), the Temple of the Golden Mount, or 'Phu Khao Thong', on the Rattanakosin Island, in the heart of Bangkok, near the Grand Palace. It is one of the beautiful attractions of the capital: a low man-made hill inside the Wat, constructed under King Rama III (1824-51), completed and crowned with a gleaming gold Sri Lankan-style chedi in the reign of King Rama IV to contain the Indian relics of the Lord Buddha. It is absolutely a thing to do, or better say to do not miss it! There are 318 steps from downstairs to the top. Yes, you did get right: stairs, but when you stop your feet on the last step you will not feel tired after you did rise all of it and you will forget it in a blink of your eyes to make clear and believable 100 percent your sight, turning round 360 degrees your head and enjoying an amazing panoramic view with a fresh wind, avoiding to take pictures as many real travelers and locals do, because it is a sacred destination. Bangkok Post officially recommends to visit this beautiful place, especially during the period from last week of October to mid-November, when there is an annual fair held on the 12th lunar month, for a period of nine days of full moon. Yes, unbelievable, maybe you saw some photos with a cloth colored as the monk's robe and placed around the Golden Mount. At that time the temple grounds hosts Thai traditional theatre, there are food stalls and happen some shows.
Beautifull temple. Nice temple and nice view from that for all city. The best view in the evening. One from the top atraction in Bangkok what you have to see

Amazing temple. I loved The Golden Mount. It was a beautiful temple and so cool to see 360 degree views of the city. There are quite a few steps but definitely not enough to deter anyone. Also the steps are small so kids could definitely climb up this. I would recommend going in the morning when it isn't stifling hot. Definitely one to visit to see amazing views of the city. There is a small entry fee- I think it was only 20 baht.
a must when in bangkok.... thinking of what's so special about a man made mount quite new... is a good opportunity to travel via klong public speedboats... and stunning view over bangkok...
Good!. I usually come here when there are monks praying and singing and I think when they are this place is magic!

Golden Mount. One of the most well kept temples in BKK. Enjoy the short hike up the winding steps, while observing the many trees and plants, like walking through a jungle. Along the way are images and posts telling some of the history of the temple. The view from the top is very beautiful and the auspicious relics and images are wonderful. Not to be missed if you are in BKK.

The view is great. The temple is regular. It`s a small hill in the middle of flat Bangkok, so it is amazing location to check the city from above, but the temple itself has nothing much to amaze. I personnaly think it worth the trip, even more if you are located close to Khao San Road, so you can ask for directions and take walk to Golden Mountain...it`s an opportunity to check city life going on for locals

Temple on a (man-made) hill. The Golden Mount is a plain temple on top of a mound. There is little special about the temple itself but it does have a great view over the city. However, you may need a map to pick out other sites.
small temple that should be on you list. cost 20 baht per person to climb over 300 steps and see the Bangkok panoramic from the top of the temple, really enjoyed this one!

Prettiest View in Bangkok. Easily accessible and an easy climb mostly in the shade, the Golden Mount makes a delightful interlude from the general Wat grind of Bangkok. Ring rhe bells, enjoy the lush foliage below, lsten to the birds, and admire the amazing view of the central city from the rooftop. At 20 baht it is a super bargain

Beautiful 360 of the City. Be prepared for a bit of a climb since you can only get up top by the circular staircase. Ring all the bells on the first part of the way up. Its amazing how good you feel making all that noise! Take a slow walk up and enjoy the many things to see. At the top there's lots to explore and you cant take enough pictures!

Worth the climb!. The owner of Tealicious restaurant recommended we go here for a view of the city and it did not disappoint! The 300+stairs weren't too bad as there were places to stop along the way to take in the view, ring bells and enjoy some shade. We had been told it was closed until 1pm but luckily we went up anyway and it was open and free on this day. We arrived by tuck tuk and took about a half an hour or so.

Sad tale of the temple but definitely worth a visit.. The thing that makes this temple trip unforgettable is the vultures statues when you are descending from the temple. The sad tale behind it is the darkest period of Bangkok which makes it even sadder if one of the victims were your loved ones.

Spectacular views!. Before going I was a little worried about all the stairs, it was our 3rd day in Bangkok and we were struggling with the heat, adding 300+ stairs to the mix didn't seem like a great idea. However, the climb is so beautiful I barely noticed them. When you first start there's trees, water features and statues beside the winding staircase, then as you get a little higher you start getting the views of the city. There's a beautiful temple level just before you get to the top (which also sells cold drinks). At the summit itself the 360 views of Bangkok are breathtaking.

peacefull place in Bangkok. Once you are there it is peacefull and quiet. It is a very nice place if you want to leave te busy city of Bangkok behind for a few ahours. It is a very beautiful place to visit with not many tourist and you get a good impression of Buddhismealso a good place to see the skyline od Bangkok

lovely walk to the top around the hill. the walk around the hill (mount) is very nice. first half is shielded by the trees and there is a lot of water next to the stairs. the top of the hill, wat saket, is a nice viewpoint. is is really calm at the evening.
Worth the climb. Beautiful. Bring lot's of water. It's a bit of a hike but totally worth it for the 360 degree view of the city.

Very relaxing place. What a wonderful spot, lots of stairs but what a wonderful place. Awesome grounds and surroundings and well worth a visit. Bang on the gongs till your hearts content, no one cares, the Thais just laugh at you.
Amazing view. A must see temple in Bangkok. Over 300 steps to the top but little steps and you have little look out platforms on the way up.

Off the Beaten Path. The Golden Mount seemed to be off the beaten path. My husband and I arrived at 9:00am, and because of Loi Krathong, admission was free. (We made a donation.) Walking up the stairs was very easy, and it was fun to ring all the bells and gongs. The temple was decorated with flowers and prayer flags for the festival. Unlike other sights in Bangkok, it was peaceful and quiet. I don’t know if we got lucky, there weren’t any large tour groups visiting the temple. Or if the Golden Mount is always peaceful early in the day?We took a taxi from our hotel to the Golden Mount. I was concerned that when it was time to leave, it would be difficult to find a taxi. It was no problem at all. As we were leaving, a taxi driver was dropping off his passengers and we got in the taxi.

Beautiful View. I went to all majors temples in Bangkok with tour group on my last visit to Bangkok, but I missed this one out. Not sure why Wat Saket was not included in a group tour. Even now, all visitors went on their own, there is no tour group that stops by. There were 344 steps to walk up to the top, then you can see the entire city of bangkok, don't miss it.

Best view to bangkok. Really, when you climb to top, which is not even very high, you will get so nice view of the Bangkok that it alone is worth making a visit here. The place is clean, nice atmosphere good set of toilets and just feels nice to be there.It was a bit hard to get taxi out of the place, but walking to near by main road after made it a lot easier.

Bangkok Panoramic View. The Golden Pagoda is located in Wat Saket. you can see Bangkok (Rattanakosin Island) Panoramic view from the top of the man-made golden mount.During Loy Kratong Festival on November, there are many street foods and markets around that area.
Loved it!. Unique among the temple experiences that we had in Thailand. It was kind of magical making your way up the hill to the temple. The views were pretty as well.

Nice replacement till Wat Arun is fixed. The general Bangkok temple day tour consists of the Grand Palace, Wat Pho and Wat Arun. With Wat Arun undergoing renovations Wat Saket is the obvious choice to visit instead as part of the day tour and it is currently drawing a good bit of traffic although nothing like the Grand Palace. The climb up looks steep but is actually quite pleasant even with a six year who was quite over seeing any more temples!I suspect this Wat will continue to draw tourists even after Wat Arun is fixed. The views from the top are really good and the temple is 200 odd years old.

Simply the best place to visit in Bangkok. Donno why its ranked at 11th position. I would give it rank1 because of the serenity and beauty of the place.The staircase to the top is nicely done with a rain forest like ambience. From the top, you would get very nice view of the city.

A great place . Had a great visit here, was also lucky enough to experience a festival at the same time. Can recommend this as it is really a nice place and also gives a good view of the surroundings while also getting more into the history behind the lace.

A truly local experience. Thanks to my friends I got to visit this cultural (religious) rich place with night markets and Buddha.Took a taxi from Asiatique (talk about taxi, if there's no local with me I don't think I will be able to get on a meter taxi. It takes patience but I think tourist who can't speak Thai can seldom succeed) to this place took less than 30mins. There was a famous pad Thai street food stall nearby. Once got off the taxi, walked a very short distance and will reach a place with lots and lots of people. Along the side you will see many stalls selling mostly food. It's a bit of a walk (as there are just too many people) till you can get to the entrance of the Golden Mount, where you will see a Ferris wheel (not sure if it is there for the festival or a permanent thing). Just keep walking along the crowd and will see the entrance to the mountain with lots of small steps of stairs. It's not difficult to walk at all. Along the way you will notice there are bells and visitors can hit the bells with the rod inside the bell for (I suppose bringing good luck? Just guess...)... There were about two levels with Buddha statues and some priests blessing people.By the time you reached to the top you I got completely soaked! The centre of the square has a big bell shaped object covered with a red cloth. The interesting thing is that you will also notice some people taped a piece of 20B note to the wall of money next to a statue. Surrounded the bell shaped object is the priceless view of Bangkok city. One of the direction can see the old palace (I think). Getting back down was a pain as it was so jammed with people. You can enjoy the food or games once to got back down the road (it's better to go to the top first then chill when you got back down in my opinion).

Absolute must seen!. Personally for me the whole plesure of seeing this place was not the view from the top (which was ok) but the walking up the hill. Despite the fact its a plenty of stairs to climb on .. its like being in a different world.. greens are so intense in colour. . Buddha is standing in the steamy spot.. then u got plenty of bells to make noise with (which we did!) And in the end you reach the top which has a pleasant view. Definetly worth spending 20 BHT to get in. Highly recommended!

For the view and the peaceful serenity!. Believe it or now, the Golden Mount used to be (back in the dinosaur era?!) one of highest vantage points in Bangkok! I first visited it in 1980 and have been back often, most recently just this month (35 years later!). Now, there are lots of skyscrapers in Bangkok that offer fabulous views, but the Golden Mount is still a great place for a quiet, peaceful view of the city. The climb is not difficult and steps are small and user-friendly, with rest stops along the climb and nice shade. There is usually a pleasant breeze at the top. Foreign visitors are asked to pay 20 baht, but it's not even so strictly collected. Not the most spectacular temple in Bangkok, but very pleasant and well worth a visit if you have the time.

Peaceful, tranquil, and rejuvenating!. Wat Saket actually encompasses a large temple complex, containing the well-known Golden Mount. Nice to wander around the extensive temple grounds, but the real attraction is climbing to the top of the mount and enjoying the view! Not as spectacular as Wat Arun or the Grand Palace, but still very pleasant and well worth a visit if you have the time.'
beautiful view of the city. There is a religious monument and there is a beautiful view of the city of Bangkok. Such a combination I really like.
One of the must vist temples in Bangkok. Another inspiring temple in Bangkok. This one with a good view over the city. Very impressive especially when lit up at night
345 steps. Cool. Great view. Awesome. But bring a small towel cuz it would be exhausting. Thai culture is interesting.

Quiet haven, fantastic views. This place is quite tricky to find, so you may want to get a taxi rather than tramp the rather seedy streets that surround it to find it. Once you get there, there is a complex of various temples and the main site, a huge golden stupa which you reach via spiral staircases. As you go up, the view of the city gets better and better. The stairs are quite shallow and not difficult. It is much quieter than many of the tourist sites in Bangkok, and the gardens are beautiful. There are various bells along the way and it is very atmospheric as you hear people ring them. At the very top, there is a huge shrine where people are kneeling and writing.

Kitsch stairway to top, but good views. It's a strange ascent through an artificial mountain landscape with mist and statues of religious deities hidden along the way.Once you get to the top, there is a large Chedi and a good view from the top.They also claimed to have free wifi up there but I did not try.Quite a few worshippers.Only costs 20 Baht and Wat Suthat is not that far away.In the actual Wat next door called Wat Saket, there is another large Buddha and beautiful wall murals.
Beautiful Temple. Well worth a visit if your in the area and the views of the city are stunning. Entry for farang is only 40p :)
Lovely little temple. Nice temple. A lot of steps to the top but worth it for the views of Bangkok at the top. Costs approx 20bht (40p) which is cheap.
A must see in Bangkok. This place is really special. Great views from the top and a beautiful building. Very reasonable entry price too! Great huge bongs that you can strike too for fun!

Average Temple, Impressive View. This temple is well worth the visit for the view alone. The overall temple isn't really the peaceful buddhist temple you would want to see. However, the views of the city are amazing and worth the climb. If you plan to go, be prepared to hike a good bit (344 steps).
What wonderful views from the top...... I just loved the Golden Mount. What a spectacular view is to be had from the top. Be warned there are lots of steps to climb and lots of bells to ring.

Peaceful and Blissful place. Even thoug we came there in rain, and seen no sunset or even sun the palce just stuck in my heart with it's atmosphere. I wish to come back one day) Ringing bells in the wind... unobtrusive background music and mantras... beautiful stairs through green bushes with golden statues appearing here and there and slowly opening view of BKK...beautiful Buddha statues seem alive and breathing in waving iridescent golden scales... and scent of incenseJust forced myself to leave <3

Leaisure walk up the hill, breezy at the top. Wat Saket (the Golden Mount) costs 20 bhat for the entrance fee, and it is a leisure walk up the stairs to the top, suitable for elders and kids.Along the way there were some bells. The bells are rang intermittently by visitors and create some beautiful unknown melodies.The top, where the Golden Mount sits, was breezy. It gave a panoramic view of Bangkok. There is no shade on the top so do prepare for protection from the sun. Wat Saket is not near to any BTS station, so you may take tuk-tuk there. Alternatively, you can access it via Phan Fha pier (300m walk). From Phan Fha pier, we took the long tail boat to Pratunam. Take note that it can be VERY crowded and not much safety equipment in the boat, but certainly a very local experience!

Good view from top. Not overcrowded by foreign tourists, this temple is a nice experience to visit. It takes about 5 minutes to walk up to the top, so be prepared with good shoes. Not recommended when rainy, as the pathway may be slippery.Nice view on top, beautiful statues of the Buddha.

Only for the city view. To be honest I thought this was just ok. A little tacky in places, although there are good views over the city. I wouldn't go out of my way though to view it. Entrance fee was 20 baht.
Good view on Bangkok. In sunny day it is really good idea to go on Golden Mountain. The view on Bangkok is really nice. Climbing isn't very tiring.

So worth a visit. . I can't believe this isn't higher up the list of things to do. Easily was one of my favourite places in Bangkok. The view from the very top was incredible and wasn't too much of a walk up there either. The steps are not steep at all. Well worth 20 baht each.
Tranquil temple in a crazy city. This is a beautiful temple, with a short walk to the top. Many impressive Buddhas and a great view from the top as well.

Easy to reach the top. Great Place, as all temple in Bangkok.you have to be ready, wear a proper shoes not a slipper.There are some steps are very smooth.It Isn't too high as i thought.The view is very beautiful from the top.The ticket is not expensive.it will take around 20 minutes walking to reach the top.
Good views of Bangkok. This is a good way to get good views of the city of Bangkok. Lot of steps but worth the climb. Lovely and quiet.
favorite temple. this is my fav temple in bangkok. Go early to avoid the crowds and stroll around nearby areas...... good for a lazy day

Golden Mount. We took an early morning stroll up here to beat the heat as much as possible. It's 344 stps to the top but they are low steps and it's an easy enough walk for children to do but it was hot. By the time we headed back down it was starting to get busy but it's worth the walk!

Loved this; an easy climb, great to see and fab contrast of colours. If you have young children who are 'templed out' and exhausted by Bangkok, Wat Saket is great fun for an hour's visit. It cost 50 baht from memory so was cheap. It is an easy climb to the top, there are bells to ring/chime as you go up and nice views at the top so kids will enjoy this. Great photo opportunities with the gold structure and the blue sky. There are even icecreams, cold drinks and souvenirs at the top! When you get down, there are plenty of tuks tuks on hand to whisk you to your next destination. Recommended for a short visit.

Climbing is not a problem. This temple is not as crowded as the other temple. It is quite and not many tourist going to this place as there is not so many things to see. You need to climb to reach the temple. It is worth because at the top you will see a good view of Bangkok city. Please bring your hat because of the sunlight. Ticket price is only 20 THB.

Good!. The perspectives from this sanctuary are superb - you can see right crosswise over Bangkok, however you aren't too high up so you can observe day by day life pass by while getting a cool wind. I profoundly prescribe a visit in the event that you are in the zone.
for experience and sight seeing. its good for tourists the monks around were friendly.great view of the city.go in the late afternoon when its cooler

Not worth the trouble . So what do you get after climbing all those 322 or so steps? A quite ordinary looking temple. Yes you can get bird eye views of Bangkok, but there are probably quite a few rooftop restaurants in Bangkok which offer better views for lot less trouble. Also the place is not located close to any BTS station. You can safely give this place a miss.
Very nice temple with view for a whole Bangkok. Very nice temple with view for a whole Bangkok. Be aware that the only way to get there is to climb on hundreds of stairs.

Great view of Bangkok from the top!. I went there with one of my friend last year in December. We enjoyed the scenery while climbing and from the top too. To get to the top requires a climb up some 300 steps(approximately), which encircle the chedi like a loosely coiled snake the and view from the top make it worth visiting place.

Definitely worth a visit. The views from this temple are wonderful - you can see right across Bangkok, but you aren't too high up so you can watch daily life go by while getting a cool breeze. I highly recommend a visit if you are in the area.
Best for views. The temple has some excellent murals on the walk up and has a calming atmosphere. The main event is the view from the top after a leisurely climb. The view of the Old City is amazing.

Great view of Bangkok. The stairs was easy to climb for us and a nice little extra exercise for the day. Whether you have a problem with the stairs or not the view makes it worth it. Really great view of Bangkok!

The Golden Mount. The golden mount or Wat Saket is located in the old city of Bangkok. The entrance fees is 20 baht. There are small steps going up to the top of the mount. You can see the city of Bangkok from the top as a panoramic view. Nothing much once you got on top. Only a few Buddha images. It's not very high. Can go up slowly. There are also some places on the way where you can sit and take a break and enjoy the view.

Mount of Faith. This place been such observation tower in Thai style belong with Ayutthaya period but restore and renovated in reign of King Rama I the former of Bangkok. The golden stupa where place of relic situated inside is belong such a landmoark of town with tall building like mount of FAITH.

Good City View. We were nearby so decided to visit at the end of the day, only about 30 minutes to closing. The crowds were small then, and nobody collecting admission. The hike up to the top of the hill took about 20 minutes and we were at the top for another 10-15 minutes or so. The actual Golden Mount was a quick pic and then back down.

It is ok. If you are a Buddhist or really into Buddhism you may really enjoy this place.. I went here after going to Wat Pho and was not really impressed. If you are a Buddhist I am sure this is a great place to visit. There is a nice view of Bangkok from Wat Saket.

Bring Your Camera!. This was another place the tour guide suggested & was on the money. We learned about the different poses that the Buddhas are sculptured in and their meaning. This site does not tie you up a long time but there were a lot of locals worshipping and more tourists. Tell your tour guide from the very beginning, if you'd like, that you are not interested in any souvenirs/shopping as you might be taken to a store in between tours.

Beautiful!. Another temple well worth visiting wile you are in Bangkok, the views from the top are well worth the hundreds of steps in the heat!! Take plenty of water!! It won't take up your time, maybe a couple of hours at the most!
Round we go. I wish it was higher! It was still an interesting take on bangkok from slightly above. I was able to walk in without paying... only reason it was worth it to me.
Best view in town. I think one of the nicest Wat in Bangkok. A bit unknown and quiet which makes it perfect. A beautiful climb to the top will give you a stunning view of Bangkok

The Golden Mount. I'd say it's a must see in Bangkok. Beautiful Temple with great energy. Very calm. Great views of Bangkok.
Go up the stairs to the roof top - you won't be disappointed. Don't forget to ring the bells and the gong:-)

Amazing view of Bangkok, ok temple. The Wat Saket is at the top of a little mountain in the middle of Bangkok. You can get there easly by taxi, tuk tuk, public transport or walking from the Grand Palace.You have to walk up to the top which takes around 20min but is easy and has stairs all the way up. The temple inside is quite average, but at the roof there is the golden monument which gives name to the temple. The most amazing thing is the 360º view you can get of the city from inside a refugee of peace, without the noise of the traffic.Really worth to go there just for the views and take some amazing photos of the city, having the contrast of the palace and ancient monument on one side and the skyline on the other one.

Beautiful view of the city. Absolutely beautiful and easy walk up to the top. There are a lot of plants and statues to see, as well as traditional bells to ring. Once at the top you have a great view of the city sky line.

Excellent Panoramic views of Bangkok. This is the place to see Bangkok all in one place. The admission is 50 Baht. Go up about 5 minutes of stairs to enjoy one of the most incredible views. There are areas half way up where visitors can ring bells and a large gong. There is a small interior at the top with a worship area and gift shop. The top balcony offers free WiFi (didn't work for me) and a lovely golden mount. This place is about a 5-7 minute taxi from the Ananta Samakhom Throne Hall and Vimanmek Mansion Museum.

Great view. We had trouble getting here as the taxi driver seemed to have no idea where it was. Be careful of some men hanging around the attractions as they will tell you they are closed & offer to take you elsewhere, it's a scam so ignore it. There was a long climb up but worth it, I really liked visiting this attraction.

wonderful views. great views, lovely people. calm place to visit. quite stunning at the top and take your time when you are there. you will only visit it once. it is worth checking out the stalls around the streets below.

Excellent view of the city!. Amazing view from the roof. Ring the bells for good luck! Lovely stupa. Thought it a bit humorous that there was a "Free Wifi" sign at the top. It is a bit of a climb, but don't let that deter you. There's a coffee bar on the way up, and plenty of opportunities to take a rest break in the shade or under the misting jets along the way.

Wonderful walk and great view.. There is a lovely spiralling walk, shaded for most of the way with trees and flowers up to the Golden Mount. The view up there is incredible and there is a little river that flows from the high rocks along the path to keep you company.
Great view of the city . It is worths for the nice view of the city. Some steps to go up but nothing impossible. The area around the mount is very nice also.

Great view. Worth a look . We enjoyed a short visit to this temple. The view was impressive.We liked the bells, gongs and garden.Should be on your to do list if you have time after you have done the major attractions as the grand palace, river, Wat Pho, Prah, Arun. Golden Budha etc

Golden - more ways than one. I really enjoyed this Wat compared to some of the others in Bangkok as it was tucked away in a quieter part of town, not very busy, and offered a panoramic view of Bangkok once at the top. Comprised of a longer set of stairs, the walk is meant to be meditative as you make your way up to the top of the Golden Mount. There are bells along the way that you can ring in meditation, and there's areas above to purchase snacks, light incense, worship and pray, and places to sit. Outside of the wat there is a burger and coffee place, called the Golden Mount ironically. Try going there before or after your visit, you won't regret it.

Nice golden mount. Honestly, you don't have to climb the tower just to have a good look at it. You can already admire this mount from a far without really spending time and effot climbing the structure.
Nice view. Love the bells and the view. Pretty entertain through the way up. The big golden top is quite impressive but couldn't figurate the waning of it. Must do

so gold. beautiful golden structures despite of your religion you will get nice pictures in the morning wit the sun the golden things shine more  please mark down this as a helpful opinion , since it is a free contribution to the website thanks

Very good and interesting experience!. Was told by some friends not to go, but was stubborn and decided to go anyways! Absolutely loved it! It is a quiet place, amazing views and they even offer free wifi. Definitely worth visiting and spending an hour or so at the top watching the great views and taking some photos! (Consider there are a lot of steps to climb, but it is a great experience once you reach the top)
Great view of the city!. The temple is not that important to see but you need to visit for the view! Its a bit of a walk up but nothing to worry about.
To do to have an overview on the city. Go and climb the mount to discover the temple and an overview all over this part of the city. No noise, a little bit of nature downton

high above the area,to enjoy the view,and to worship Budha.. located near the Democracy monument,woking distaned from kosan road.the fanny way to reach is by the public canal transportation fom Pratunam.there is an easy way to clime up to the top by foot.no need to take your shuse off,it is some kind of musium,with status and meet tai teenage learning to became moncks .
Amazing temple. The stupa at Wat Saket is unbelievable. There are less tourists here than at some of the other temples but it is still a magnet for tourists.
Nice Place. Amazing place to visit, with stunning views of Bangkok.Better to visit by water Taxi ,you will definitely enjoy .
Another Temple. A good way to see a panorama of Bangkok after having climbed to the top of the hill. Very picturesque views for photographers.

Avoid the tourist and visit this Wat. One of the less touristy attractions there are many locals walking up to the summit. The cost is very low and you can amble your way to the top. Not too much of a climb for a great view over Bangkok. We took the BTS to national stadium. Then walk for five minutes to the canal boat where the locals go. You have to walk through a few dark stalls under the road bridge to find the pier . If in doubt when you walk across the bridge look down and you can see the river and pier. Three stops on the canal one on the left and the. The second on the right is the end of line then it's afive minute walk to the Wat.

Worth the walk up. Worth the walk up the stairs in that heat! Amazing views and the great sounds of the bell, known as a uvula! Bringing peace within each time I heard this amazing sound!! pclapper or uvula,
Nice temple. very nice temple, great atmosphere in between the busy streets. Our tuktuk driver left us here, well no problem, we didn't pay yet..
Golden Mount offers fantastic views. Lovely place to visit. Great view over the old city from above. Free wifi on top and a coffee place halfway up the hill!! ;-)

Impressive. A very interesting place where you can slowly walk up to the top of the Mount.. quite a nice view from the top too..you can ring the Luck bells on the way up. & pray to the Buddha up there too...there is a small place to buy gifts too...Quite enjoyable & somethig a bit different too

fantastic view over Bangkok from up here. second visit for me, a few steps to the top, but worth the climb, the big golden bell at the top is HUGE, and 360 view is amazing, the gardens and grounds surrounding the temple are very pretty, and I like that visitors can go inside the temple and also to ring the many bells on the ways. and bang the gong at the top. worth a visit .
Peaceful Oasis. Great views of the city from all directions, this small temple oasis in the North of Bangkok is well worth the visit.
Interesting. This place is currently undergoing renovations and we had restricted access. That said it's a nice place to visit and quite serene.

Excellent panorama for Bangkok. You can visit some small prayer rooms at the bottom of the mount and then go up. It will take some time but it is worth it. You can bang the gong while going up and then take pictures of the scenery on the rooftop.

Great views of the city. You have fun from the moment you step inside, from the stairs going up, to the top of the mount, till your way down. The views of the city are marvelous. Definitely worth visiting.
Great viewpoint of the city. A lovely walk to the top that gives you an amazing outlook on the city of Bangkok - it was very refreshing after the rain

wat saket. A fabulous Wat . Climb to the top the view is worth it. This wat is close to the Saen Saep khlong which you can access from the city centre Siam and other stops through the city . Its a lot of fun

Very romantic. Amazing place, very nice to go there to see all Bangkok and by 6 p.m to see sunset. Very romantic of you are with your girlfriend or wife. And actually not very high to climb and can make also some stops for visiting caves and seeing monuments.
Recommended for the sunset. A beautiful place, go there before the sunset to catch nice colours of the sky! Unforgetable view over the city of Bangkok.

Perfect for Macha Bucha. We went here on the eve of Macha Bucha. It was an amazing atmosphere and almost no tourists (they celabrate after normal visiting hours, but it's open to everyone). The view from the top of the tower is beautiful, and the whole feel is more authentic then other touristy attactions.

Famous temple in Thai people heart. Reach here for your Loy Krathong celebration and you will feel the truly Thai festival. Here is one of the most place to visit during the festive time by local people.
Impressive. Very beautiful place, it have be be one my top five sites in Bangkok. From the top you have a viem of the city as well.

Great views. Be warned - there's a LOT of steps up to this! Half way up there's a lovely little cafe for nice cold drinks. The views from the top of the amount are spectacular - 360 of Bangkok - best views in town!

Best temple in Bangkok. In my opinion, Wat Saket is the best temple in Bangkok, let me tell you the reasons.Firstly, the price was only 20 baht for foreigner, which is cheap if you compare it to other popular temples. Secondly, the atmosphere of the temple itself, peaceful and not too crowded, you'll see 3 wise monkeys at the entrance of Wat Saket, on the path to the top, there are some statues and bells (yes you can ring the bells), don't miss out the panoramic view of Bangkok as you go upstairs.Thirdly, the golden mount, where you can enjoy the breathtaking view, worship Buddha, take a look and pictures there, all covered in gold. There's also souvenir, drinks and ice cream stall.If you're more likely to stay in Khao San area, you can take 15 minutes walk to get there or simply take tuk tuk, motorbike or taxi. Don't forget to dress appropriately when entering the temple.Tips : get there in early morning, try to meditate, you'll find tranquility.
peaceful walk...serene view. Serene place to visit..Few minutes walk to the top..its beautiful..specially if u can visit at evening it looking amazing!!!!

Huge and Holy Place. This temple is super huge. You'll get fit climbing up the steep road to the top. When you get there, the view is worth it. The Golden Temple is really huge though and people pray. There are different small Buddahs too and things to see and buy for tourists. The road is very quiet and peaceful too so you can just take a slow walk up or down while savoring the nature.

Beautiful temples and views of Bangkok. The Golden Mount is a must whenever you visit Bangkok for the first time. The views are great as well. 20 baht entry and a less than 10 minute hike make it very accessible.

Bangkok skyline. Recommended to me by a friend, who's already been to Bangkok a couple of times and I'm glad he told me about it. The place isn't so great if you've already seen your share of temples and pagodas around SE Asia. But, you'll probably have the best view of the Bangkok skyline! Tourists pay 20 baht, which is fair, considering what you get. Oh, and the have free WiFi at the top!
Nice view. Good view of the city for only 20 baht. Sunday morning was a good day as there were very few people. More locals and less tourist.
The Welsh Nomads!. Nice little temple but more impressively the views are worth the visit, only 20THB to enter so very cheap indeed. Would recommend a trip if time allows!

Fantastic views from the top- old and new Bangkok. Out of all the times we have been to Bangkok, this is the first time we have been here. A real bargain for 20bahts and a lovely walk up to the top to see the 360 view of Bangkok. This is a definite must see when you are in Bangkok and even more so when you have read the history of ot

A great temple with a great view. The temple is beautiful with many interesting statues of Buddhas. An amazing view from the top is another advantage as you can see Bangkok with new modern skyscrapers and ancient religious buildings. The way up to the temple is also a nice treat, you go past bells, Buddhas and green plants. Worth a visit!
