Really nice pagoda to know a little bit Buddhism in Thailan. you can see lots of building in BKK if you go on top pagoda. you can buy some yellow pages to stickers on Buddha statue.
Very grand. Thoroughly enjoyed seeing this. We came here from the floating markets, had a wonderful tour guide Anan, which is helpful.Would recommend.

Great view of the city. Described as the golden mountain, this large golden dagoba is not only a beautiful place but a great place to view and photograph the city. It's an easy climb to the top up a gentle circular path that goes around the mountain. Go around sunset for some great views. The path is lined with mist guns to keep you cool. At only 20baht to get in this is good value!

Must See. THB20 entrance fee.Visited the temple during rainy day and it's give difference type of feeling (peaceful)Excellent view where you can see Khao San Road and Grand Palace from the top of the temple.
Golden rims!. Visited in the morning and the golden rims were a sight to admire basking in the morning sun! Fantastic!
Impressive. Enjoyed seeing this on my visit. Had a great tour guide as well. Hope to visit again in the future!!
One to Visit!!. Great Temple - offers views all over Bangkok and has numerous bells en route up the steps to the top. Definitely recommended!

Another Must See!. Free, commanding views, and many things to see combine to create a great experience. It’s and easy walk from the khlong boat (river boat taxi). Finish with a serving of Thai-style Ice Cream Sandwich, complete with open bun and sticky rice. Perfect treat after the walk to the top!

A must see in Bangkok. Having done other Wats on previous trips to BKK, we were recommended to go to Golden Mount and it was fantastic. Awesome views over BKK, lovely walk up to the Wat and a great breeze on a hot day. A quick tuk tuk ride from downtown.
"Gold, I always believed in your soul" :-). Nice attraction but there were too many people. It was hard to even take some good snapshots because of the never ending tourist groups....

Worth a visit to get away from the hustle and bustle of bangkok. Beautiful place to visit. You get away from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. It is a steep walk to the top. When you get to the top the view is amazing
Climb to the top!. The hike up to the temple features a small stream, greenery and bells as well as panoramic views of the city. On the top you will be awarded with a golden stupa.
great and marvelous. one of the best religions place in Thailand that show the real culture of thai people.but the hot and humid whether make you crazy.
Great view. We took taxi from rachathewi to here (60 bath). Cheap entrance fee 20 bath / person. You can see city view and big golden stupa at the top.

Great view!. We took taxi from Siam to here(60 bahts). View is stunning and you can go to loha prasat , democracy monument and wat suthat or kao san road afterwards(walking distance)! Its a well maintained, quieter temple in bangkok that definitely worth a visit!! If you've already visited wat pho, grand palace and wat arun, come here for a peaceful view.
A Bangkok "Can't Miss". Truly a taste of Bangkok and glimpses in to the neighboring countries. Be sure not to wear short pants.

Up lifting. Most see for any one visiting Bangkok
A wonderful spiritual place
And the views from the top are fantastic
You get to see 360 of the Bangkok skyline
The old with the very newest skyscrapers

Great Views . Cheap entry and not a strict dress code. The views over Bangkok are really impressive (you see the mix of buildings, from corrugated iron roofs to skyscrapers) and the walk to the top is easy and fun too. Takes less than an hour to visit and enjoy.
On top of the world.. Amazing place to visit, with stunning views of Bangkok. The mount is majestic and calming. A beautiful escape from the city.
very nice for photos. Do not take the tuk tuk drivers who offer you cheap tours, they stop many times at different shops. take tuk tuk directly from koh san road. beautiful tempel

One of the must-stops in Bangkok's wat trail.. One of the best "wat experiences" in Bangkok, winding "trek" up the hill and on top, provides a great view of the city. Such a nice view at dawn as well and a short distance from Wat Rachanadda and Loha Prasat.

A must visit in Bangkok. Great place to visit by water Taxi or Ferry. Went in the AM before it was too hot. Get a guide as it will be more relevant. Be respectful as this is still a place of religious worship.

Great views and lovely sites. I really enjoyed our trip here.
Seeing all the bells, the gong, the different elements of the temples going up on the walk and also the great views of Bangkok.
Really worth seeing as different to a lot of other temples that we visited in Bangkok.

Surprise find in Bangkok. I stumbled upon the Golden Mount as I had an hour before a scheduled tour was to start. I was quite pleased with the beautiful park-like area at the base of the mount. Many steps, but easy, to the top where you get great 360 degree views of the city. A great way to spend the extra hour I had.

Impressive. There are for sure 1000 and more things you have to go to and to see. The Golden Mount is one of our favorites. It is impressive and if you have a Hotel nearby and decide to have a walk to that impressive temple you easily can fail to find it with the first attempt.... But if you finally are in it is a great experience climbing up through the plants until you reach the section without any sun protection and a good view on Bangkok. The tempel itself is extremely nice and we enjoyed it very much. It has never been overcrowded when we were there. Eventually not all tourists know what they are missing what is good for people who have the time to go there.
Worth visit. Took a tuktuk to visit all the highlight of the old city. This one should be on your list. Enjoy panoramic view from there is superb.
Must see.. Very beautiful small mountain in bangkok, the building and art is very beautiful but also the view over the city is stunning.

One of the better temple outings in Bangkok. For anyone interested in going to Wat Saket please keep in mind there is no public transport, apart from the canal ferries, which will drop you near to this temple. In fact for anyone who hasn't been to Bangkok before I would highly recommend planning your trip and hotel stay around the the city's very efficient underground (MRT) and sky train (BTS) networks. The easiest way to get to Wat Saket, if you are staying around the Sukhumvit area, is to take the MRT to Petchaburi terminal. When you exit the terminal follow the indicating signs to the Canal ferry. It's approx 100 meters back along Asoke Road and for 15 Baht (US 50 cents) will take you all the way to Wat Saket. There is a change over at the half way point of the trip along the canal. Don't stress about this. just alight from the first ferry and wait on the platform to board the second one. If in doubt, just follow the crowd. The final stop is where you get off. It's at a bridge and you will be able able to see Wat Saket from the jetty. Ask the Tuk-Tuk guy's hanging around the bridge if you need more directions but it's just along the road and across the bridge. NOTE: the touts may try and talk you into going elsewhere, just say no and say "Wat Saket."

Climb the steps- views are worthy as is the "roof" area. Climb up the winding stairs-hitting the gongs along the way. Near the top is a lovely cafe (I write this bc it was 102degrees and iced beverage was much needed). At the top, services were going on so entire room was filled w joss stix smoke- venture outside for great views and more "gong-ing". Several areas "to donate"- one for happy real estate transactions- one for love- I think visitors are suppose to walk around the roof 3x to the right? to the left? Interesting visit-

Out of the way but worth it. Took a taxi out here and enjoyed the views and bells as we climbed up. What I found very strange was the free wifi at the top! Lots of tourists using it and personally I found this disrespectful. View from top is great. Worth going if you have the time,we did this on day 7 of our trip.

Peaceful and very beautiful. Very beautiful and peaceful temple to vist must go there, Golden mountain on top give a very beautiful city view, Golden budha for pray .... just incredible beautiful and peaceful
view beautiful. My favorite place n Bangkok. Awesome views, It's beautiful and you get a great view! Bells and golden Buddha's galore!

It changed a lot. I was there in 2012 and then again last month and it changed a lot. Now it is more like business with a better decoration and service for the tourists. Yet, it still has its holy glory atmosphere at the site. It's nice to walk up to the top of the Mountain and see the city from the top.

Nice view!. It's amazing when you see it and think it was man made! i goes really high and you have a nice view over the city. on your way up there ara a lot of bells that you can "bang", small fee to get in

HARD WORK IN THE HEAT BUT WORTH IT. We had an interesting walk here from the Grand Palace area and survived the very humid heat climbing the around 300 steps to the top for great views of Bangkok.We were joined in the climb by a group of very well behaved schoolchildren adding to our enjoyment as they practised their English and insisted on having their photos taken. When you arrive back down at the bottom of the steps you will find seating being misted by water sprinklers. There is also a cold drinks machine.However, take plenty of water for the climb up!
Panoramic Views. Panoramic views of Bangkok city from the top. Worth the climb of 320 steps in the humid weather. A must visit when you are in that area

Good Place to Make a Merit and The great viewpoint of Rattanakosin Island. It's a good place you must visit when your're here in Bangkok. Walking up the hundreds of stairs to make a merit at Golden Pagoda above. It's also the great viewpoint of Rattanakosin Island.

Visit for the sunset view, not for the temple. It's not a great temple. The reason to visit is mainly the view of Bangkok that it offers. You can go around 6pm for the sunset. It is just about climbing a few stairs and to see the panoramic view of Bangkok.

The Golden Mount Oasis in a Busy City!. What an amazing temple! Truly stunning and breathtaking views of the city can be seen at the top. The monument itself is amazing in its own right! The golden mount is like a jungle oasis in the middle of the bustling city with a gentle walk to the top. We had a fun time hitting all the gongs on the way up and down!
Peaceful mind with nice place. You can relax and clam down here. I spent time for meditation here. You can soothing with nice weather, with top view of the rajdamnern road here.

Old Bangkok temple with a view and lots of character.. This is my favorite temple in Bangkok. It is built on top of an artificial hill that history books say was the remains of an old, supermassive chedi tower that collapsed. Visit the observation platform at the top. Don't forget to visit the wat temple buildings also located about a block to the east.

Keep your shoes ON!. breathtaking, amazing, worth the long walk up all those stairs. ring the bells. chose to buy a bell with your name on it to place amoung all the other bells. don't touch the monks! KEEP YOUR SHOES ON. it is one of the rare places where you are asked to actually keep your shoes on. there were so many shoes at the down that I ignore the contant repetitive chant "keep you shoes on". when you get to the top the floor is painfully hot - I didn't have my shoes on. there is water at the top. there are graves or memorials around the base. good to get off the path and explore. look around there is more than just the mount. interesting tradition is to rub little gold squares on the black statues to pay respect. BEWARE AVOID WATCH OUT for the Tuk Tuk drivers. They over charge. If they don't over charge it is because they are going to take you to the THAI FACTORY a custom clothier. even if you don't want to go, they will take you there. It is horrible to feel kidnapped! WARNING they are aggressive and persistant. Walk to the road for a taxi or motorcyle.
Very nice temple. Very nice temple at the heart of bangkok not bad to spend some time to visit also not far from grand palace

great views. Having eventually found this place we paid our 20bht and proceeded to walk up a number of steps. Despite the heat it was a cool and tranquil climb. Shame there was no kind of commentary on the history of the place. But the views across Bangkok as you start to get higher were fab.

Wonderful Temple with a View. Not highly as sought after as Wat Pho or the Grand Palace, Wat Saket is an excellent temple to visit that offers amazing views of Bangkok and is an excellent way to spend time at a temple not filled with tourists everywhere. Highly suggest visiting Wat Saket as it was one of the highlights of our day!

Not the usual temple. I have to admit, once you see one temple you've basically seen them all. However, Wat Saket offers a lot more difference. It's an amazing temple with wonderful grounds. Caution, there are 200+ babysteps to get to the top. The top of the mountain boasts wonderful panoramic views of Bangkok. I've been to the temple a few times and it is never crowded. I would put this on my list of things to see in Bangkok.
Please see if you are a traveller seeking thai culture.. Nice historical Location. Please go if you are a traveler seeking thai Culture. Remember to keep the noise level low.

Go up there, you view Bangkok is. I went here many times as It's icon of this zone. Golden Mount used to the highest landmark in reign of King Rama III like high building in the present.Best time you should is on November that called Loy Kratong's day, full moon with Bug Buddha day here. There is annual fair here like big festival that joiner can be fun in Bangkokian style.
Temmple tour.. I went there with a group of friends to visiting the Golden Mount for our temples trip around BKK. Wat Saket has a very nice view of bkk.

Wonderful views, including spirituality. My young friend, novice monk Pichas brought me to this temple. Together we climbed up the stair to the top, the young monk let every bell ring the way up. You should do this, it gives you a good inspiration and ones you arrive the top you are spiritually touched and can even more the beautiful view over Chinatown and the western part of the city of angels Bangkok.
One of Bangkoks top Twenty must see places. Did not visit this until recently, having seen it many times, not a great deal to see, but photos taken from here are superb, worth going.

Come for the view!. We visited Wat Saket in March 2015.We travels there by boat down the Khlong Saen Saeb waterway. We caught the canal boat from the Pratunam Pier (located beneath the bridge on Ratchadamari Road, near the Pratunam Market) to the Phanfa Leelard stop (which is the last stop on canal heading towards the Chao Phraya river). It costs around 25 Baht per person each way and its a great way to see parts of the city you might not normally see.Once you get off the boat you go up the stairs and over the bridge and you'll see the Golden Mount to your left (you can't miss it) just down the street.Once you go in the entrance you need to go up a large flight of steps to get to the top. The walk is very pleasant, with nice views and stops on the way to rest up if you need it. Once you reach the top you are greated with a fantastic view of Bangkok. We spent a good 30 minutes just looking around at the view and seeing Bangkok layed at before you in all its glory. You can see attractions like the Rama Bridge, the Grand Palace and even Wat Arun from the top. Being up that high you also get a nice breeze which is most welcome in the Bangkok heat.Once you get back down to the ground there are other areas and temples to look at as well which help make this one of the must do things in Bangkok.We really enjoyed this and would recommend to everyone.
One of the largest Buddhist Monuments. I loved this wat. we stopped on our way back from the floating market in Damoen Saduk (spelling). What a beautiful what, great murals and well kept grounds.

Nice and different. Nice place. I suggest to go there early morning so you will be alone. It's like being in another place outside Bangkok, all the noise, traffic, all disappears. There is a temple next to the golden mount, you can see it from there top, is a perfect spot where to take the perfect picture of the mount.
Great view. We enjoyed going up here. There was a small fee but worth it. It was really nice to just sit up the top and take in the views. There is no dress code.
Nice Temple. great place to relax and enjoy the surrounding. In the centre of all yet quiet and easy to explore other areas nearby

Temple get old after a while.. I'm not much of a Buddhist Temple goer, but most of the structures are impressive and almost all have something unique. This one was a little dirtier than some of the others I have been to and at the time I was there, they had a celebration that was very noisy.

Nice view. Loved the view. Loved the walk up. Loved the stupa on top.
If you make a nice walk around Bangkok, don't miss this one. It's a long walk upstairs so please take some water with you.
The fee is resonable for what you get.

A Great Site and Unique. a must see in Bangkok the temple is a great place to see buddist monks practising their chants and ceremonies daily addmission very reasonable. It can be reached using the BTS as a station is nearby and most Tuk Tuk drivers will take you there and wait for a small fee.

Good panoramic view of Bangkok. This landmark gives you a panorama view of the city, especially the old city of Bangkok. It is worth the travel, and it is usually quieter compared to other tourism spots.

Nice view. Accidentally came upon this place while getting lost trying to find another temple. Paid 100 baht and slowly climbed the stairs to the top. Once at the top, it had a lovely view of the city.

Excellent views. If you want to have a 360 view of Bangkok, this is the place. I learnt that you have to gow up the 500 steps, step by step... Do not get desperate to get to the top. on each floor the are bells that you need to ring them all, one by one... i gues is a ritual to get to the top were you pray in front of Budha....The views are very nice.
Nice place to visit. 500 steps to get to the top. You should take the step by step and on each floor ring all the bells one by one. At the top the is a very nice 360 view of Bangkok.

Don't pay too much attention to the advertised admission times!. First thing to note- while walking their we saw a sign that said open 9-5. We arrived at half 5 and were planning to just walk round the edge, then saw another sign that said open 8-5:30. We were there quite a while for reasons outlined below, but nobody ever asked us to leave!Nice to visit if you happen to be in the area, perhaps not worth making the effort to travel to. While we were there the heavens (do Buddhists believe in heaven?) opened, so we sought shelter one level down where the free wifi became a rather convenient tool to kill time!Favourite part of the trip- watching people try to decide whether to take their shoes off or not when confronted with the 'please do not take off your shoes' audio clip played over and over, but the contradictory large collection of shoes left outside by the people that clearly didn't listen
Beautiful city view. Amazing 360 degree view of the city.Tip: If you go right before closing it is practically empty and the sun begins to set!
Great place to visit. Interesting historical place and nice to visit with family. Location is decent and great place to visit before sun set

Okay but not a must see.. The walk up to the top of this really isn't too bad so you don't need to be in amazing shape/super fit. Although the views of Bangkok are pretty cool, you could miss this out of your trip and it wouldn't be a big deal. It more impressive to look at it from a bit further away.Weirdly, and on a side note, they have wifi up there!

A nice break and beautiful view. We had a late start our first day in Bangkok (jet lag) and after making our way to the Old City and having a snack almost everything was closed. Took out a map, picked Wat Saket more or less at random and hailed a tuk-tuk. It was easily the best decision we made all day. The first 2/3 of the way up, everything was covered in misty hanging gardens, which were perfect and peaceful after an afternoon of heat. It was nearly empty in the evening, so we felt no rush and went at our own pace. It was absolutely stunning at the top, with great views, as many have mentioned, and a few people sitting around and chatting.

8th visit to the Golden Mount. Went there several times and it keeps on getting better. Best to visit this temple after you have done all the others last afternoon and stay for sunset. After that the golden Mount is lit up and the best views u can from Rachadamnoen Avenue near the fort. Do not forget to see all stuff around the mount bottom such as the temple itself too. It's worth it.
Best Temple in Thailand. Small and just enough temple for the not so site seeing individual. The photo at the end is also a great tourist idea.

Wonderful 360 degree view of Bangkok!. Well worth a visit! Incredible 360 degree view of Bangkok from the top. There are long stairs to walk up, but the lush greenery, buddha and other statues, bells and gongs, even a constant prayer from the loudspeakers make it an almost meditative climb.So far the only temple where you are specifically asked NOT to take off your shoes! No strict dress code requred but scarf to cover bare shoulders advised.Odd fact: there is free wifi on the Golden Mountain! And benches to sit on while you check into the net.

I like it :). Nice visit, the way up the stairs is absolutely breathtaking! Great scenery and decorations very interesting view of the religion (keeping in mind its mostly a touristic sight) but it was too hot better stay hydrated :)
Nice view over bangkok. exceptional temple located on a mount which offers a nice view over Bangkok. Possibility to reach it by express-boat-taxi.

360 views of Bangkok. Brilliant place to visit. Lots of steps up and but it wasn't a difficult climb, even in the intense heat! View from the top absolutely priceless, 360 views over the whole of Bangkok. Huge contrast between the poor ramshackle houses up close and the sky scraper business towers in the distance. Was a wonderful, calm place to reflect. Randomly, it also had free (and very quick!) wifi and the refreshment shop on the floor below was very welcome!
A cool place on a hot day.. Definitely worth going to see. But be sure to watch for signs as it's not the easiest place to find.
great views of Bangkok. Very interesting to walk around the mount,read the history and then walk up th many concrete stairs and enjoy the great views of Bangkok.Well worth the exercise.
Worth visiting. A short climb to the temple, Bells and gongs along the way, Nice place, we really enjoyed visiting this place :)

extermely peaceful. This is such a peaceful place, you feel very welcome, the monks welcome all people regardless of religion. Quite a hike, but it is all worth it. Not a tourist attraction as such, many locals visit to worship, so it is off the beaten track, so to say.

Beautiful temple with a view . This is definitly one of my favorite places in Bangkok. A beautiful temple on top of a hill. After you have climbed the staircase, you are rewarded with amazing views of Bangkok. Surprisingly, there are not too many tourists around. So, there is a calm and peaceful atmosphere. And the entrance fee is only 20 baht.
Sweaty climb. It's a bugger of a climb in the heat and humidity of Bangkok, but the view from the top makes it well worth the sweaty climb!

Beautiful, it is up up up, then back down, The bells and gongs !!!!!!!!. Love love love. So beautiful and I rang every bell and gong, take it at your pace, I was moved at this temple,They give you the space and an experience. Thank you so much
Worth an hour of your time. I really enjoyed our visit to the golden mount, well worth the walk up, but need a clear day for the best views.

As always a must go for my friends visiting . Every time o have a friend that comes to Thailand I always strongly encourage to go and climb the golden mount. Do penitence as you progress. When you reach the top the reward of an exceptional view of the old Bangkok is one of the greatest reward. You van then pay tour respect to the shrine at the top and center of the mount. A must!

Steps!. Visited Wat Saket because we had 45 mins to spare and were walking distance at the time. We had to go fairly quickly up all the steps, which got easier towards the top as there was a cooling breeze. Took about 15 mins to get all the way to the roof. Great views from the top.
Temple up hill.. Historical temple on the top of the hill in old town of Bangkok.Enjoy panoramic view from there is superb.

Great view of the city. The height of the temple offers an amazing view over all Bangkok. Numerous temples are to be seen mixed with the houses, representing pretty much what Bangkok is today.It may be a bit tiring to go up all the stairs but the reward is great.

Beautiful view, worth a stop. This temple offers a beautiful view of Bangkok and, in my opinion, is definitely worth a visit. The monks take very good care of the premises - there are a lot of beautiful flowers everywhere. I'm just sorry we didn't climb to the top to see the golden stupa.
place to visit. long way up but so cool place, must have water with you. A bit far from city center but its worst it
Nice. We took a tuktuk to visit all the highlight of the old city. This one should be on your list. From up the mountain, you can enjoy a nice view on Bangkok.

Walk to Golden Mount. If you go early, just as the gates open you can experience a little Buddhist religious life before the place gets "touristy" take your time to walk through the streets leading to the mount. Once at the mount and climb up look at the view which is OK but also sit and soak up what is happening inside.
Lovely view.. There is a beautiful view of the city from here and an oppurtunity to make offerings All around the temple.
Good view. When taking the khlong boat to/from Phanfa or staying near the victory monument I would make a detour to climb the golden mount. You have some nice views.
Wind makes dust swirl. Stunning considering this was had water 5ft high 6 years ago. well worth vist. very open and if windy very dusty

Must see. Arriving there by boat is already a nice journey, but this place is really a pleasant surprise. There are not as many people as the other popular temples so it looked surprisingly empty, and there is no specific dress code either (shorts and sleveless tops are ok).There are lots of stairs to climb but that's not too painful because the steps are not very high and the surroundings are really nice, green, with small cascades and statues hidden amidst the greenery. The atmosphere at the top where the golden bell is is very peaceful and relaxing and the view rewarding. A must see place.
Visit every time when go to Bangkok. My favorite place n Bangkok. Never missed a chance to visit while stay in Bangkok. Amazing 360 panorama, fresh breeze and feeling of peace make me happy here
Golden mountain. Awesome views, could see our hotel from the top and when our tuk tuk driver left us we just climbed to the top to figure out which way was home!! Haha definitely worth all the stairs

Steep climb, but good views. Stumbled upon this when I was aimlessly walking from the Democracy Monument. Lots of people already get their photos taken with the Chinese Zodiac statues below. The climb was a bit steep but there were gardens in the lower rungs, which was nice. The view at the top was also good! It's not really a must-see but one of those neighborhood attractions that you'd be glad you discovered.
Beautiful vista of Bangkok. Stunning view of Bangkok- ring every bell- lots of steps, and quite a climb, but well worth it!- you can take a canal (Khlong) boat or get a tuk-tuk from Old Bangkok

A different type of temple site.. Based around a mount there are a number of shrines around the base and at the top. The atmosphere is a relaxed one and the site provides a pleasant couple of hours. The gardens around the base and up the sides of the mount add to the atmosphere and there are excellent views out over surrounding Bangkok. There was also a small panorama explaining a little history of the site, especially during the Bangkok plague. A small charge for going up the mount. Quiet compared with the larger temples but well worth a visit for the Budhas, the gardens, the view and the history.If visiting by taxi, be sure to use a metered cab, 50 baht from khaosan area. A tuk tuk would cost several times more than that, as would an unmetered taxi. I see from other reviews it is also accessible by public boat service along the klongs (canal system).
Leg day. . Don't skip leg day, and go trek up this temple. It's beautiful and you get a great view! Bells and golden Buddha's galore!

Surprise view from the city. This is a nice place to visit that is not so crowded. Probably because getting here is not on a main line for the BTS. We took a water taxi that the locals used, very cheap but no English so we had to look at the line on the map and knew that ours was the last stop which made it easy. Going back, we had to remember land marks to know where to exit (fortunately we got on near the Jim Thompson house so had easy landmark). The ticket takers do not speak English and were not much help. The fare is very cheap and is an exciting way to travel and see the canal system and houses along the way. The water was very polluted and there was a water shield system where you pulled on a pulley and were protected from the splash. The Wat itself is visible but finding where to get in was hard. We got in through a little alley that had the smallest of signs. Once in the fee was cheap and the climb up the mount is not hard. There are rest areas along the way which makes it easy if you need them. Once at the top though, the view and breeze was fantastic. It is not that high but high enough to see all around the city 360. Definitely worth a trip and great photo op.

Good time - family visit. We visited it in August 2015. Although it was a good day (no rain and sunny), but it was very good time for family time in a green, colored place.Very pleasant local personal. We had a private guide - it makes the visit very authentic and interesting.
Great place. Near to water taxi. Huge place. A few halls in this temple area. Due to time constrain, did not manage to get up the top of the mountain

For a view of the city.. We went here to get a view of the city. Having just visited the Grand Palace and Temple of the Emerald Buddha the temple itself wasn't anything particularly special.
Most memorable for me was the waste disposal. Instead of trash cans the had giant pipes running down to the bottom on the mountain.

Amazing.. A beautiful, serene temple in the centre of one of the worlds busiest cities. A must see attraction for anybody in Bangkok. The temple is well maintained, beautiful and the monks are friendly.
Definitely worth a visit.. Extraordinary. Just being in there and walking around gives you calm and satisfied feeling. Atmosphere, architecture and a view, all spectacular.

Don't miss this temple.. Having seen the 3x main tourist temples a few days before, this is well worth a visit. You have amazing views as you wander up the steps. The temple itself has a tranquillity which is a welcome change.

A nice place to visit for a good view over Bangkok. After a small fee, head up the Golden Mountain to reach the top where there are great views over the city. The walk up the hill is pretty tacky (decorated with statues) but good to have a look at. Just be cautious of the time of day; we headed up at about 1pm - the hottest part of the day - and the heat was unbearable at the top!
Great View.. Excellent view, from the top. It is a little bit of a hike to the top but it is definitely worth the trek. Bring some water with you if it is hot out.

Great place to start. Although Bangkok has many temples, I would recommend seeing if time permits. A great way to learn more about the culture and see the city. It has a lot of stairs so be prepared to walk. take comfy shoes.

Good Looking and provide nice view. This temple located about 10-15 minutes walking distance from Khao San. I initially did not plan to go here, however during my bus/taxi trip to downtown I was quite curious to see what's in there. It is considered as a newer temple, It is included quite an ascending up to the top. It was worth it. Nice view, nice temple and a good place to take pictures where "regular" tourist does not go

Beautiful view, gorgeous climb up.. So worth the trip up to the top, flanked by trailing creepers and beautiful bells. The entrance (and shoe removal) instructions up top are a bit confusing (you really don't have to take your shoes off, where the sign says you can keep them on). Otherwise really lovely.
beautiful. beautiful temple with a great view at the top although there are a lot of stairs to climb the end result will be more than worth it as there is a beautiful view of surrounding bangkok

A Golden Find. First and foremost be sure to have good directions before departing. This is not the easiest place to locate. For whatever reason it also seems to fly under the radar with tourists with Wat Pho and the Grand Palace being so much more popular.You begin at the Golden Mount by ascending a winding staircase around this large man made mountain. The landscaping and decorations are gorgeous and as you get higher and higher you can see more and more of Bangkok. When you get to the top you can look out on one side and see all of downtown Bangkok. On the other side is the river and Thonburi. If you go inside at the top there are places to make offerings and burn incense. I will definitely go back if given the chance.

Wonderful evening !. The peaceful place in old Bangkok.It is best place for sights seeing in evening.You can also take a ferry boat from Platinum shopping mall to this place and vice versa. If you decide to come back at evening from this place to central world and siam shopping place, it better with the ferry boat because you can avoid heavy traffic and save money and time.
Spectacular!. Just spectacular and amazing! Everywhere you look the architecture takes your breath away. It is a once in a lifetime experience, unless you are Thai.

Dusk under the rain.. Came to visit this temple.Unfortunately, it rained heavy as soon as we alight the taxi.There is no shelter for the walk up the slope of the hill.Waited for the rain, till evening.With a light drizzle, we took a few photographs.But, the rain started to gets heavy. Didn't really visited this temple.Will be back, if I come to Thailand again.

Beautiful view of the city. There are lot of temples or Wat in the city of Bangkok, beside the very popular one like Wat Arun and Wat Pho, I found Wat Saket which situated on top of the golden mount is an interesting Wat to visit too.The golden mount is situated in the middle of the city and the interesting way to get to this place is to catch a local boat from the canal next to Central World mall and it only costs 20 baht to reach the destination, the journey is about 15 minutes and I have to say you can see the other side of Bangkok while traveling on the canal.Although it takes 300 steps to reach the top but the climbing is kind of easy and there is 2 stops along the way. Once you reach the top there are many Buddha statues inside the temple for prayer and the most beautiful one would be the golden reclining Buddha statue. There is a way to go to the roof top of the temple where there is a golden stupa on the top. The view from the top of the temple is beautiful where you can see few popular destination like Wat Arun, grand palace and giant swing.If you are looking for a temple to visit in Bangkok, this one is definitely highly recommended.

Great Temple...Travel to it by Canal Boat. If you are staying in Sukhumvit, get a motor-sai, to take you to the Canal Boat, as this transport service will take you to within walking distance of the Golden Mount Temple..for about 20 baht

Lovely views from the top. Built on a man-made hill, a climb to the top takes 300 steps. The gold chedi at the top houses a Buddha relic. Lovely views of the city can be seen from the high vantage point here which is the tallest spot in Bangkok.
If your going for the view fine, for the temple don't bother. Nice view made with this artificial hill. Many steps but once you reach upstairs really nothing doing.
Great view of the city.. Great view of the city. Nice breeze when you reach the top. Steps can get slippery . Refreshments available at the base.

The highest point in Bangkok. As Bangkok is very flat, this is the closest thing you get to a hill in the city, thus the short way up affords you a stunning view over the many surrounding temples and older part of the city.

Quiet and traditional. Nice and quiet traditional buddha temple on top of a hill. Stairs go round the hill 3 times. But it was worth the climb for the bells and the calm temple. Very good view of the city as well.

My favourite temple in Bangkok. This place is amazing. Beautiful and peaceful with an amazing view of Bangkok city at the top. Not too crowded with tourists as it's a bit far from the city centre so definitely worth a visit if you are into temples and cultural stuff

less crowded than the rest for the Wat in Bangkok. It is a very nice Wat to visit during the day, as it is very breezy once you reach the top and the spectacular view of the city awaits you!
This Wat also seems to be less crowded than the rest for the Wat in Bangkok.
Admission fee is 20 Baht.

Hidden Gem...so to speak!. While taller than any of the other temples or monuments, the Golden Mount is a great site with a great view. There is a climb to the top, but the view (and the breeze) is worth it. It is about 1.5 miles east of the Grand Palace. 20 THB admission.

A spiritual Island in a sea of concrete. The golden mount feels like a quiet place far away.you get to climb many stairs with nice natural view along the way.When getting into the top, you get to enjoy a very special view of bangkok and the golden bell look alike structure on the top.No big statues or anything like any other temples, but maybe that's what makes it so special.Entrance fee - 20 Bhat

Overlooked beauty. I always pay a visit when in Bangkok with my Family. It's simply a must do.This beautiful and easely overlooked temple complex is overlooked by many, where more widely know temples such as Wat Po or Wat Trimitr attract more visitors. They don't realise what they miss. What many not realise is the quitness away from the buzzing Bangkok streets and one of the most beatiful views over Bangkok from the top, combined with the nice walk upstairs. Wat Saket, or Golden Mount as it is called marks the border beween the old centre and the more modern part of Bangkok. It is easy accessibele with bus Connecting Lines 8, 15, 37, 47, 169 or by taxi, tuktuk. Admission used to be free, but recently 20 Baht entrance is required. Cheap drinks, snacks and icecream are available upstairs in the main building. Even a nice gardenstyle coffeespot has sprung up, where you can sit, drink and relax. Upstairs don't forget to pay a visit to the top structure, a big golden stupa or dome, wich gives this temple it's English nickname. It's accessible through the small stair in the coner. Mind you're head, as it is quit small and low ceiled. If you're lucky a processing is taking place, wich gives insight to the way Thais practice their religion. To avoid the heat while climbing bring an umbrella with you, like the Thais do, or visit the temple in the morning or afternoon hours.

Like a huge golden bell. Wat Saket looks like a huge golden bell and is one of the main attractions in Bangkok not to be missed... The walk up the hill is very nice due to the scenic grounds and the view from the top over Bangkok is very worth the way up.
Great view of Bangkok. I found this through a tuk tuk driver, but we ended up seeing a great view of Bangkok. the entrance fee was only 20 baht.
Nice view. The walk up to the temple is lined with planted boarders, running water and statues and is very appealing. The view from the top is spectacular. Well worth a visit.

Temple after temple.... Quite a climb... In the heat, it was intense but the views were worth it! I would recommend doing this when visiting Bangkok, it was no where near as busy as other temples we visited.

Really good place to take picture.. The Golden Mount is a really great place to take a picture. Gold with blue sky as a background, it's amazing. It's a bit of climb to this place, but not to worry, as long as your pants is comfortable, you are alright. It can get a bit humid, so make sure you wear a breathable clothing. It's only 50 Bahts, and you get to ring the Gong preceded by a prayer, which locals say will help what you pray for comes true.

Good views of Bangkok from beautiful temple.. I went to the Golden Mount about a week ago while staying at Nat2 near the Banglumphu post office. The temple is an easy walk from Khaosan Road. It is only 20baht entry and has beautiful statues and water features on the way up. There are announcements telling visitors not to remove shoes incase they get stolen. There are also signs that when raining the steps are slippery. A good view can be obtained from the summit. There are cold drinks available, which are needed after climbing to the top and back.

Golden Mount viewing point and temple Bangkok. I was trying to look for something free to do in Bangkok and came across this. Really close to Koh San, I walked and did in 30 mins. The steps aren't that big and can be done by most people. The view is lovely. Definitely worth a trip, took me about 40 mins to complete. Only 20 baht. A time filler!

Beautiful!. This is a quiet but beautiful temple which seems to miss most tourists' itineraries. It is located amidst a lot of greenery in a rather quiet street in Bangkok. The temple is well maintained and has a modest entry fee of 20 Baht. The top of the temple provides a good view of Bangkok, and the area near the shrine or the rooftop can be used to peacefully meditate for a few minutes.
Nice location. Interesting place. Love it as you can have a city view from around 30-50 meters high spot plus the attraction of the enormous golden status.

Great views all round on the roof. The Wat Saket sign outside gives no indication of how lovely it is within the compound. A few steps to get to the top but they're really shallow and not difficult. The whole place is well kept and you can take a lot of great pictures here. Going up the stairs, you'll pass by bells, water features, benches, and more. At the top there are more statues to view and a shop you can buy souvenirs at. Another little oasis in the middle of the city and one of the most sacred places in Thailand.

Stunning views well worth the climb. Another gem in Bangkok! Visited here on the recommendation of a tuk tuk driver. Excellent and very ornate. Quite a quick one to tick off the list too only took us 30 minutes to walk up and down again stopping for photos etc. Not overly crowded and the gong is great fun! :) great value at only 20B pp

Amazing views from the top. The climb up to the top (318 steps) is very nice, along the way you can enjoy statues, bells (that attract good luck) and small gardens. The views from the top of this temple are especially interesting because it is located between the old and the modern area of Bangkok, which from its top you can see the two distinct areas. Not too touristy so it is common to see Thai people praying in the temple. Wat Saket is just 15-20 minutes walking from Khao San Road and it only costs 20 THB. Open from 8.00 to 17.00
Beautiful. Everything I saw in Bangkok was stunning, and I think all the glistening of the gold is awesome in the sunshine.
Local Fellings. Great place with strong energy and amazing view from Bangkok, was really nice ring the bells during the way and fell a bit part of that rich cultura.Thailand is a magical place.

On top of a hill in Bangkok need I say more. Beautiful view of the city and temple on top of a mountain. Went there with a friend. Good exercise also :). We took the free tuk-tuk I suggest don't fall for it they will take you to ruby market and all that (as part of taking you to temples for free, it's kind of a gem advertisement, I guess) but be careful if you don't know how to handle them they will rip you off in the gem market and you will end up paying a lot more than you would actually pay for either the gem or the tuk tuk. Word of caution, if you are taking free ride don't buy anything in the places they take you to. Aside, the temple is very beautiful and more beautiful is the view of the city from the top. A must see location.
Great view of the city!. One of the best views of the city! Prepare to walk alot of steps to the top!! The golden chedi is really awesome. There are alot of big bells to ring for good luck.
Nice temple. Best thing to do is just take a taxi and go to the top. Great mountain and peaceful temple. Worth a visit!

Cool temple. The walk up the mountain up to the top of the temple is definitely not as bad as it looks. Remember to be careful f it is rainy because the stairs are a little slippery. From the top you can see the entire city and there is even free wifi for those of you who want to rub the fact that you are chilling in bangkok in your friends' faces.
Good views. This is an interesting place to visit and the area around it feels different to a lot of the city. Loads of market stalls around the base and good views of the city

Great views. Only costs 20 baht to get in. Walk to the top via a spiral stairway. Unlike other temples there is a voice recording encouraging tourists to keep their shoes on. Fantastic views of the city from all directions at the top. Took great photos from there.

Great Views. I happened to just randomly stumble across Wat Saket when I was catching a bus trying to get to Grand Palace, and to my surprise, it has stunning views of Bangkok from the top and offers you a place to shelter and rest from the day's heat. You must climb up a series of steps that spiral around the Wat, similar to that of a mountain hence the name Golden Mountain. It is air conditioned too and throughout most of the day you will find many of the local people come here to pray, its a beautiful thing to witness. From the top the views are absolutely stunning on a sunny day, giving you a great panoramic view of Bangkok city's skyline and the greater plains in the background. Well worth the trek up if you're keen on great views.
Not bad - Good view up top. Not bad for one of our first Temple visits View from the top was great!Would recommend a visit... Would only take an hour or two

ET Phone Home. I don't know what happened. I got off a ferry boat, my cloths soaked through with some kind of toxic smelling mud. I smelled like a pulp mill. The next thing I know I'm walking through an overexposed zodiac garden and a man in a yellow outfit beckons me to a staircase. I climb. The ascent is a lazy one bedecked with bells and fake rocks, gongs and statues of some foreign deity, the likes of which I've never seen before or since. The climb ends at the mouth of a great room, signs kindly remind you to keep your shoes on. The covered area is a welcome respite from the nuclear sun's penetrating rays, however brief it was. The climb continues to the roof: a decorated slab with a massive antenna painted gold. I can only imagine that this was some kind of ancient device used to communication with extraterrestrials that utilized some technology that we in the present day have long lost. It just makes you realize, as you look at the city below in all it's shades of brown, just how little goes into antenna aesthetics these days. They don't make 'um like they used to.
interesting and relaxed. relaxed temple with the shape of a mountain with nice views over the city, everything is in its proper place
A bit off the Beaten Path. Amazing views and plenty of opportunities for photos. Go in the late afternoon for the best views and to avoid tour busses. Seems to attract many local thai people.

Best attraction in bangkok. Amazing experience with fantastic views of Bangkok from the top of the temple. We caught the the canal boat from the Asoke stop for 13 baht. A great way to travel through the city.
Peaceful. Great views, and a relaxed atmosphere.Try to go at sunset it's absolutely beautiful. Go here before you get temple fatigue! :)

Fairly Good Wat. The Golden Mount, like all the other major sites in Bangkok, are on the beaten path, so they are easily discovered. However, the crowds can get a bit much at times, and the weather can make for a diminished experience if you are not properly prepared.

Authentic Thai Experience. I decided to visit the Golden Mount as it seemed to me that if nothing else one would get an excellent and very different view of Bangkok from the top. I was not disappointed. I visited on my own and was pleased to see that it was being visited by mainly local Thais and was certainly not crowded with tourists. I enjoyed to walk to the top and felt that I was engaging in and experience that I was sharing with locals.

Very good. We found our way here without a tour and found this to be a treat. We loved the piece full serenity of the attraction and enjoyed sharing the climb with Monks and tourists in equal measure. It only cost about 20 baht to get in and the cafe was lovely. Remember to tak your shoes off if you go inside the Budda temple at the top.Worth a trip by taxi, rather than a tour.
Great view. Best temple in Bangkok. Lots of tradition and monks and a very good feel to it. Just beware the tuk-tuks outside, they prey on guests and it's always a scam.

Excellent views of Bangkok.. The Golden Mount temple is literarily atop a mountain. So, its both a test of endurance as you climb each step leading up to it. It's rewarding when you reach the top, though, with excellent views of neighborhoods where the real Bangkok lives.

Loved this place!. This was a nice little surorise. I has no expectations no it other than its was going to talé me a while to get up but its not haré at all even in the heat. Hace such nice views of bangkok and the way up os entertaining.

Best temple in bangkok. Definitely worth a look. I took a canal ferry boat from Bodega Bangkok (amazing ride there on the boat) after they recommended and I agree it's the best in the city. Very nice view, well kept, a lot of monks and culture. Nice pamoramic view.

Great views of Bangkok. It's probably best not to visit here during the middle of the day, as there is quite a number of steps to walk up which I imagine would be unpleasant during the hottest parts of the day.Once you have walked to the top of the temple you get to enjoy a panoramic view of Bangkok. Whilst I don't think the view could be described as 'pretty' it's definitely worth going up to see.
Well worth your time.. If you like ringing bells and hiking up a mountain with an awesome view of old Bangkok, this is your place.
Okay Wat. The Golden Mount itself is okay. I found the fake mist to be too contrived.The temple behind the mount is better because there are no people and therefore it's peaceful.
worth to see. As all of the cultural places I ever visited in Bangkok, this is worth to see and visit, check out the surrounding as well.

Worth the walk. Be prepared to walk over 300 steps but have to say it is well worth the effort. The view from the top is wonderful, You can also purchase holy water from the monks at the base of the steps.

Just the right amount of kitsch . The Golden Mountain is indeed a man made mountain with a golden temple on top. I went for the view, which is spectacular. And my girlfriend enjoyed the flowers. There are 300 something steps but the climb isn't strenuous and the view is worth it.

Tranquil temple with a view!. The Golden Mountain is literally just that, a man made peak in the centre of Bangkok. The temple grounds are serene and peaceful. It was a mild trek up the winding staircase of Wat Saket, but well worth it. Ring the bronze bells along the way, and enjoy the amazing 360 views of Bangkok at the top.

worth the climb. I went a few years ago, and found it a good vantage point once you reached the top. You can ring the bells for good luck, or toss the sticks for you fortune. I enjoyed the vista the most, and enjoyed seeing monks from outside coming to pay respects.

humble experience. This is quite special, once the highest point in Bangkok on a man made mountain with a temple aloft. Its fun to catch the local canal ride to the temple, to walk up the 300 + steps and then take in the view from the rooftop at the base of the large chedi, see our pics and video in thaibis directory goo.gl/HrBxpt

Worth a visit since convenient. Wat Saket is easy to get to either from Khaosan area or from Siam area (by bus or tuk tuk). Bus 47 passes by here. You can also use the Khlong Saen Saep river boat service and walk a <1km distance.This is on a little hill where you can overlook some of Bangkok city. The golden mount itself is quite beautiful, but I would say that the view itself is probably worth a visit.

Fun for an hour. The Golden Mount is 20baht to enter, very pretty and an easy way to spend an hour or so around the Khao San Road area. You have great views from the top and it's usually not too crowded.

Wat Saket ( Golden Mount ). Just take a river boat from Pratunam pier and get down in the last stop at Panfa Lilat pier. Fare is only 9 baht one way. From the Panfa Lilat pier you can see the temple. Take a walk over the bridge for about 8 minutes you will see the temple on your left. Climb the stairs up to the top and you will have a good view of Bangkok. The temple structure is unique and very peaceful inside the temple. There are lots of bells along the steps to the top. Highly recommended to go in the evening for the sunset view. Visited on 28.6.2015

Highlight of Bangkok - great view from on top. Our experience at Wat Saket was rather great, and mainly due to the number of locals praying for what I think was a celebration prior to full moon or some other festival. The place provides great views of the city. Highly recommend it, and to do it as one of the first places to see in Bangkok.
A calm & Serene Place. A very enriching experience when you visit this beautiful place. The architecture is worth commending

Particular place. This temple is very characteristic. Be prepared to go though many steps before reaching the top (which makes it not too crowded at least!). On the top you have an overview of the city - very recommended
inspiring. very nice place , amazing view and nice peopleinspiring place go there to get some silent from the busy thailnad streets.

Worth a visit. We went there via Tuk Tuk and not really knowing anything about it were pleasantly surprised. It is interesting, with great views of Bangkok. Being able to ring the bells and beat the drums (respectfully) was an added bonus.

A little bit of everything... This was a cool wat to see in the city. Easy to get to and nice view of the whole city once you're at the top. Bells, gongs, monks, and buddha's, what more can you ask for :)
great view. go on a clear day to get a good view of bangkok city. go crazy ringing the bells as u climb the steps to the top. make sure u make a stop at wat suket down the hill too.
Good Hill climb. This is a cool temple with a difference. The walk is gentle and beautiful. The temple is different and view is great. Well worth the effort

A beautiful temple in the middle of Bangkok with a view.. A beautiful little temple with many bells, a glorious golden stupa and quite a few steps to reach the top but well worth it, lovely gardens and a serene place to be. Good view across Bangkok. Charms / amulets available to purchase.This temple is easy to walk to from the Banglampu area and is easily reached by a klong (canal) boat (an experience in itself) from near the National Statium BTS, klong boat stop called Tha Saphan Hua Chang.

Not really impressive. nothing much but only one temple in the hill with great view. This place is not symbolic or outstanding either. Many taxi drivers have no idea about Wat Saket, until you pronounce the name precisely.
Nice views of Bangkok. A short climb of this place will give you some nice views of the city. Was a very hot day so the climb was a little uncomfortable, but was definitely worth it

Wonderful views!. Wat Saket is a must see in Bangkok! We caught a taxi to The Grand Palace and walked. The journey was long, and in the heat, can be quite tiresome, however, by doing this, we were able to include a few different stops at other temples on the way. If you can find a 'Robinson' brand map of the city, it will show you street names and where to find various temples, and this made our day a lot easier. The grounds themselves are very tranquil and were a lot less crowded than I expected. At the top, the views of the city are amazing, and make great photo opportunities, which makes the tiny entrance fee well worth it.There are lots of stairs, so it might not be an ideal site for less-mobile people, and I was disappointed that I could not find a suitable souvenir. Definitely worth prioritising during your site-seeing adventures though!

Great views from the top. The site itself was a bit disappointing - there doesn't really appear to be much to do or see here as you're going up (there is a pleasant cafe on the way and some bells and gongs set in verdant greenery which broke the walk up a bit). I was ready to write it off, but once you get to the top you'll see it was all worthwhile for the tiny amount of baht you'd have parted with. There are great views of the city in all directions and it is well worth spending a bit of time up here just to take in how amazing Bangkok is.

Amazing Temple to Visit. Amazing trip I had here when I visited this nice temple. Grand Palace has an entrance fee of THB500 (USD$17) , and it will take you 2 hours to tour around the whole place and one of the temples is the Golden Mount (Wat Saket). Amazing temple to visit!Read my BLOG to know more about my journey here:http://olympusgirlinsg.blogspot.sg/2013/03/2013-asian-trip.html

Amazing but touristy. It was absolutely amazing, beautiful views and gourgeous architecture. Received a blessing from a monk and bracelet. Was worth every penny spent to visit. I would absolutely go back, in fact I may ha received a blessing from a monk and bracelet. Was worth every penny spent to visit. I would absolutely go back, be to go back because my camera battery died when I was there... Too many beautiful things to take photos of!

Nice stupa with a view. It's a different than the other tourist attractions. I liked the bells on the way up and down. The garden around is beautiful and we'll kept. The view was alright but midday the rooftop is incredibly hot. Lot of monks running around making it a good spot to take some nice photos. We had a good visit. For once not same same :)

Lovely view. The golden mount is a lovely walk up to the top with great views of Bangkok, definitely worth it! However don't trust the tuktuk drivers they will say the mount is closed in the morning for a special ceremony and ask you to go somewhere else so they can drive you, but they are lying the golden mount is always open all day!
Nice views. It was really quiet when we went, very tranquil and few tourists! Very pleasant views of the surrounding areas.

Worth a look. A must see as you are sight seeing really special
Also tie in with the grand palace. Bit of a walk which I didnt like but the view was worth it
Great views of the river & city.. Plenty of space, hardly anyone touting for business, and if you climb to the top you are rewarded with excellent views of the river and city.

Tranquil Temple. Wat Saket is at the base of the Golden Mount. It is very quiet and peaceful. The interior walls are decorated with subtle coloured murals. I don't recommend visiting, rather enjoy the sites and activities the Golden Mount offers.

The Incredible Place In Bangkok .. This temple is beautiful, its surroundings are beautiful, lots of trees, plants, flowers, sometimes it feels like your climbing a temple in the jungle. climbing the temple was so much fun, and reaching the top, you are rewarded with great views, this is one of my favorite temples I went to.Will be there again very soon on my next holiday in Bangkok .GRS Victor Try

Magical mountain. There is something very magical about this mountain.... You climb slowly up the stairs and discover this very nice temple on the top.A lot of greenery everywhere... Something that totally made this place so lovely.I'm totally going to keep coming back...
Lovely view of the city. For just 100 Baht, it's a nice walk or climb to the top for fantastic blue skies, city skyline and fresh air. It is a simple place but worth your time for a short visit.

Very Beautiful....... It was a little trek up some stairs to get to the Golden Mount, but it was worth it. Along the way up you have several different statues and areas to take some pictures. Once you get to the top its really beautiful and nice views. Overall a very relaxing experience.......

A staircase to heaven?!!. We have visited Bangkok on several occasions and have seen the Golden Mount from one or two of our hotel windows. In May 2015, we decided to take the canal boat from Pratunam to the Golden Mount as it looked easy to get there looking at the map. A helpful local pointed us in the right direction and from there it was in fact easy to find. The walk from the boat pier was only about 5 or 10 minutes and a small entry fee gave us access to a moderate number of steps that wound around the hill and eventually up to the top. On the way up were a number of interesting stops with a variety of religious statues, gongs and relics to admire including the three wise monkeys!The top was accessible via a narrow staircase with a 360 degree walk around view of Bangkok and a refreshing breeze to help with the heat. We thoroughly enjoyed this trip that cost us less than a 100baht as the canal boat only cost us 9baht each way!! Who needs guided tours? Nearby are a number of government buildings, broad, clean streets (boulevards?) and impressive buildings.Well worth our morning out.

Great Temple, but be warned!. This is a great temple to visit but be aware of a scam being run outside the temple. You will be approached by a local, very friendly acting kind and wanting to help you with your plans. He will offer you a deal that is unbeatable. But it is too good to be true. This scam is known as the Bangkok Export Centre scam. Don't believe anyone saying the temple is closed or anything like that just go to the temple and enjoy the walk up the stairs. Make sure to stop and ring the bells. The view from the top is fantastic!

Beautiful! Try an alternate route :). This was a fun Wat to visit and hike up! Loved all the bells you can ring on the way up and down as well as the view of the city from the top. To get there (not by taxi), take the canal boat near the Jim Thompson House (a must see!) several stops and get off near the bridge. Cross the bridge and walk down the street until you see a sign (or a crowd) for the Wat. Simple, a fun experience, and saw a different part of Bangkok! Oh, and did I mention that it was mere pennies to get there?? :)

Beautiful View, Very Nice. I felt a great sense of calmness at this Temple. The monks offer a handmade string bracelet to you as you enter at the top. The bells were very cool and relaxing to hear as well. Not a huge Temple, but nice enough to visit and experience and it is not the hustle and bustle of the other larger Temples.

ok but nothing wow. It was ok to go there and its worth the 20baht you spent. but the view is ok nothing spectacular as everyone describes it. there are many more interesting places to visit instead if you have very limited time in Bangkok.

lot of steps but amazing view. Walking all the way up, worth for a view! Cheap get in- 20 bhat . Once arrive the top, very pretty to see 360 of bangkok! Make sure you bring drinj=k with you as it is very hot.

Big golden bell. This place is quite far from Wat Pho and the Grand Palace. However, if you happen to be in this area, I recommend you to pay a visit. The entrance fee is only 20 bhat and by climbing some stairs you can get to the top of this building. The golden mount is huge and on the terrace one can have a great view of the entire city

peaceful visit. compare to other temples (wat) in BKK , this temple is quiet; not many visitors. u have to walk a bit to reach the top ( many stairs) but once u arrive above the view is nice ... for accomplishing your wishes, u have to walk 3 times around the Golden Chedi. after your visit, don't miss to take the boat along the river.... very peaceful, even if the water is not specially clean . u can see how the people really live along the klongs. by the way very cheap... 9 bahts from the Golden Mount till Jim Thompson's house
Huge golden wonder. very huge and you can see on the way. when you see city tour you can enjoy on the way from your vehicle also.

Sanctuary in the city. The Golden Mount is literally just that, situated in a protected grounds in the center of chaotic Bangkok. The grounds are quiet and peaceful, and you ascend a small hill to get to the actual site. Once inside, you climb higher to the top of the temple to amazing 360 views of Bangkok. Must do.
WOW!!. The day I visited upon getting to the top I noticed a complete circular rainbow in the sky. It just added to the nice view of Bangkok

Blissful Mount ❤ ❤ ❤. This mount is “Top of the Bangkok” Absolutely Blissful with Fabulous views ,If you want 360 degree view of Bangkok , this is the place for you to enjoy the beauty of all the Wats and other important tourist attractions near by.We went there on 20.05.15 with my 2children , we have to climb steps to reach the top , it is very easy , even though the climate is very hot , they have made arrangements to sprinkle water and the whole environment is like a hill station.Must visit for all age groups when you are in Bangkok.Thanks a lot for everything...Loving you so much...Peacefully yours...S M Bega Raaj.Happy travelling...

Impressive temple with amazing views. This temple cost me 20 Baht to enter which is very cheap compared to others. It involves quite a lot of stairs to get to the top but makes it more rewarding, I just wouldn't recommend doing it in the mid day sun. Once at the top Wat Saket is very impressive and from here you can view Bangkok for as far as the eye can see - 360 degrees.
Best in Bangkok. Great place to visit!! Not crowded by tourist! Great view of Bangkok! Beautiful and peaceful! Entrance only 20 bath! Definitely worth the visit!!!

Amazing view of Bangkok city. I walk to Wat Saket from the giant swing area. It took about 10 - 15 mins to arrive. The 318 steps of staircase wasn't that scary as being said. There are chairs for you to rest if it matter. Once you reach the entrance of the golden mountain, spectacular view and strong wind blows away all your tiredness.Spend some time here to read some history and see Buddha's statue. Another small staircase will lead you to the top of the mountain, the golden pagoda stately build and you can see Buddhist doing prayer there. You may walk along the pagoda 3 times in clockwise direction as a blessing.

Nice place. Golden Mount is made on top of a small hill with about 345 steps to climb. steps are so comfortable you actually feel walking on them. There are beautiful spots designed for relaxing and are very picturesque, Its a must go place. There are cafes and souvenir shops also.
Excellent views of Bangkok. Lovely walk up and good views of Bangkok at the top. There is also a cafe part way up or down for a stop.

Nice walk up and great views. This was not my favorite site but I am glad I went. The walk is for the able and nice enough. A quick look around at the Buddha's and views is entertaining. If you have time I would go - but it is not a must. The very nearby free Palace Museum (with airco +++) was ver informative and made this excursion more worthy.

Take your time..... Think hot, humid Bangkok day, and long slow walk around the Golden Mount to the top. Had a chat to a few locals, there's even a Golden Mount Cafe, who do a great chilled coffee. To get there it's near one of the canals, so you can catch a long boat. Get off and go immediately left, over bridge.
The golden mountain. Oh their are plenty of stairs to climb to get to this one but once you get to the top the views are amazing.
Great views!. a good climb up but the views and golden buddas are worth the trip. 20bhat (40p) entry. I felt there was a big emphasis on money and asking locals for donations.

Easy walk to top, great views. Similar to other temples but just as gorgeous. My favorite part was all I the bells throughout. Quick walk to the top resulting in great views of the city. It was a little difficult to find the entrance to the temple from the side streets, but manageable.

Must visit. Although this temple is a little out of the way, it is definitely worth the visit. It is near the famous Khaosan vicinity. The climb to the top may seem intimidating at first, but it is actually pretty smooth and easy and manageable. Once you reach the top of the temple, you are rewarded with an amazing view of Bangkok city !
Offers an Aerial View. An aerial view of the vicinity is the reward for climbing up a lot of steps. The entrance fee is 40THB which makes it a relatively cheap attraction to visit.
Beautiful. This is an absolutely beautiful place to visit. I was lucky to get a guide to help me. Incredibly crowded, lots of crowds, but everyone was very pleasant

Something New to discover. I loved the walk around the outside of the temple, the shrine's at the top, the bells arousing the spirits along the way - absolutely beautiful and a fantastic view from the top - All though their are stairs all the way they are very well paced and not a "mission"

Bells and Gongs. On your way to the temple at the top of the hill you are implicitly invited to ring bells and hammer gongs --interactive temple tourism!Don't miss the Golden Mount Coffee Shop frequented by monks halfway to the top.

Golden mountain. Beautiful temple and must visit. Temple is on the hill which gives a nice view of the city from the top. Try visiting during day time for visibility. They charge an entry fee to the temple which in my opinion is incorrect though it is for maintenance purpose.
Great View of Area. This was a fun trek that we did. Very beautiful scenery and was able to meet some great Buddha Monks. Once you make it to the top it was an amazing view!
a little disappointed. doesn't compare to some of the other attractions within a very short distance, terrific view from the top

Interesting. It was okay. Liked the view a lot and the decor of the staircase and the gongs but nothing immensely special. I wouldn't go again if I had something more interesting to do. But it was nice.
An unmissable attraction. The Royal Palace is unbelievable, its history, art and architecture is amazing, no one should go to Bangkok and not take in this amazing place
Another tourist place. It's a thing you have to see, but don't waste your time hanging there to long. Look, take some pictures and go the the next place :)

A Must Visit. This is another nice temple which is less known to tourist. I visited this temple because it is near my hostel so I thought why not. The entrance is only 20 baht and you will have to hike up a flight of stairs but along the way there are attractive things to see. They even have a cafe along the way up so you can have a chilling session there. It was windy when I visited the area and when you reach the temple, you can have a bird's view of Bangkok. Its really picturesque especially during sunset time. Had a good time here. Highly recommended
Great view, big gongs. Came here for views during loy kratong. Very crowded but great views and there are quite a few giant gongs you can ring throughout your journey around.

The Pinnacle. Set aside an hour and try to get there before the heat of the day. great gardens on the walk to the top, also prayer bells and a sense of calm that follows you to the glorious spired dome. View is awesome, but the reverence that the Buddhists show is something to behold

One of the best views of the old town. We found this place by accident on the 1st day we arrived in Bangkok and it was such a great find!! Especially because we caught the sunset right by the time we reached the top! The entrance is 20 THB btw
Lovely. If u like Temple and Architectural work. Must include Wat Saket in your tour list.U can have photographed here and in near by place.
A must visit. If you like visiting museums, temples, etc. this place is a must visit. The golden pagoda we call it is amazing. From afar, it seems the golden pagoda is a real gold......Nice one!

Excellent views on the roofs of Bangkok ;-) ... Go there. Not far from Loha Prasat very interesting place to visit in Bangkok. I remember flowers , bells , funny modern statues on the way.interesting temple at the top and the great view on the roofs of Bangkok. The conclusion: the sea of poverty with the islands of well protected roofs of temples and palaces.

Golden biggest pagoda in Bangkok. You can visit golden biggest pagoda in Bangkok that are located in Wat Sakret. Interestingly, inside these pagoda there are the bones of Buddha. Moreover, along the way to go to the top of the pagoda, there are a lot of the bells for Buddhist to ring and you can see the city view from the top of this pagoda.

Great views over Bangkok city!. Going up to the top of Wat Saket is a must do when you visit Bangkok, as it provides amazing views over the city. The grounds it is set in are also nice to walk around, there is some great temples and sculptures.

Worth a look but not a "must see". We whizzed down the canal to it on a klong from the Jim Thompson House, went up, came down, and came back on the klong. We probably enjoyed the klong rides more than the climb up the Mount! The views are good, but we didn't think there was much to see.

This was an Incredible experience. This temple is beautiful, its surroundings are beautiful, lots of trees, plants, flowers, sometimes it feels like your climbing a temple in the jungle. climbing the temple was so much fun, and reaching the top, you are rewarded with great views, this is one of my favourite temples I went to.

A Quick tour!. Our hostel was located near the Golden Mount so we decided to check it out. A quick and cheap tour, the view of Bangkok from the top is worth it! You get to chime the bells and learn about Thai culture. Took about 20 minutes.

different and pretty. I have been to Bangkok several times but I did not know "The Golden Mount" existed. It gives great views of the city. It is a perfect grade climb so it is easy and steady. I really enjoyed it.
Nice view . Nice view and walk ways with flower and plants. When we visit last time it not that much crow and great walk around the pagoda too.
Day visit. Very good view from the top and only 20 baht hard work climbing the many steps in the cast heat but no pain no gain

Nice place. We went there by taxi, should told the taxi driver that go to "Wat Saket". Or take a boat trip from Pratunam Pier and get off at Phan Fa Lilat station. 20baht admission fee. Easy to walk up hill. Great view from there. And after visiting here, you can go to King Prajadhipok Museum, Rattanakosin Exhibition Hall, Wat Ratchanatda etc.

Amazing surprise . We reach this temple by accident. Is that kind of place that is amazing to see by the sunset. The ticket is 20 thb. The temple is at the top of a small hill. Takes about 4 min to reach the top. Beautiful statues along the way. Really refreshing (fake) waterfalls, once you up there the view is amazing. Specially if you are a couple at the sunset. One of the best palaces I've been in Bangkok. For the price is a really good bargain.

Time to reflect. This is such a peaceful place to get away from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. We went at 5pm and it was a lovely walk to the top. You can also get a good view of the city in day light and as it becomes dark. The sun set is beautiful. Monks also come to meditate and it's lovely to watch them. Worth a trip

Nice route to the top... It is a small temple at the top. Entrance ticket will be 20 Bhat. The route has got some water sprays to compensate the hot weather in Bangkok. Not much an attraction if you have visited the Wht Pho earlier.

Pure relaxation and a great view over Bangkok. I loved this place. Entirely! The way to it, the place itself, the music which is guiding your steps on the paths up, the terrace where the wat is, the view, the bells, everything. This is a must!

one of the oldest temples of the city. Visiting temples and attractions "old town" in Bangkok, we were already full of impressions, and not a lot of tired. The final in our list was the Temple of the Golden Mount - Wat Saket.Frankly, I was immediately fascinated by it. Quiet, calm, a small number of tourists. There was a feeling that we were in an enchanted kingdom.Temple of the Golden Mount, one of the oldest temples of the city. It is built on a manmade hill, 80 meters high, and later was built on top of the 18 meter high golden stupa.
Not bad.. If you have time to spare then go.Otherwise do not. Walk upwards and have good views but not must see item.Skip if you have less time.

Go...or Don't. I think this one depends mostly on time and weather. It is quite a ways to get up there and it is somewhat awesome when you are at the top, but that's about it. It is not as big as the pictures would suggest, but the view from the top can, most likely, be stunning but only of you catch it at the right time of day.

Go after 2pm very peaceful and quiet.. The stairs are nothing to be scared about, were relatively unfit and we made it no troubles, various monuments and gongs to gong the way up and there you can rest. The golden mount has a nice ambience at the top good views of Bangkok and many people praying.

Cool spot. One thing I love about Wat Saket is the name (the Golden Mount) because I imagined at the very least a big hill. This being Bangkok (flat), that was not in the cards. I love the neighbourhood around here with lots of small shops and restaurants. It's most interesting to go on a holiday as there will be many people making merit. No one will be offended if you join in.

Amazing sightseeing, nice place to visit.. This place had a wonderful sightseeing, you can see nearly the whole city from the top of the temple. It takes about 15 mins from Khao San Rd to walk there, then go upstairs and enjoy fresh air with wind, sunshine, and sightseeing.
