Nice view from the top. Entry fee 20 bath/pers. Nice view from the top (the man-made hill used to be the highest point in the city). Liked the bells & gongs along the way. Moving story about cholera outbreaks in the early 19th century.
Nice view. A nice temple, but definitely not a must see. We climbed up the stairs and enjoyed the view over the city.

Bangkok culture. Took the kids here on our second visit to Bangkok ( we went to Golden Palace the first time) great place, amazing views, bit of a climb on a very, very hot day ( take water) interesting place but very busy
Another interesting Temple. Climb the stairs to the top to see the Temple and relaxing view of Bangkok. Just bring water and camera

Bangkok's most underrated attraction?. We visited the Golden Mount on a Marriott Navigator's recommendation. We loved it! I believe we were the only tourists there at the time. The climb to the top is several hundred small stairs but it is interesting all the way, with statues, gongs, bells and other Buddhist items. The view from the top is excellent and the Buddhas at the top are beautiful.
Nice view but more of the same. . This is one of the nicest temple I've seen. With English written boards. Decently worth it. You can atleast spend 1 hour there. More than enough

Go for the views. Golden Mount is a quiet place in the middle of a busy area. It is quite an easy climb as the steps are shallow, nevertheless it is along way up if you aren't fit. Well worth the effort though as the views from the top are stunning. Lots of interesting bells and gongs on the way up and a rather strange area of "sky" burials on the way down. Very peaceful and a nice place just to sit and contemplate. Definitely a no go if you have a walking impairment

Great views from the top. It's a must visit temple, you climb up high to the top of this man made mountain where there is a pagoda containing the Buddha's relics. Great views It's not far from Kaosan road, just get a taxi there, so no excuse, not to. Thai people call it the golden mountain temple

Temple with a view. Before climbing up to the Golden Mount you can visit the Wat Saket school with the consecrated convocation hall in which a service was held when we visited it early in the morning. A few nice buddha's and a beautiful courtyard which was almost empty and had a nice view on the Golden Mount.It is an easy and entertaining climb to the top. On the way up you see a lot of little statues, small waterfalls, a row of bells. On the top more buddha's and a good view over Bangkok.

Nice monument with amazing view. After the Grand Palace and Wat Pho this is a must be in Bangkok. Quite hidden and far from the crowd the surroundings have some nice Thai style buildings. It begins with a walk all the way up to the golden Bell. It´s not a boring walk as several nice statues, big bells and a relaxing voice guides you through the walk.Up at th end of the hill there's a small shrine inside the building and going further up to the rooftop you find this big golden bell.The view from there 360º of Bangkok is amazing.
Such a beautiful place. Last time we were in thailand we didnt go here but this time I am glad we did what a spectacular place. It is a must go !

real nice temple. for temples lover this one will be a major stop over. it is so charming and the surrounding quite beautiful. i was under the charm of the golden stuppa and the people over there are extremely kind and helpful. full Buddhist experience.

Worth the walk up the steps.. Stunning landmark in the middle of the city and well worth visiting. Be prepared to climb up and around the Mount - the views are great. Beware unscrupulous tuk tuk drivers telling you everywhere is shut or trying to take you to tailors or tourist offices!

A Must Visit of the Bangkok Wats. We always visit Wat Saket because of the wonderful ambiance and terrific view of Bangkok below. Being higher than the surrounding area, the winds cools and enhances the experience. This Wat is quite spiritual with Monks often visiting even posing for photos or taking photos for tourists.
Nice place. Small Buddhist temple on top of hill. Very quiet place in central Bangkok. Great viewpoint for free (or you can pay to money box if you want).

Great view over the city.. After seeing a few temples it becomes more or less similar, but the golden mountain was a bit of a surprise (as we took a tuck tuck from temple to temple and didn't quite know what to expect... By the way, don't take tuck tuck tours, they're all scams and just trying to get you to tailors/fashion factory's or stuff like that)We paid a little admission, some 10 baht or something, and began to climb up the stairs. From the top you'll have a great 360 degree view over the surrounding area.

Huge and definitely golden. The Golden Mount (Wat Saket) is located just outside the old city limits and has an interesting history. In the 19th Century, King Rama III tried to build a large chedi on the site to mark the entrance to the city. Unfortunately, the marshy soil in the locality could not support the large structure and it collapsed and became an overgrown pile of rubble. Later, Rama IV built a small chedi housing a Buddha relic on top. It was rebuilt again towards the end of the nineteenth century when an Indian viceroy (Lord Curzon), made a gift of a Buddha relic.There are about 300 very short but not too strenuous steps to climb to the top, where you have a 360 degree view of Bangkok. The building itself is large and rather plain and in the centre lies shrine which is encased in many layers of gold leaf. There are some amazing prayer bells around the perimeter. Be sure to ring them they sound amazing.Getting to the Golden Mount is a bit difficult because it is not near the Skytrain. This makes is a special place to visit because it is off the main tourist routes. As a result it is usually a very peaceful and tranquil place to visit. Try taking the Chaophraya Express Boat to the Memorial Bridge pier, and walk (about 1.5 k) or take tuk-tuk or taxi from there.
Great view, fresh air.. Go there for a fresh look on Bangkok. Have been there numerous times and like it a lot. Can also recommend Wat Traimit if your looking for a good view and solitude.

Nice place to spend NOTHING-TO-DO day.. Spend my nothing-to-do afternoon there since its 15 mins walk away from Khao San road where I stay. Nothing much to see, just another temple. Looks like Wat Phnom in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

Good views on the city. The Golden Mount can be accessed if you take the water ferry till the last stop and walk for about 10 minutes. There are street food vendors outside the entrance (but of average quality) if you need to eat a soup, fruits or dessert.There is a long flight of stairs to the top that leads you to a very large gold stuppa where you can observe parts of the city. Nice to see, but not on my list of must-dos in the city.

Songkran Festival. Today is Thailand famous Songkran festival (water festival). As a tourist, of course i will take this great opportunity to experience the Thai local culture. The golden mount is one of the famous temple in Thailand. It was built in the 1800. The temple was later refurnished. But it still look as glamour as before. And you will get a great view of Bangkok city when you reached the top of the mountain. Its Songkran and the temple was crowded. If you do visit on regular day i believed the temple is quieter and you can hear the chanting of the monks.

Great views of the city but not much there. The Golden Mount was the last thing we did while in Bangkok. It was an easy climb despite the heat and provides nice panoramic views of Bangkok. However there isn't really much there to see, and it is difficult to access except via taxi.

The View. We took the ferry from Nana Char pier down to Phanfa Leelard pier. About 10 minutes walk to the entrance. 20 baht gets you in for a nice slow walk up the hill for a great view of the city. Definitely worth the trip for the Wat and for the view.

A little bit of peace among the bustle of Bangkok. I loved this temple. The walk up could be challenging for some but it is worth it. Great views and a peaceful atmosphere. A good way to get there is along the canal on the taxi boats.

Peace and quiet in the middle of the city. Been to Bangkok several times and always come here or take friends here as its nice to talk up the hill and get the 360 views of Bangkok and see it in its glory. The only sounds are of monks chanting and the bells people ring as they walk up the mount.
Beautiful!

Wonderful!. The hike up the Golden Mount was steep but nevertheless adventurous. Upon reaching the highest peak one can witness the view, and it is a good place to take photos of the surrounding area.

Great views, sacred place. No long pants needed.. Was there with my wife, what a lovely place to visit. Serene, scared & friendly - not too crowded and the 360 view of the city is wonderful. Long pants are not a requirement. The stairs upward are not challenging at all. Check it out.

Off the Beaten Palace Path but Well Worth It. Every time I visit Bangkok, I make a trip to Wat Saket. It's tranquil and not too touristy but has all the culture and tradition of the more popular temples. I have never experienced much of a crowd which is a nice change of pace from the Wats near the Grand Palace. Those who seek history will not be disappointed. The view from the top is incredible. A must see!
Panoramic view of the city. Very well maintained. Artificially created. Amazing view from the top. It takes a little while to go to the top. The steps are small and doesn't go with a smooth walk.

Something cool to do. We went there as a back up plan and it was really nice and calm, the stairs can be a bit tiring but it's a really nice view from up top, it's just a very relax place and they have a coffee shop along the way.
a peaceful visit with not so many tourists. The Golden Mount is beautiful itself, locating in a high hill, where you can see the central-north of the Bangkok city.

Temple with a view. Wat Saket is walking distance from the river taxi - that's how we got there. The view is nice but I suppose some will prefer view from rooftop bars. However, the feel of being on top is difference from bars - after all, this is a temple so it's quiet and zen in its own way. Note: Tourist will need to pay 20bahts for the entrance fee.

Cool place with great views!!. We wandered around the city on a day off from our planned tour (with tour guide), and came across The Golden Mount. It is a very peaceful place in the middle of a bustling city. At the top of the climb, you can see magnificent views of the city, and rest to take in the beauty of the Thai culture and religion. We even saw a few monks up there praying and resting. Cool visit!
Very nice. Away from other attractions but a great way to see the city from the top. It is down to earth temple and you have hike many steps but it is not that difficult
panoramic view at the top. A number of steps to climb but well worth it for the view. I like the café on the way at the entrance - they have lime soda and iced coffee.

View was just OK, but Buddhist hell murals were fun. Not spectacular, but still nice. The best part was finding murals of Buddhist hell in one of the buildings - looked like the Buddhist version of Dante's Inferno.
Great views. A lot of steps to walk up , but it is worth the time and effort for the views over the city. We were recommended to visit this Wat . as it is so peaceful

amazing view. This place is no where close to BTS sky train so you can only take taxi, took took, and bus. The view from up top is stunning you can see the city really pretty and it's also windy so you won't have to worry about being too hot. A lot of Thais visit there as well so be prepare for the crowd but i think less than grand palace.

Great Views!. This temple was easy to get to on our own. We decided to do this one because it enabled us to see the city skyline. From our expectations, we were prepared to get a workout with the climbing the stairs. It wasn't that bad, and I wouldn't exactly describe us as fit. We did go in the morning to avoid the heat. It wasn't really crowded and we got some cool pictures.

Part of a large temple complex near to our hotel. We walked over to this site. Good view from the top but city very smoggy so hazy view. Slightly wearing away looked unkept but for an hours visit an interesting site.

Not worth walking up. I would not recommend this temple as it has not much to offer. It is not worth walking the whole way up. Other temples have more nice buildings, storyline and many more Buddhas available.View over Bangkok is the only thing mentionable and quiet ok but you get better views from the various rooftop bars.

Wonderful Temple, The Golden Mount. Built on an artificial man-made hill, the Golden Mount is the temple’s most well-known landmark. The Buddhist cultural place in Thailand. I liked the place that I visited in Thailand. Don't miss to visit this place if you are in Bangkok.

Amazing views of old meeting new. Went to the Golden Mount , a guy a the bottom said water , I thought I know what water is , but as i climbed the steps I wish I had purchased a bottle . It's amazing the views from the top of old and new Bangkok living together. It's a must stop if you can fit in another Wat!! .
Another sight worth seeing.. Don't leave Bangkok until you have seen this. Yet again you can only wonder at the amazing work involved in creating such a structure

Must See!. With all the wats in Bangkok, it's easy to overlook this one, but the view from the top alone makes it worth a visit. Also, the walk up the stairs is beautiful and peaceful in a busy city. I visit here every time I'm in Bangkok.

Wonderful temple. I am a Buddhist girl so I intent to go to Wat Sa Gedd.
I have been very happy to be there.
The stairs to the top hill very amazing.

The Golden Mount - beautiful. Great place to take pictures of the sunset (with normal camera of professional). It is far to the top but the steps are so small that you will get easy to the top. Entry is only 20 bath. Recommended to go when you are in Bangkok!

One more must visit place. Basically one of the main cultural heritage point in Bangkok. Definitely should be in must-to-visit points in your itinerary. Some of the monks speaks in very good English and allows you to make foto with them. Shot of Espresso in the middle of golden mount can add you some energy :)
Good Wat. This Wat is not as beautiful inside as some of the others in the city, but the outside, as well as the view from the top, make this Wat worth checking out.

Great sunsets. I visited here after the Thipsamai Pahd Thai, what a treat. I watched the sun set over the city and once again like most Wats here, it's tranquil and takes you away. No good for anyone in wheel chairs. Wat Saket offers fantastic panoramic views. Well worth a looks, especially photographers.

Bangkok view point. From the entrance, it had totally different atmosphere from other temples.
It was like a little jungle on the way up to the top.
After tens of stairs, there is a temple on the top. It was also the best viewpoint, looking down Bangkok city.
Worth visiting with a slow walk and deep breath.
Views and small temple. One of the better small temples dotted around Bangkok, mainly for the views from the top. The steps up to the top offer a few bells and shrines that are interesting.

Large complex of wats. So peaceful, a lovely place to wander round. Very few tourists whilst we were there. Great views from the top of the Golden Mount. Lots of temple bells to be wrung. Stunning jade buddhas.

Great view and LOTS of walking.. Wat Saket is located on the top of a mountain and requires a great deal of walking up lots of steps. This was the fourth temple of the day and I was exhausted. After slowly proceeding up the steps we were rewarded with a great view of the local area. It is strongly suggested that you visit early in the day, so as to have enough energy to walk up the stairs and when it is cooler.

Steps.....so many steps. I would not have visited this place had i not been told to visit by a tuk tuk driver, granted he just wanted to make some money!The temple is built on top of a man made hill, getting up there involves tacking lots of steps, which are too small for one step at a time but slightly too big for two at a time, which made the climb extra tiring. Once up on the top it was well worth the visit.Great view from the rooftop over much of Bangkok and only 20 baht entrance fee. lots of bells which people ring all the way up the climb.
Nice view of Bangkok. Admission cheap, its is a nice view of Bangkok. Many bells and gongs on the way up. Not too busy, stairs easy and few. Stop by if in the area.

Perfect view for free. Not only this is a beautiful temple by itself, it also opens a terrific view to Bangkok!!!Why I say it is free, because we were the only one who actually paid :)))) right at the entrance, a guy would be asking to pay 25b, but it is not necessary.You should've seen my husbands face when we found that out :))) However please enjoy the city to its maximum!!!
Go up there. Generally it is hot in Bangkok during the day, so be there early. Then you avoid a lot of crowd and the worst heat. Anyway it is no to many steps and there is a great vue.

Still worth a visit.. Used to be free, but now I think its 100 baht? Regardless, the climb up has some cute sites along the way (garden drenched buddhas with refreshing misting machines lining the path) and the top has wonderful views that I don't feel can be equalled in Bangkok. Beyond that, it is not as elaborate as other temples, so it makes for a quick stop (unless you are REALLY into panoramas), once you reach the top.

Great for the view. A lovely change from many of the other temples as you climb to the top of the mount. Well organised one way system and a calm and refreshing place with water falling and many plants. At the top the view is great.

Great climb . We decided to go and visit as this one gives a little different angle on the city, nice climb but the view and pleasure you get is worth.I wouldn't t advice for seniors as in hot times climbing is really hard.Same with small kids...Great place.

Beautiful climb up, breathtaking views!. The Golden Mount is a short distance by tuk tuk from the Grand Palace and worth the detour. Once there, I was surprised to find lush greenery and colourful flowers surrounding the mount and continuing on all the way to the top. Kind of makes you forget your in the city. On the way up there is a landing with a large gong and also some large bells which make the long climb up a little less boring. When you finally get to the top, there are breathtaking views of the city making for excellent photos. It is a little busy with tourists but nothing like The Grand Palace or The Reclinning Buddha.
Surprising!. Very surprising to see this mountain in the middle of Bangkok. Very well done, very beautiful! Must see!

Hands-on temple. Temples and small kids do not mix well in my opinion (and those of my 9-, 6- and 3-year old), but Wat Saket is a welcome change. Our kids thought this was one if the highlights of our stay in Bangkok, as they were welcomed by a very friendly monk that took the time to show them around and let them join in some of the customs of the temple. The view from the top was awesome at sunset, when the golden dome seemed to glow.On the climb up and down, the kids (and the parent) had fun ringing the bells and the GIANT gong!

Wasn't on our list but delighted we went!. We visited here based on a recommendation that morning, and we were delighted we went! The grounds are really beautiful with lovely monument on the walk up, it's not far and really easy, one way up and one way down! Once you get to the top there is great viewpoints to admire the city and really great sculptures inside, it was a lot less busier than other attractions, which was really nice.On the climb up there is nice cooling water most being sprayed etc.

Great Viewpoint. Get there by taking the canal water taxi. That is an adventure in itself. It is close to Democracy momunment and Khaosan road, so it is a good destination. It is a small hill with a temple at the top. Other than skyscrapers it is the only high ground in Bangkok.
Amazing attraction. One of the gems of Bangkok. The view is amazing and the building and temple itself are quite spectacular. Along with being an amazing place, the monks are so nice and helpful

Originally a man-made mountain to look for enemies.. This is a beautiful gold spire finished by Rama III to look for enemies from Burma and Laos. There are 300 steps going to the top to give a good view of the city.

Go to the Golden Mount via the khlong. We went via the canal which was great three stops from Jim Thompson's house .The cost was 9 bahat (18p) ! The Golden Mount was really quiet as it is out of the way from the main Wat's.You can walk to Ko San Road from here with a good map.The view from the top is worth the climb as is ringing the bells and gong's ,

Much more than views. Decided to go the Gold Mount based on reading about the great view. Realized that, at least for me, the place offers a lot more. The entrance area is nice but doesn't tell the real story. Go the tickets booth, pay the modest fee and start climbing. The walk us is kind of magical. From the busy streets and all the hassle, everything transforms into tranquility. Stop at prayer bells, enjoy the quietness and continue all the way to the top. The temple is yet another small surprise with its several parts. Note that you leaves your shoes on. Climb up to the roof, enjoy gold temple and the 360 degrees view of Bangkok.

Well worth a visit. I went with a Thai friend for a special ceremony that was taking place conducted by a monk she studies with. There were few tourists around, and in spite of the few dozen people who came for the ceremony, the feeling was very peaceful. It is a bit of a hike up, but the views from the top are excellent. You can really get a good feeling for the city from there. The walk up is beautiful in itself. Because of the climb, I'd recommend going there early in the morning and definitely not during the hottest part of the day.

great views. The Golden Mount was recommended to us so to leave the crowds behind we decided to visit. Entrance is cheap, we went later in the day and there was hardly anyone around.Being a mount there are stairs but the climb up is fairly gentle, there are statues placed in the waterfalls and mist jets making it all look quite magical.There is a coffee stop half way serving excellent drinks a time to relax a little and have a drink among the monks.There are large bells that you can ring as you ascend, you leave your shoes on for this one, there isnt a buddah here but the long tall conical gold temple that you can see throughout the skyline of Thailand, 360 degree views of the city, much quieter and calmer than other templess we had visited
Great views. Quite touristy which I find detracts from the beauty a tad, but the top has wonderful views of Bangkok and is definitely worth the walk up.

Best view of Bangkok...on a clear day you can see forever!. This was a real treat for me...in so many trips to Bangkok over the years, I had never been here. A true hidden treasure. I kept stopping on the walk up to "chom" or admire the view. The view at the top of the mount is great, especially if it isn't hazy. The walk down overlooks Wat Saket and the bougainvillea is gorgeous.

Views of Bangkok. This is one of the oldest temples in Bangkok. You climb the artificial hill up a circular staircase of over 300 steps up to the golden tower. On the way up there are lots of bells and gongs which you can ring and also different monuments and tombs. Once you get to the top you get great views across Bangkok and can see the Palace and Wat Arun.It's worth exploring the Wat around the Golden Mount as its so peaceful and like other Wats really ornate and beautifully decorated. You can also see the Standing Buddha and Sitting Buddha, both of which are worth seeing

Great view, nice boat trip. The view from the top is magnificent! There are less tourists which is priceless in Bangkok. On the hill, there is a nice, shady garden with buddhist bells etc. - great for a stroll around. We then took a speed boat (stops directly below the hill) to go to the Jim Thompson House (it is just 4 stops, approx. 15 minutes). The boat trip was a real adventure, no tourists, just locals, costs 20 bath. The driver was very nice and showed us where to get out for the Jim Thompson House - a real highlight of our Bangkok stay.

Climbing up is worth it!. Wat Saket is very beautiful from afar with its gleaming chedi on the top of the mount. There are maybe 300 steps on the path which leads up to the temple, circling around the man-made artificial hill. It is a very good exercise, tiring a bit but the steps are not steep and there are places to stop and catch you breath on the way up. When we were there, we were the only foreigners and a few local people. When you are climbing up, you can enjoy the beautiful flowers and plants growing next to the paved way. I read that it is good to ring the bells and gongs for luck. The temple on the top doesn't have any extraordinary statues or decorations, it is a simple place to pray. The views of Bangkok from top are remarkable and beautiful.At the base of the mount, before we started to climb up, there were figures of animals as per the Chinese zodiac with some explanations but in Thai, as well as photos and notes (in English) about Buddhist sites in non-Buddhist countries (the figures of Buddha in Bamyan, Afghanistan, for example, which have been destroyed). Down at the base, if you pay attention, you will see something like a cemetery. Later I read that in the second half of the 18th century, that place had been used as a crematorium and dumping place for about 50 - 60 thousand people who had died of plague.On one side of the mount, there are, I think, living quarters of monks and we also wandered a little there. The climbing up is really worth it! Recommended!Entrance fee is symbolical - 20 baht.

Great views of Bangkok. This is a nice temple, with an atmospheric climb to the top with bells and gongs and increasingly good views of the city. Once you make it to the stupa at the peak there are stunning 360 views of the city which are completely worth the climb

get your camera ready. Everything around and inside the main gates are beautiful. Get your camera ready and be prepared to wait in line for a photo. Go early.We went later in the afternoon and I'm probably in 20+ tourist photos. Lucky me.

Great View of the City. Golden Mount is located on an elevated plane in Bangkok. On a clear day, this is a great place to enjoy the breeze in Bangkok. The views of the city is superb and not to be missed. Do check out the roof top floor of the temple. Offers a great view of the city. Read about it on my blog : http://zephyroustravels.blogspot.sg/2015/02/bangkok-day-2-7-nov-14-wet-wet-day-in.html

Magnificent views. Terrific views on your way to the top. Ringing the bells along the way brings good luck. A lot of stairs but they are narrow so it makes it an easy climb. A short walk from KSR and only 20 baht. Definitely worth a visit.

amazing. Decided to visit as we hadnt been before. Got a taxi from hotel which only cost 77 bahts on meter. Lots of steps to top but places to rest on way . View from top was amazing. Only cost 20 bahts to visit. Well worth a visit.

Another fantastik must see.. It is a nice walk up the mountain with great views of the city. I also liked the row of temple bells that you can ring yourself. It is expected for good luck. The views from the top are spectacular.

Up and down. We hadn't visited it during our first trip in Bangkok.
Step by step you'll arrive to the very top of this really golden mountain, ringing bells on your way up.
Once on the roof you have a quite wide view of the town.
Beautiful. A beautiful temple, although you have a lot to climb around 300 steps to reach the top. Beautiful view of Bangkok from there.

Lives up to it's name. Wat Saket is a beacon in the middle of this part of the city. The windy pathway up and down is border on both sides by a lovely gardens. You must remember to ring all the bells on the way up and down for a wonderful melody. The top is a quite area where many Buddhists come to pray homage to Budda.
Climb Up. A nice place with around 300 steps to climb to reach the top. It was a nice experience reaching the top and a great view of the city from there.
Nice view. It will be very hot if you visit this place in morning or afternoon, But when you climb up the top of this mount, there is a very beautiful view the whole Bangkok.

Wonderful.. A beautiful temple, although you have a lot to climb to reach the top & it is tiring, its worthwhile. The scene from the top is fabulous. Beautiful gardens on the way, till you climb the stairs & it is well maintained, its worthwhile even for non Buddhists too just for the beauty of the place.Well worth a visit.

Ring the Bells. This is one of the defining monuments in Bangkok and is a must of any visit. The climb up is fun (though the long shallow stairs are a little annoying) as you twist around the mount and get views as you go. Also you can ring all the bells as you go up for luck and merit, though they do break the serenity of the climb a bit. The views from the top are lovely, but be sure you go all the way to the top (there are stairs to the roof of the temple)...
Must see. Quite spiritual, it is an experience to climb up to the top, nothing really hard but nice. We made an offer, we felt well.

Well Worth A Visit. Despite its proximity to crowded Khao San Road we found there to be fewer visitors than most of the temples we have visited and the 20 baht entrance fee is good value. There is a steep climb to the top but this was easy as we frequently stopped to take photos of the many statues and city views. Following the lead of many others we rang the bells lining the route and banged the enormous gong which makes a deep boom, great fun! Entering the base of the temple many people removed their shoes despite a recorded voice urging us not to. A short flight of spiral stairs takes you to the base of the golden dome which is visually overwhelming but due to its sheer size is very hard to photograph. Here some people were praying and leaving offerings of money while most others were taking selfies or admiring the views over the city. This is well worth a visit.

Temple with Great Views. The Golden Mount is located near Khao San Road (about 20 minutes walk). The first impression you get is the golden Chedi on the hill, which glistens in the sunlight.You walk up a series of steps to the base of the mount, where you can ring a series of bells before ascending to the top through narrow spiral stairs. At the top you get excellent panoramic views over Bangkok. A great place for a photo opportunity. On the way down you'll get a chance to see an interesting sculpture area with vultures with humans being eaten, not for the feint hearted!Don't miss Wat Srakesa at the bottom of the mount as it has a lovely courtyard with a temple with a very large standing Buddha image.

Lovely views of Bangkok. There are many stairs but they are not steep and it does not take too long to reach the top. Good views of Bangkok. Make sure you bang the gongs as they make a beautiful sound.

"Well worth a visit ". With worth a visit
You can climb to the top( not too strenuous) and there are 360 degree views over Bangkok.
This attraction is less crowded than others, and 20 B entrance fee.

Wonderful. Golden Buddha - is the world's largest solid gold statue, with a weight of 5.5 tons (5,500 kilograms). It is located in the temple of Wat Traimit. Amazing Statue and a peaceful place to spend some quite time.

Unique Temple Experience in Bangkok. Golden Mount is definitely worth a visit if you’re in Bangkok for more than a few days. Just be sure you invest your time FIRST on the Bangkok Big 3: Temples of Emerald Buddha (Wat Phra Kaew), Reclining Buddha (Wat Pho) & Dawn (Wat Arun). The Bangkok Big 3 are all more spectacular than Golden Mount.Once you’ve seen Big 3, by all means make your way to Golden Mount (Wat Saket) which offers a unique temple experience in Bangkok. What’s unique: far fewer tourists; most visitors are devout local Buddhists; interesting nooks & crannies (especially at base), side temples, some of which are tiny but contain beautiful Buddha images; only “hill” of consequence in Bangkok so views from up top are spectacular; surrounding neighbourhood is great to explore (see my Wat Saket review of 4 June 2013 for recommendations on touring the neighbourhood).Easiest way to get there is take Skytrain to National Stadium, then walk to & just past Jim Thompson’s House until you hit canal (Khlong Saen Sap), turn right, walk along canal until you get to Hua Chang Pier. Take Khlong Saen Sap canal ferry WEST-bound to last stop (Phan Fa Lilat Pier). You’ll see Wat Saket looming off to the left/south, at which point it’s a 3 min walk. The Khlong Saen Sap canal ferry is best 30-cent “adult Disney ride” ever!
Great view of Bangkok from the top!. Worth the walk up the steps to get a 360 view of Bangkok, temple at the top. Definitely worth a stop on a tuk tuk tour

A little hard to find, but worth hassle. This sight was not on my "to do" list, but hotel concierge suggested I visit. I'm glad I took her advice!! The taxi driver dropped me off a little distance from the entrance so I had to ask and meander down some side streets but glad I preserved! It is a very tranquil setting where I quickly forgot the frustration of finding it.You will want to go on a bright sunny day, as the views of Bangkok from the top of the mount are amazing! There are quite a number of winding stairs leading to the top, but it is a relatively easy climb. It is not at all crowded so take your time on the ascent and enjoy the view!

Superb view, BUT. well, even the rocks where not real and we felt like being in Disney....but the view was great, so if it not to hot, just go. It was not a place for praying, a few did, it was more a fake tourist atraction, but still nice.

Golden Mount. Peace and tranquillity reign here. Beautiful,spectacular views. Well worth a visit. Lovely place to take in all that is Bangkok. Skyscrapers,temple, Grand Palace. Easy to hail a taxi back to our hotel.

A must visit. Don't get me wrong...the temples in Bangkok are ALL beautiful, but the views from the top here are spectacular. A great spot to take a panoramic shot of the city of Bangkok, which I did! For a small donation, you can lay a flower for the buddha and light a candle and incense stick for the souls of passed loved ones. It's very peaceful and moving.
Worth seeing!. A very nice view, calm and so piecefull place..steps are very mild and easy to get up to, gong and bells..GREAT! We had chance to attend the ritual with a priest, really magnificent !

Need to be reasonably fit. This is a lovely relaxing couple of hours, take your time climbing the spiral stairs to the top, ring the bells on the way up and down and take in the views. At the top you can participate in the rituals by giving a small donation, you do not have to take your shoes off inside the temple. We stayed in sukhumvit so took a klong canal boat which cost a grand total of 16bahts then walked to the mount. A very cheap and relaxing visit!

Great place to see panoramic view of Bangkok. The Golden Mount is only 20minutes walk from Khaosan road where I've stayed for few nights. The temple is located on a hill top. Walking up on the stairs you will see different size of bells which said to be bring good luck if you ring them. The first floor of this temple are some golden buddha statues and up stair is the Golden stupa. I went to this place around 5pm and found it a good time to visit as you can see the sunset of bangkok on the rooftop. The entrance ticket to the temple is 20 Bhats.
Don't be put off by the steps. We thought this would be a big hike but it really wasn't. The steps are not steep and easy to manage. Great view from the top!

Enjoyable visit to Wat Saket. Staying at the Hilton, getting to the Temple was half the fun.We took the Hilton boat to the Dockand waked 5 minutes to the Skytrain. Walked from our exit past the Jim Thompson House and walked about a quarter of a mile along tKlong to the Fast Boat dock. Fifteen baht and three tops later, we exited and walked 10 minutes to the Golden Temple. A 20 baht donation and aneasy walk to the top was pleasantly rewarding. .

Very nice indeed. This is a gem of an experience for only 20 baht, much better value than most attractions in Bangkok. Nice easy and interesting landscaped walks up to the temple with a humidified environment, clean, some interesting exhibits but like most attractions in Thailand not much interpretation, not over-run with tourists or commercialism, tranquil and offers wonderful views of the city. An oasis to escape the hustle outside. Highly recommended.

Very nice. OK, we got here because we saw on the map and thought it would be cool to see it. When we got there we were amazed. Again not only for the place but also to see people praying so intensely. They are so thankful for everything they have that praying is part of their daily life and they do it every time they have a chance to. You get a wonderful 360 degree view of the city right from the middle of it. Definitely worth going.

Interest history in the part. This temple was belong with Ayutthaya period, therefore name Wat SaKae and later after king Rama I enthroned assign to establish as Royal temple. The golden mountain was build in reign of king Rama III proposed to keep the great relic of the lord Buddha but past away before so the bell shape stupa complete in reign of king Rama IV. The Vultures statue are represent the part of sad story during 19th century which epidemic came over bangkok and alot of people death by that until cannot completed funeral and cause of over hundred corpse laid on ground waiting for crematorium so group of vultures came over to consumption.

Lovely views at the top. The entrance fee is only 20 baht. There are numerous gongs and bells to ring on the way up. Take your time. Enjoy the view on each level. Once at the top, there are sellers of temple knick knacks, incense, amulets, ribbons, etc. You can pray before an alter then head to chedi right at the top. Make a wish. Take photos. Enjoy the breeze. And then make your way down again to the streets below.

Beautiful temple with a tragic past. Stunning views from the top and the steps up and down from the chedi. The base however is a graveyard and there are many strange and beautiful grave markers surrounding the bottom third of the base. Unusually, when entering the temple rooms just below the chedi you are asked to keep your shoes 'on'!!! The differing views from the top of Bangkok are stunning and many other Bangkok landmarks can be seen from here. The temple grounds were used for many cremations. Beautiful temple and grounds and a definite must for a visit.

Easy hike to the top. We thoroughly enjoyed this quick hike to the top of Golden Mount - beginning in the cool of the shade trees, walking past monks in their robes, and enjoying the captivating views at the top ! Better than we thought and totally worth going !

Great view from old bangkok and terrfic temple. The walk up is just beautiful with landscaping and prayer bells. Inside a few different budha's to see and then the top part which has the golden mount and terrific views 360 of bangkok. At a time this was the highest point in the city and it's easy to see why. After there are some Wats in the immediate area worth investigating as well with beautiful budhas.

Nice change. Sought this out since had done all the "must see" sights in the past. As described already, take the boat from Klong Saen Saeb, not far from Ratchathewi BTS, walking toward MBK. Get off at the last stop, I think 4 after Saen Saeb. The boat costs 9Baht per person. When the boat roars up to the stop, you will need to hop on board, grabbing the rope for balance that hangs across the top. Then step down onto a bench. The ticket seller will come to you. When you get off, exit the klong station and turn left. There are signs to The Golden Mount, which is about a 5 minute walk away. There will be a ticket booth, 20 B, just before the steps. It is a long but gentle climb through a park like setting of flowering shrubs and greenery. Feel free to ring the many bells and hit the gong. At the top you will have a terrific view of the city. This Wat is quite different from others we have visited.

Stunning View. Been living in Bangkok most of life, but discovered this temple recently. The cheapest and quickest way to get to this temple is by long tail boat in Klong Saen Saeb, the pier is located around Siam area, from Sapan Hua Chang to Panfa Leelard. If struggle to find the pier as the local where 'ta lur' (pier) is. The temple is located at the last stop. Foreigners will have to pay for an entrance fee, there's an official sign of where to pay. The stand is located next to the stairways leading up towards the pagoda. The pagoda and view is a few minutes of walking up the stairs, but through each levels the view of Bangkok gets better! Definitely worth the trek!

Dont skip this place. This temple is very different and certainly one of the best of the city. Located in top of a small hill, the structure, the path and even the rules are very unique. The view of the city is great too. You can cultive your soul and mind and eyes at the same time.

Something a bit different. Having been to bangkok many times over the years we had somehow not visited the golden mount, we were therefore really suprised bu how lovely it was. Glorious views over bangkok from the top and a nice stroll up there through green tropical garden. Well worth a visit.

Worth the trip. Slightly off the main tourist track, Wat Saket is worth the detour. Tuk-tuk drivers can take you there from Grand Palace for no more than 100 Baht. (They will probably ask you to detour to a store, so they can get a commission though...)The mount is a pleasant walk to the top, and a nice view of the city from above.

A pleasant retreat with an excellent view. It is worth going up the Golden Mountain for the view but there is a lot more too. Some lovely bells to ring as you climb the stairs. You are asked not to take your shoes off in the temple at the top which is a relief to some visitors and a worry to some devote Buddhists. It is also worth visiting the various other buildings in the complex which are quiet and very interesting.

Nice View. This was a nice temple. You can climb to the top (not too difficult of a climb) and get a good view of the city. I wouldn't say this is the nicest temple in the city, but if you have the time, go see it.
great views. the golden mount offers great views over bangkok and is a great place to reflect. There is a small shop on site.

Great view on clear days. In the center of town, a short walk from Khaosan area. The temple itself is rather average, but the panorama is great. Don't miss it! And, the most popular street restaurant, known for it's excellent Phad Thai, is very close.

Gorgeous views!. Visited this lovely place just the other day. Only about a 10-15 min walk fro. Khao San Road.
You can climb right to the top and take in the breathtaking views it has to offer.
Oh, and buy some coconut ice cream for the little street vendor. Best I've had!

An Enjoyable Place To Spend A Few Hours.. Interesting place to visit, within walkimg distance if you are staying in Banglamphu (Khao San Road) area, easy to find as it kind of sticks out.Great views over Bangkok and in and around the temple itself is very nice and well maintained.Free entry with donation box at the bottom of the stairs. Grab a coconut ice cream from the street vendor at the open gates across the road. Best ice cream I've ever tasted.

Get away from the Crowds. I've been in Bangkok many times but this was my first visit to the Golden Mount. First, it is a delightful break away from the crowds that flock to Bangkok's big three (the Golden Palace, Wat Pho and Wat Arun). The scene is much more quiet and idyllic. The climb to the top is gentle and frequently shaded. The view of Bangkok is awesome. The surrounding temple grounds provide both the amazing art and architecture of Thailand, and a serene atmosphere for the reverent.

It is not bad, just not bad!. It is not really a bad visit, the temple itself carries certain significant history but I would not rate this one top of the list - it is to say, if you have 1/2 day free - why not! Or try next time, or Google the pictures.The temple is on a small hill that once you climbed up there is a display of panoramic view of Bangkok - nice, and feel peaceful at times, but nothing spectacular. But still nice! Particularly late in the day.Obviously it is unto one's time in Bangkok and focus of visits - if you have several days - yes, but for a couple of days - I would skip it. It is worthy if one plan to have enough days in Bangkok but really it is not on priority list for me.
Very nice to see. It was very nice to viait the golden mount. For only 20B entrance you shouldn't pass by it without going in. Very nice views and a beautifull surrounding.
Worth seeing. A nice place to visit, entrace fee only about 20 baht. A nice and sacred place with a beautiful view from the top. Liked it alot.

peaceful. a wonderful view of the city from the top It dosnt need to take long for the visit 25/30mins including the climb up but it is worth it it is a significant Wat for the Thai people and it i so peaceful when you are there Not a huge amount to see the golden bell shape at the top is impressive in its size the steps up are gradual and easy going

Not worth a visit. Best to have a go through while travelling by taxi. Better to have a view of the monument while visiting bangkok city areas by taxi.Its quite high up on a mountain and not worth the pain.

Pretty nice elevated views of Bangkok. It is reachable from Democracy Monument on foot (10-15 minutes walk). The temple itself is not very interesting, but it has very nice views of the city. It is not so crowded, compared to other places in Bangkok.Don't forget to hit the bells on your way up!

Spectacular temple and views of Bangkok. The Golden Mount is definitely worth seeing for the temple itself and for the fantastic views of the city from the top. It isn't really near any public transport options but it is not difficult to walk to.

Lovely!. Step outside the madness of the city and observe it all from above. The walk up to the top of Wat Saket is really lovely with lots of greenery, water and mist along the way. Beautiful gold and emerald Buddhas inside, and a great view at the tip. It's nice to just go and sit there for a bit.

The most tranquille place in Bagkok. The pllace really has atmosphere - relaxed and tranquile. It is a walk up the mountain by quite nice path with some waterfalls and sculptures to the golden painted stupa. All area is very clean and nicely preserved. We really enjoyed it.

Great view of the city. I especially enjoyed the views and the somewhat fresh air from up top on such a warm day. You can take the cheap canal boat from near the shopping malls (Central world etc.) to get there, dirty canal but very cheap and adventurous ride!

Just amazing. Ringed every bell and gong, the view is spectacular and the steps towards the top was so well organised and ornate.
We actually had time to enjoy the beauty of the view without many tourists around, no one was jumping in-front of you and trying to sell you anything

Long walk, yet a rewarding view.. Long walk, yet a rewarding view.
Also nice are the gongs hanging next to the stairs up the mountain.

must go. I went to the golden mount by boat near central world which was an interesting experience. This temple is situated in a small hill where you can have a panorama view of bangkok. I really recommend to go to this temple and have a better view of the whole bangkok city.

Great View of Bangkok. The temple is definitely worth it for the views. It looks like a long hike, but the steps are small and the incline is easy so it doesn't feel like the hike it looks like it may be. If you ring all the bells while making a joyous wish for someone else, it is said that it will come true. And they all make beautiful sounds.

Grand Temple. Entrance ticket is THB 40. We must climb a set of stairs before reach the top pagoda.Many people use this temple to pray.View from the top is amazing.Temple design is unique like a fort.You can take khlong boat via San Saeb route to reach this Wat.

Best place for great views of Bangkok!. What a lovely, fascinating place! The stairs are not steep at all; I'm short and I was easily able to skip steps. :-) It's a unique temple, and the views of Bangkok from the top are great! This is the best place I've been to for great views of the city.

Great Fun to Climb the Mount.. The Golden Mount (Wat Saket) is such a familiar landmark for all Thai residences. After all these years, we decided to climb the mount today. The whole activity was a great experience. Firstly, the officers at the entrance mistook as as regular tourist. They were surprise that Thai could look and act like tourist as well. On the way up and down, the major activity was ringing the bells and praying at various Buddha images. The whole visit lasted about an hour with great fun.
4th time there. Very quiet location. Beautiful temples. I like to go there to escape Bangkok hectic traffic. It's easy to get there with the river taxi.

Beautiful at night. I suggest to visit in the evening when city gets beautifully lit up. The view is stunning. The temple itself is nice though of course cannot compete with Wat Pho or What Arun, so do it afterwards - this place is good to sit on top and relax.

Excellent view and climb. Really beautiful view from the top of the temple, and interesting art on the walk up to the top. The surrounding area is populated with a decent amount of shops for food and souvenirs if you're hungry.

Lots of stairs but spectacular at sunset.. Sunset view was perfect. Splendid Wat. There are a lot of stairs but if you take your time, you can stop at various levels on the way up and enjoy the bells and view. It might be very hot during the day on a warm day.
Very cool spot!. It's a bit of a climb, but worth it it. Great views. Beautiful temple. Take a water taxi to/from here.

Heck of a climb on a hot & humid day, but worth it. On our first day in Bangkok, we took the Lonely Planet walking tour around the Grand Palace, and added on this stop. Boy oh boy, it was a flippin' hot, humid and sunny day to be walking around. But we took our time climbing to the top of the hill, and the final experience was lovely.The steps you climb as you circle the hill are quite small, so either you slowly climb up or start jumping 2 at a time! Then it levels out and you can hit a row of large bells (at least that's what others were doing). Then keep on going until you reach the actual temple! Once inside, I must have looked wiped out because the worker immediately led me to a large fan to cool off! So nice. There are places to pray here, but we are not buddhist, so we just took in the sites. You can then climb another tiny set of stairs to the roof, where the Golden Mount was decorated in cloth for the festival. The view from here was amazing! There is chanting playing over speakers, people worshipping by circling the mount and ringing a gong when done... and lovely breeze which is great on such a hot day! We stayed here for quite some time just taking it all in and appreciating the peacefulness of it all.

nice view and nice surrounding streets. Tool a tour with Sabai Thai Life here, visited the nice Wat Saket, and after that took a super nice stroll through the small streets surrounding Wat Saket and the river. Very nice,old wooden thai houses, local markets and nice small local shops.

Well worth the trip. The place is beautiful and serene. The view from above is fantastic, with a 360 degree view and a pleasant breeze. Place suggested mainly for the view and for a sense of getting away from the busy city.
Good Monument to see in bangkok. Had been to Wat Saket and has good Viewing Gallery to click Photos in the middle of the Bangkok. Peaceful and Scenic Place. Must Visit.

Great view, yet loads of tricky stairs!. Another sightseeing on a high spot that will give you a great view of the old city and the grand palace. The Golden Mount is just a temple that people visit to pay their respect and give their wishes. You only pay 20 THB to get up there but the view is brilliant! Once you come down the temple there are a lot of other little building that you can walk around, so bear in mind, is not a small sightseeing!
Nice Historical place. Nice for whom interested in culture and history, good to know about, nice design for a historical place.
A lovely temple. The Golden Mountain temple ( wat Sakhet) is a great temple. On the top of a hill you have a great view over Bangkok from it. It's many stairs until you reach the top.
Impressive. Very scenic and beautiful buildings. Really good and enjoyed the experience. Now catching up on some reviews so should have posted this earlier. Worth a view for sure

The View at the Top is Amazing.. The Great Mount is wondrous, there are many twists and turns, make sure you take all routes, so not to miss a thing! We had the pleasure of talking with a monk who proceeded to tell us he learn to speak the English language by watching the movies Black Hawk Down and Batman and listening to Linkin Park?! so fascinating and unexpected at the same time. He also told us about the life of a Monk and when I was playing the gongs, he said it meant I was going to get good luck from the Heavens, which was nice. The room at the top of the Mount holds some of the more exquisitely detailed Buddas in an array of Golds and Jade, it is a Holy place, so please treat it with respect when you visit.

Gigantic!. Well, you're either a Temple bum or you're not. As for me? I can't get enough. I can't pass one by. Most times I never even find out the names. I have sooo many pictures that only enjoy. You can only show a normal person so many temples before their eyes glaze over. This one is the Mother Lode! There will always be another... I can't get enough...

Very interesting and Impressive. There is a long hike of 30 min to reach the top. It is surrounded by beautiful gardens and the views from the top are spectacular.Stay after sun set to see the lights. You will appreciate the views more.
Nice temple but not the best. Worth a visit because of all it's so rounding. It's nice the scenario and getting up the mountain but not the best attraction in Bangkok!

Interesting. The entry fee was supposedly to be 20B but I got in for free because they said "Today special, free entry". Be careful as it could be slippery to climb. Don't forget to hit the Big Gong! The top contains religious relics and such, but the view from above was two thumbs up!

Impressive. We enjoyed our visit to the Golden Mount immensely. It was a quiet Monday morning and the place was serene and calm the views were fantastic and the temple itself is stunning. Well worth the trip

the most beautiful destination for the ancient temples in Thailand. I visited the Wat Saket last month Nov 2014, it was an amazing trip among all these well made shapes of temples and arts. every corner it worth to take a picture for it .The design, finishing, the shapes all are beautiful.it was little hot that day 23rd of Nov 2014 , so its useful to use an umbrella to avoid the sun.worth to visit and take alot of pictures there.
surrounded by a beautiful garden en great view at the top. Great walk to the top of the golden mount. A hidden paradise, with lot of green along the path, in crowded Bangkok.

Worth the walk in the heat!. Its a bit of a hike up the stairs but the view of Bangkok is well worth it. Just watch your head as you go up the stairs to the stupa. Its not marked as a low roof and I nearly knocked my self out on the ledge!.The gardens on the way up are lovely too. Keep your eyes peeled for the sculptures set within the gardens. Some are very beautiful. Don't forget to ring the bells on your way through either.

A long climb but worth it!. Love this place better to go either early in the morning or late afternoon its a big climb to the top but 1/2 way is a café and bells for you to ring but the view from the top is brilliant worth a visit after you just go round the corner and you can get a water taxi on the clong to the heart of Bangkok to the sky train

AMAZING!!!!!!!. we reached this beautiful temple with the river boat from the city center the atmosfere was incredible after i don't know 1000 stairs but it worth the effort!!!If you are travelling to bangkok you can't miss it.

Low-key attraction, away from the crowds. There are so many temples in Bangkok, and this one is a relative unknown that is tucked away. Most tourists wouldn't go here, since there are always the more famous Grand Palace and Wat Arun etc. The temple is atop a small hill, and the walk up is serene, the gradient gentle enough for most people. Stop along the way to admire the bells and other sculptures along the side of the path. Inside the main hall of the temple itself, you can see the Bangkok skyline, but don't forget to go one more level up to the roof, where the 360 degree view is magnificent.
Great views. It worth the visit. You do a short hike to the temple and get great views of the city. It worth the visit.
Climb atop. with a good climb of 25 minutes, this place is amazing for a whole view of the city. Very serene place to spend evenings with family. Bangkok under lights is spectacular.

An interesting bypass. I walked past this on the way back to my hotel on a touring day around the area. Really interesting to walk up; you get a really good view of the local area and beyond. It's also very peaceful!

Set on a hill. Very cheap to go up and every step is enjoyable and littered with plants and other features before you arrive at the top which has a great selection of Buddhist artifacts and you can see the whole city around you.

A relatively unknown must-see. This is a very spiritual place and the view over Bangkok is compareable to that from Wat Arun. But here you don´t Need to climb very steep steps. And you don´t have this masses of visitors like in Wat Arun or Wat Phra Geow.

Nice view. It was not special but ,ok for a short walk up the stairs about 300,been there done that :-)
Entry fee 20B but it was kings birthday so it was free

Nice view of Bangkok. Different than the other famous Bangkok temples, Wat Saket is set on on hill in the middle of Bangkok. We thought the temple was nice but really went to see the city of Bangkok from a different perspective. Peaceful temple with a nice climb up to the top.

A must see. Not as famous as Wat Pho, Wat Arun or the Grand Palace but I enjoyed this temple just as much. It offers stunning views over Bangkok. The walk up to the golden mount is very scenic, offering a multitude of photo opportunities. On a hot day, the breeze at the top was very welcome.

Great view of Bangkok. This is an awesome temple to visit.
It's set on top of a mountain in the city of Bangkok. There are many steps to climb but once at the top the view of Bangkok is great.
Definitely worthwhile making the effort to go to the top.
beautiful. Amazing and peaceful temple with a beautiful climb and view at the top. For some reasons it s never too crowded but it s definitely a must do in bangkok.
Great view over Bangkok. This is a must-see. It's free of admission and the view is stunning. It is and important Wat as well and you will find it very rewarding.

Nice, ready to climb stairs for some good views. There a some stairs to climb so if you are with small kids or elderly, might be little bit difficult.
Stairs height is small so easy to climb. View from top is good but not spectacular as I was expecting. Temple itself at the top is beautiful.
Not much to do here.. Here you have nice view of some parts of the city, but is a heavy way to the top and there´s not so much as in other temples.
Up the hills. The temple was located up the hill need to walk up. When reach top at the temple u can see a very nice view. The temple also nice and very attractive.
Nothing Special. Nice view from the top but as temples go nothing special. A lot of stairs but they are wide and shallow so if you have mobility issues you maybe able to manage the climb.
Great View. We loved seeing this temple. We walked a big spiral of stairs, reached the top to an amazing view. Not much to do when you a have reached the top, but definitely worth a visit.
Good View From The Top. Very Nice Place. Great View From The Top. You Can See Bangkok Overview. So Beautiful. However, Not That Much To Do InThis Place

Good views.... But not much else. The temple itself ain't much and given the walk to the site, plus e climb up the stairs, considering Bangkok is better appreciated from street level, this is not a must visit.

More tourist spot than a temple. Just like every place has a tourist spot, this is one. Though this is supposed to be a Buddha temple, you will hardly find anyone praying. Can spend about 45min to an hour here.

The Golden Mount. We decided on visiting less crowded sights in Bangkok and this was the first with our guide from YourThaiGuide.com. A good breeze was found atop and the climb well worth it. Enjoyed its calm and serenity and the flavor of the nearby neighborhood.
Beautiful!. The structure and views are spectacular. The climb up is a good part of the experience. Not difficult to find.

Beautiful Temple. The main Temples (Wat) in Thailand is very beautiful and clean.
Specially Buddhists people in the world must go on pilgrimage to visit all the Temples. What I dislike is you find many stray dogs in most of the places.

Great view from the top.. It was very hot the day we visited here but well worth the climb up for a wonderful view. I had a spare shirt to change into when we got back to the bottom again, that is my secret hint.
Peacefull. If u will go to Bangkok u should see Wat Saket. It has a great view. And also the way going to the Wat is so peacefull.

Bit of a climb but worth it.. Nice quiet temple that overlooks Bangkok, bit of a climb to the top. Not many tourists at this one so got a chance to have a good look at some of historical pieces they have here.

Great View of City. Great little Shrine set atop a small hill,which is tucked away from the Hustle and Bustle.An easy climb to the top which all ages can cope with and it's Free! Fantastic views but do MIND YOUR HEAD when entering up to the Rooftop (my partner's tears can vouch for that!) :-(
Great view. There are approximately 400 steps leading to the top but it is not steep, worth going because scenery is awesome. Lot of sculptures and a shrine.
A pleasant escape from noise and heat of the city. I always enjoy coming here. I gentle walk to the top and great views of the city. Nice just to sit in the breeze whilst taking in the views.
If you are in the area. worth walking up the 400 steps (v easy climb) of this mount just for the views over Bangkok - funny little area with a funfair outside

Breath taking scenery... . A slow walk around the mount to get up to the place... Enjoy the climb while looking at the sculptures of various buddhist deities and saints. At the top, soak up the breath taking view of bangkok... It can get pretty windy too! Also, there is a shrine at the top whereby you can pay your respects to some buddhist relics!
Best View of Bangkok!. Incredible 360 view of the city from the top of the Mount! Quite the hike to the top, but worth it once you get there. Must see!

Great view on Bangkok + shrine.. Interesting green area - many bells and steps, wonderful view on Bangkok, shrine on the top. One road to go upstairs, other to walk downstairs. Better to choose sunny day - when its rainy steps became slippery. This place worse time you will spend here. Monks in orange clothes and calm atmosphere.
Great view and free!. Not too many steps, but you get a nice 360 view of the city. Its near bus lines. We had lots of time in Bangkok, but if you are short on time, skip it.
Okay. Nothing outstanding, but bizarrely surrounded by an amusement fair. If you can't find the route up the mount, the temple below is sufficient for a quick look.
Stunning views from the top. Be prepared to walk up 400 stairs, but once you get to the top, the view is truly breathtaking - 360 degree views of Bangkok. Worth the walk up, if you can manage it.

Great Views, Plenty of Sweat. Certainly worth the hike up the stairs for the great views and the temple at the summit. Probably my second favorite temple to visit after Wat Arun. You will sweat buckets, though, so be prepared!

Exhilarating Experience. There are quite a few wats in Bangkok whose art and architecture surpasses this; you could say that here the engineering is the most impressive element. However on a beautiful day, it's hard to find anything remotely as exhilarating as a walk up the Golden Mount. The mount is artificial; King Rama III ordered it built, but it was not competed until the reign of Rama V. You ascend sunwise (clockwise) from tropical foliage onto stairways that offer wonderful views of the surrounding temple complexes, until you arrive at the small shrine on top, Along the way both up and down you'll pass courtyards lined with sacred bells. (See photo) The sound of the bells is a nice addition to the overall ambience.Not an excessive walk from National Stadium skytrain sfation: just go straight west on Rama I past the elevated expressway, klong, and hospitals until you get to Thanon Warachak, turn left and after two short blocks, you'll see the entrance to the Golden Mount on the left. No admission fee, but you might care to leave a small donation at the shrine on the top.The view is particularly nice at dawn, and the walk is cooler in the early morning. Obviously you can view Bangkok from greater heights. SkyBar on top of the State Tower building comes immediately to mind, but while SkyBar's angle of view of the river and metropolis is loftier, the Golden Mount's view of the surrounding environs is more intimate and immediate. (See photo)Short-term note: at the moment there is a Kathina festival going on at the Golden Mount, adding traditional Thai music to the charms of the climb.

Intersting place. Very interesting place, just arriving you will be at a local market with a lot of "strange" food that you can try if you are bold. The smell is like all around Bangkok. But passing this area you will start to going up 400steps on the stairs, not hard, but the hot weather doesn't help. Arriving to the top you will see more buddha's and the huge golden bell, really impressive and the view from there is really good. Ps: I've being there now and the bell is partially covered for restoration, so check before going there if it is fully uncovered.

nice lace!. another temple of budha!where u have to take off your choes and visit and see people praying for it!i like the temples but i felt really bored just after 2 days visiting the boudhist temples!however if u like it just go!the place is great!

Perfect view. I went her during a perfect day. The temperature was good and it was not too cloudy. You have to climb a bit and after that you will have a great view. This place is not as busy as other temples in the sightseeing area of Bangkok. I believe it is a perfect view (except when it is raining).

Nice View | วิวดีมาก ทั้งตอนกลางวัน และกลางคืน. Awareness! This is a Buddhist temple, either Buddhism or not should pay respect to the place. When you come to this place you should not wear too short or vest.-Walking to the top and you will find a nice view

Klong dirty river boat to this temple with a beautiful view. The reason we have given 5 stars is that we caught the only remaining river boat to here, almost no tourists, the walk to the top was fantastic - beautiful breeze, amazing view to the entire city of Bangkok and we had a personal tour from a lady that spoke no english - entire experiecne was delightful and pleasant..no touts, just a nice temple with a 360 degree view of Bangkok.
Good view at the top. Kinda difficult to go to since it's far from the pier or train station. I walked around 2km before I reached it. interesting architecture though.

Nice temple. Popularly known as the Golden Mount or ‘Phu Khao Thong’, is a low hill crowned with a gleaming gold chedi. Within, the 58-metre chedi is a Buddha relic and welcomes worshippers all year round. Step climb but worth it when you get to the top.

Very Nice Temple. We went to Wat Saket on our first day in Bangkok. We stayed at Sukhumvit area which is a bit far from the temple. The temple is located at the old town of Bangkok. We hopped into the MRT from Asoke/Sukhumvit interchange and lined down at Hua Lamphong MRT station. From the station we took a taxi and it took about 20 minutes for us to get there. Once we reached the temple we were amazed by the landscape around the area. The china town is visible from upon the temple rooftop. There is a calm tranquility in the temple. I felt almost lost in myself while I was looking at the city from above the temple. Wat Saket is also known as the Golden Mount Temple for its huge gold alike mount on the tip of the temple.
nice temple. nice temple but often to much people there. That makes the place sometimes very busy. The view is nice. Go there in the week not on weekend.

Unexpected view. After climbing the stairs to very different sounding music, you reach the top where you reach a wooden looking room with features of gold (as expected). Then after glimpsing at the lovely statues and such, you can have a look out of open windows from every angle of Bangkok. It was quite startling really, you could see the ins and outs you know? The city in the distance, temples near and far and just that lovely sky. Just one of those things you've got to see for yourself, it's free and all

Nice Temple. It's a nice temple and very different looking. The walk up the mount(ain) is pretty nice, because you're surrounded by plants, which isn't that common in Bangkok. The view from the top is pretty good. I wouldn't recommend going on a very sunny day, because you'll sweat like crazy on the stairs and might even burn your feet on the top floor after you've taken your shoes off.

Yet one morw Wat. Bangkok, the city of Wats !! However, this Wat is worth a visit. It's atop a pretty good sized hill and the view of the city is really nice. It is a pretty long climb up the steps, but in the end the exertion is worth it.
Nice place. The morning time visit will the the best.The view from the top of the mountain is excellent.the top view of Beautiful Bangkok City is lovely and the traffic from overview is great.

Bring your sun glasses, well worth the climb. After a great but fume filled tuk tuk drive along the canals out to the Golden Mount, past what must be the largest outdoor clothing market in Thailand, the Golden Mount complex seems like a oasis. The walk up to the top cuts through lots of lovely green surroundings with some really interesting shrines and little pools with frogs and turtles. Once you get to the prayer bells the white washed walls really put a strain on the eyes, especially if you dont have your sun glasses. The final slog upto the top definately builds up a sweat but the views are more than worth it. You can see the whole city and pick out all the landmarks. The golden stuppa its self is also amazing. The walk down is equally as sweat inducing but fortunately you can pick up a nice cold bottle of water from the store at the bottom and take 5 minutes on the picnic table. Well worth the many steps up, especially for the views.
Temple. Loved it - definitely worth visiting. No two temples are alike. Went to visit on our tour group and again with my husband & his co-workers. They were as impressed as I was

An oasis of calmness in Bangkok. Easy to reach, about 1 km from Khao San Rd or the big temples on the river. Not too high, which means not too many stairs, but you still have a great 360 degree view, one of the best in BK. Definitely a must in Bangkok!

Worth A Visit. One of the monuments which is unique in shape and environment. Its on a hill and one has to climb up the stairs which have small steps. There are different types of bells inside which ard considered auspicious. The view from the top is also nice and one can see the city from different angles.Overall it's worth a visit

Superb views, peaceful temple and grounds. I visited this site on a weekday afternoon. It's in an attractive part of town, of particular interest to anyone with a fascination for wood or carpentry. Many small timber merchants occupy the surrounding streets with their stores heaving with teak boards.It's a pleasant climb to the top of the hill. You are rewarded with extensive views over Bangkok in all directions from the summit. A great place to spend some time taking photographs. Next door to the mount you will find Wat Saket. There's no fee and you simply wander through. There were no other tourists there and it felt like I had the entire place to myself, with the exception of some monks passing by.The interior of the temple is an absolute delight, beautifully painted.The lack of crowds and the peace and quiet made this a particularly memorable place to visit.
Nice monument. if you have free time in bangkok this is the one of the place you should see very nice and interesting culture

Definitely a "must" in Bangkok! :). Despite it being on a hill or a mountain with so many stairs, it was so EASY a climb due to the "low stairs" (meaning each stair of a very short height) that you would just feel pretty much like walking on a horizontal surface! :)Great 360-degree views from the top with places to sit on one side (on the right), don't hurry coming back down and take in the views as much as you can. You can even see the tall prang (tower-like structure) of the famous Wat Arun from up here if you look carefully. And, in one scene I was kind of struck by how the newer tall skyscrapers of the city were sort of providing a backdrop in the distance to the older part of the city with rusty buildings right near this place.I was also pleasantly surprised to get some Thai tea for refreshment (for free!) after coming downhill, and at that base area there are also two temples or so (I believe they're called throne halls) and one of them has a standing Buddha in a blessing gesture.About a half-hour walk from the Hualamphong train station, the area around is a little complicated though, especially to find the entrance to buy the ticket and to go up, and you could also lose a sense of direction after coming down (since it's a round-shaped structure) and forget which street is in which direction, so the best thing to do to come here and to go back will be just to take a tuk-tuk!
Lots of stairs ;). There are loads of stairs, but if you focus on the sites you won't even notice. It's very beautiful, and the views from the top are magnificent.
Good views but miss if you're short on time. Free to enter and its a nice if hot walk up the many steps to the top but the views are good. Allow about 45 mins to an hour.

Cooling, charming, golden, and unique.... We've been to Bangkok before but this was our first visit to Wat Saket, the Golden Mount.Originally the highest point in Bangkok, this ancient monument has now been superseded by many of the tall skyscrapers, ....none however are within coooeee of this Wat, and so a pretty clear line of sight around the city.I'm not sure why anyone is commenting on steps. You'd have to be pretty unfit to notice them. I'm a 52 year old woman, very average health, and I don't remember being worried about the steps...or even noticing them.We visited with our two teen boys, who both enjoyed it as well. Starting off at the base, you findyour way up the entry...to the pathway that includes small grottos and waterfalls, orchids and delightful statues, cool and enticing with the sounds of running water and bells. There was also a Buddhist monk chanting out his words of ..prayer?, over a microphone, but it added to the atmosphere. A line of huge brass bells aches to be rung, 1 time each..along the line. The giant gong gets hit, gently, 3 times. Do it, it's fun. Don't forget to stop and take pictures of the gorgeous flowers.At the golden stupa it's so blindingly beautiful. Only the Thai's can do this and not be ostentatious. Inside you find your way to the top, and make sure you find the corner stairs where you can get to the roof to look out over the city. What a lovely view.Inside you'll see statues and icons and relics, and other religious artifacts. This is a working temple so be respectful. Ladies make sure your arms & legs are covered and don't wear anything too revealing or you won't be allowed in.Lovely, just a short visit of 1/2 was just right. Taxi back downstairs was waiting for us. So cheap, you can easily ask a taxi to wait, then you don't have to go to the trouble of finding another vehicle.
landmark. this temple is another great beautiful landmark of bangkok's old city. very nice view from up on the mountain. there are precious relics on top of the golden mount stupa. a must see.

Hidden gem in th heart of Bangkok.. To reach the temple, you have to climb quite a few stairs but the path is just amazingt. Plenty of trees, shades, flowers and sents. At the top, amazing view over Bangkok.

Great views over Bangkok. Not the most famous temple. Main attraction are the views over Bangkok. The temple interior is nothing much. The climb is not too steep and within 5 minutes you have a great view.

Nice, nothing special. This is a nice temple, you climb a lot of stairs to get there, but get a nice view of the city from up top.Nothing special to see inside the temple itself, visit more for the view from up top.
Good. Doesn't cost a thing and is really worth the visit. the view is great from the top and we saw our hotel/

What a way to. See Bangkok...and...it's free!!. How the city has changed from this panoramic vista! I remember first coming here nearly 40 years ago and there very few skyscrapers and nary a crane! It's still a fabulous place to take in the view of Bangkok with a 360 degree view of the city. It is wondrous as is the cooling breeze that nearly always greets the visitor reaching the very top. The temple at the base is welcoming for those who wish to take time out to pray, meditate or just have a few moments of silence...it always seems that temples are an oasis of silence and peace in the hubbub that is this Bangkok!!A holy site for Buddhists, there is always a stream of people making there way to the top with presentations of flowers etc.For tourists, there are toilets at the base free or donation, drink sellers and a small shop selling both drinks and "souvenirs".Enjoy...it is free and what a view.

Less busy and Unique structure. Found this Wat to be quite charming and different structure than the rest.
