A nice walk up to the top - just make sure to not give up when you're actually in the building! Look for the small staircase in one of the corners that lead to the rooftop to see the real nice view.
Nice view by night. We walk to the gold mountain área by night. It is a safe part of the city, without the Bangkok noise and It have a nice view.

Uniqueness of this Attraction - Buddha's Relics Kept Here!!!. As my title above suggest. Other reviewers have/had mentioned the hundreds of stairs .... The nice views and so on. So I will skip all of those mentioned and keep this short.The uniqueness of this attraction is that Buddha's Relics are being kept here. How did I know? Well, this was told by our guide who we engaged to bring us around to see Religious Places for the day.As u enter the main hall after u have made it up, U will see candles and joss sticks at one side of the hall. There will also be a table, where a monk will be there to chant for u if u make a small donation. Just somewhere in between, u will see a small flight of stairs (about 5 to 8 steps). Walk up and u will see it. It is shape like a mini stupa. But u will not see the relics as they are inside the stupa.After that, u can proceed towards the top of the building to take more pics if u want. Or u can just enjoy the breeze at the top.The place is also not too crowded. If u have to do a small prayer there, please do it in front of the relics.As a mark of respect, certain religious places, I will not take any pics. This place is definitely one of those even though I really wanted to deep down inside me.Anyway, just be open minded and open hearted while u are there. Just enjoy the peacefulness and maybe on the way out, please make a small donation if u can.

Amazing view, nice breeze. The stairs leading up to the top are quite many but keep going, the view is breath-taking and the breeze is really nice. I visited this place a few times and the sun could be a little too hot. If you can choose the time, go early in the morning before the sun gets strong or sunset time to fully take in the view of Bangkok from this lovely temple
Worth doing. It's a nice little cheap activity to do. Nice walk up a hill threw garden and then bells.Good view at the top, and not far from other sites.
Bangkok Views. The best views of Bangkok city are seen from here. On the way up, there are many bells and interesting statues.
great views of the city. Liked that the stairs are not daunting, the view from the top was rewarding. No touts or souvenir sellers to distract from the experience.

Great temple and views, but not free like it says on here!. Whilst not the most impressive wat that Bangkok has to offer, it was still great to see, you climb some stairs up to the top to get a great view over Bangkok. The entrance fee is either 10 or 50 THB, I can't remember exactly but it is still less than £1 so still worth it!

The Glorious Golden Mount. A trip to the Golden Mount really is worth it you pay a small fee (more of a donation) to go to the mount itself. It's a lovely climb, with lots of lovely cultural artifacts and rituals to be seen along the way...and then when you arrive at the top there's that beautiful 360° view of Bangkok.Really worth a visit!!! A beautiful Bangkok attraction!!

Climb to the top great view. great view at the top, follow the path for blessings of all sorts. The Buddha image in the center before you go up the stairs is nice to put gold leaf and a prayer. Really enjoy the breeze up top as its usually not very crowded can relax and look around on a clear day in BKK.

Great Views from the Top. There are a ridiculous amount of temples to visit when you are in Thailand. It's difficult to know which ones to explore, because of the amount of options to choose from. The Golden Mount is definitely one to check out when in Bangkok. The hike to the top of the mount is somewhat arduous, but the reward of being able to look out onto the city from on top of the mount is well worth the workout. If you don't want to organize a tour to the mount, you can easily get here by taxi or tuk tuk.
Bells sound magical!. Very nice, the first thing we visited in Bangkok. The sound of bells bring some sort of magic to it, feels very spiritual.

Really enjoyed it. Its not too difficult to find. We got off the boat taxi down one of the rivers and it was a short walk away. Sticks up a reasonable height above the buildings so you can spot it. I believe the entrance fee was something like 50 THB and it might take a bit of walking around the mount to find the entrance. The walk up is cool it goes through various levels with ever increasingly better views of the city. Once you're at the top you ascend some very small and tight stairs to get to the very top. The view from up here is panoramic of the city and is definitely cool if you've got some time to explore Bangkok.
In the heart between old and new Bangkok. The views at the top was really good, the structure of the 'mountain' is pretty interesting. Minutes away from the famous Thipsamai restaurant.

Great for the view but much better wat's. We walked up this place and it was very nice and has a great aspect over the city. The wat itself seamed out down but the view but still impressive. Go and enjoy.
Golden Mount temple. It was a good time climbing to the top of the golden mountain and pray homage to the Buddha there. There is a coffee shop on the way to the top, too.
a splendid view from the top. For those who like climbing, just kidding,worth to be seen and understanding a way of life in Thailand

Worth a look. I highly enjoyed this little trek up the mount. It was very tranquil and you could take it at your own pace. The view from the top is incomparable to anything else I saw in the city. It is defiantly worth the little walk.

Very good place. A wonderful place to see in the centre of the Bangkok.Its a quiet place in the top of the hill.It's only difficult to walk in the stairs to reach in the top to reach the temple.Lots of bell and just ring the bell for good luck.

A real delight. As a long term resident, I always take friends and family here when they visit Bangkok. The Golden Mount is usually very quiet during the week but can turn chaotic on weekends or Buddhist holidays. It's lovely to walk up the winding stairs to the Golden Mount, perched on top of a small hill. Make sure you ring the bells along the way for good luck! The large gong halfway up is a popular photo op too. The top of the Golden Mount has a lovely view of the surrounding area but it can get blisteringly hot up there in the middle of the afternoon. The entry fee is 20 baht, which is great value for money considering the price of entry for nearby temples. Most taxi / tuk tuk drivers will know Golden Mount (Pu Kao Tong in Thai) or the adjoining Wat Saket. Highly recommended.
Great views from the top.. Came across this one by accident but well worth a look.Was here i the evening but still got a good view of the city.
Great views on a sunny day. Very nice spot to take some pictures of the city. The way up is very easy and has some really nice Buddha statues on the top. Highly recommended on a sunny day.
Beautiful. It is not the most famous sights that are recommended, but it is unmissable. The Golden Mount is well preserved, comparing to the other temples.

Really Worth Your Time. A tuk tuk driver took me to this place on his tour he arranged for me. The view was spectacular. The walk up the stairs to the top was good exercise. It is a low key religious site with not a lot of tourists, but a few. It was free when I went. There are some other interesting buildings in the area. It is a little escape and a nice place to go. Very peaceful.

Little escape to the golden stupa. This site is like a little mount. Going throw the way in spiral, there are a lot of bells that you can ring on.The pick is the best. Nice views and nice golden stupa. The ticket is really cheap!

Nice temple. Off the beaten tourist track but again different enough to warrant a visit. A lot of walking but not steep or strenuous, to get to the top. A giant golden bell type dome at the top. You can go up inside and climb the narrow steps to the top but I didn't do it. It was nice to walk around as you were high up and it had good views out over the city. It was part of a tour - our 6th temple. It had shops nearby so you could get drinks.

Architecturally not great but fantastic views. The temple lies at the top of a hill. There is a circular staircase which coils the hill like a snake. The climb is not at all steep and there are benches midway up to the top. Unless you are Buddhist, the only reason you can climb for is because of the fantastic 360 degree views that you get from the top. You can see a lot of Bangkok from the top. You can also climb to the roof of the temple through some narrow steps inside the temple. Unlike other temples, this one has shops selling cold drinks, souvenirs etc inside the temple. Inside a smaller chamber lies the Buddha statue and the area for worship. The hill lies in the middle of a bigger temple complex. On the ground level, there are quite a few small monasteries and halls. There is also a giant sitting Buddha statue. There are also quite a few bells and two giant gongs, you have to swing a big piece of log at them to make sound. On the way down you will come across a place where there are statues of a group of vultures eating a dead man - a Zoroastrian custom.There is no strict dress code for this temple, but of course dress sensibly, it is a religious place after all. The National Stadium BTS station is the nearest, you can take a cab or tuk tuk from there to reach this temple. It takes around 10-15 mins depending on traffic. You can see the whole complex in around an hour. If you are travelling with children, then most definitely go there, they would love it.

Buddha............................................... A temple on the top of the mountain,good place to visit,which will rise your confidence on buddhisim,view of the bangkok from the top of the temple excellent,Temple maintained well,Must visit temple in the Bangkok.

Tourist Friendly. A bit out of the way for most Bangkok tourists as any visit will likely involve negotiating with a taxi or tuk-tuk driver, usually an invitation for a minor rip-off unless one speaks Thai. But this is a nice and expansive complex to visit but it is very crowded with visitors, especially on weekends.

Great Views. Took a Khlong canal boat here. Could see the temple from the canal - golden rooftop glistening in the sunshine. The walk up the hill is pleasant and once I got to the top I was greeted with incredible panoramic views over the city.

Lovely but just take care.... It was lovely to visit but it is a place people take you to scam you to go to overpriced jewellery shops - happened to me and others I know, so just enjoy the place and don't get into conversation!

Good views. We happened to go on a day where it was free to get to the top- a real bonus and a surprise. A tuktuk driver suggested a visit as we were too early to visit another attraction, and for a 1/2 hour stop, it was perfect. The steps are shallow and curve around the wat and the views from the top over the city were great. We had a group of school children up there at the same time of us and it was really quite a sight. We enjoyed ringing the bells and having a little bit of calm in a crazy city!
Interesting!. It was very interesting. I am happy we went to this place, inspite it was not too easie due to "revolution" problems in Bagckok.

Great views. Great views from the top however there isn't much else around the area where the temple is. The grounds are very nice and have lots of cool areas to rest which are a welcome break from the heat. I was rewarded with a nice breeze up the top too which was great! A nice time filler
Not a lot here.... Went here as it was one of the number one attractions but there is not a lot there, the wat is very average. The best thing was the views of Bangkok.

Average. The view from the top is certainly good (weather permitting), the Wat itself is not so special. The many stairs up are not an issue at all - they are very small in height, meaning that the rise is not very steep. I guess that's another reason there are so many stairs. Along the way up, there are rows of bells, which the schoolchildren ring - all of the children ring all the bells :-) while laughing. It was very sweet. There is now a price of 20 or 25 Baht to enter. I took a motorcycle taxi from National Stadium Skytrain station and back again. I might have paid way to much (80 Baht one way), but was surprised to discover upon negotiating for the price that they independently of reach other refused to do it for less.
Worth the climb. Very nice time climbing the steps to the top the place is crowded but well organized. Good experience with children

Religious cum scenic. Temple is situated at little height with few 100 steps but not hard to climbThe statue of Budha is very lively and you have feel of life in it. I had prayer and seem being heard by lord.There is one tradition way to ask guestion about your future or your uncertainety. You are given some sticks in holder and when you shake one stick come out of it. The number printed on stick have pamplets stick on wall. You can read amd I felt it was very true.Must visit.

Beautiful landmark. This Temple is a very unique and beautiful structure. From the top of the Temple you get a great view of the city of Bangkok. Do not go with small children because there are stairs to get you to the top. Shorts must be below your knees like most Temple in Thailand. This Temple is not far from the river taxi and that is a great way to get to this Temple. Definitely a must see on your trip to Thailand.

Out of the Way but Worth It. The view from the top of the Golden Mount is something you won't want to miss. Bangkok is pretty flat and this viewpoint let us really see the city. You come for the temple but you stay for the view.
Great views. Not too crowded, amazing views from the top, extremely hard to find without a tuk tuk.. Lovely scenery as you walk up through the garden and all the steps.. Well worth a visit
Really cool place with excellent views. Lots of steps but loads to look at along the way. Really enjoyed the peacefulness in amongst the crazy city.
Skycraper avant la lettre. This Bangkok Landmark is on an artificial hill, that shold not be missed if only for the excellent view over old Bangkok. Or what's left of it.

Well Worth the Stairs. This was one of our first stops in Bangkok and I really enjoyed it. Be aware there are about 300 stairs to climb but the view from the top is fantastic. I will note that we had a private tour guide with us at this site and I doubt that I would have really liked or appreciated it without her. She explained all of the history and the meanings behind all of the statues etc. For example on the way in is all the animals that represent your birth year. I would have totally missed this if not for her. Same thing with the statues you see on the climb up and the Buddhas at the top that represent the day of the week you were born. We learned about which direction to walk and why and the meaning of the money/writing people were leaving. She also pointed out from the top everything we were looking down at. I don't know if there are guides you can hire there but if there are probably well worth it.I thought the whole site was very beautiful and it was extremely cheap to enter. I think I noted bathrooms there as well. There were no restrictions on the photos and we took a lot.We took the canal boat here which took us right there and made it even more of a fun trip.
Something to see. Maybe we were just holiday'd out by then. Didn't find it at all exciting but it was there so we went and saw it.

Worth the climb for the view. It's not a steep climb like Wat Arun but there are 300 steps to climb: be ready for it. If you're not going to visit any sky bars, this is probably the best city view you will get in Bangkok. The entry fee is only 20 baht, the gardens on the way up are nice, there is a cafe halfway up. Do not miss looking at the Wat Saket grounds around the mountain as the monks' quarters are beautiful buildings as well. If you're coming from the Democracy Monument direction there's an entrance on Boripat Road or you can enter from Chakkaphatdi Phong Road and walk 200 palm-lined meters through the complex. There are probably other entrances, as well. Anyway, well worth the effort.

Great view and experience. Take some water with you as you'll need a drink when you eventually climb the stairs to the top. The 360 degree view is worth the climb.If you're lucky, a few of the monks also speak English and are more than happy to chat with you for as long as you like.I did this and had the monk then show me around the place more and explain some of the meaning behind Thai Buddhism and the temple. It helped having a Thai girlfriend with me but do yourself a favour and ask a monk a few questions anyway.I found it a great experience.

The Best Wat To Visit In BKK. i loved this place,it was a taxi ride away from wat arun but so worth it,it is beautiful and the walk upto the top is slightly draining in the heat but have a bottle of water with you and dont rush and it will be fine.the view once you reach the top is as jaw dropping as they come.i could of stayed here for hours and people watched,You MUST visit here if you come to BKK,you will not be disappointed.

Fantastic Temple. I loved visiting this temple. The view from the top is great. The climb up the steps which curl around the building is really cool. As one gets higher the temperature becomes more pleasant and cooler. The grounds are nice and well cared forMake sure you go to the roof section and take advantage of the view.To get there can be troublesome as taxi drivers say they don't know it or they bluntly refuse to take you. So....the best way is to go to Chidlom Central world area and catch the canal boat to the area near the Golden Mount...ask the boat man to take you near the Golden Mount and say Wat Saket. Its a short walk from the canal boat. The canal boat ride in itself is an experience!

Another Must See!. This is another must see in Bangkok, dont let the 300+ stairs scare you they are ot steep and very easy to climb. The view from the top is awesome and the kids will love to bang the gongs and the bells along the walk up! Dont forget to play the sticks game (for a small donation) and get your fortune in the lobby of the Wat and to see the shrine of the Buddha bone inside the temple! Get a nice ice coffee on the way up or down - good stuff!

very nice temple with a good view. The temple is probably not one of the most visited ones in Bangkok, but in my opinion still a very nice place. You can feel the special aura of this place, when you visit it and if you are lucky, you might meet a talkative Buddhist monk to tell you some interesting aspects of Buddhism.The Golden Mount is one of the oldest Buddhist temples in Bangkok. Stairs of 318 steps lead to the 79 meters high artificial mountain, crowned by a golden chedi. From here you have a great view of Bangkok.The construction of the temple started under Rama I around 1785 and was only finalized under King Chulalongkorn (Rama V, end of 19. century).

Buddha Mystery. It is good spot to watch sunset after you climb the stairs up. It is not easy to find the gate the temple but you certainly would enjoy seeing Buddha setting under showers or water and smoke. If you pass by on your back you notice that they shut the smoke effect and Buddha sits alone there :). It is nice place to visit!

Peaceful place in Bangkok. This place is fun to visit. However, it is not very long and not very interesting, if it is for the view you have over the city. There is a lot of Buddha statues and praying places. There is also many bells (like other temples in Thailand). The entrance fee is about 40 baht per person, which is cheap for Bangkok temple. I would recommend to get there only if you have some extra time in your trip, as other temples are much more impressive. If you decide to go, don’t forget that you need some clothes to cover the knees and the shoulders, like in most Buddha temples.
Very nice, good atmosphere, great view. Expect to spend about 1-2 hr. Walking up to the top and see a great view of historic Bangkok. May not good if you have difficulty walking or handicapped
A nice 'mountain' in the middle of Bangkok. There was actually a pretty interesting temple at the top. It was most fun just walking up the 'mountain' and ringing all the bells.

Good to go around the Sunset. It's a great place to go around the sunset or may be even sunrise as it offers a 360 degree view of the old city. The architecture is regular as in other temples but yes, it's beautiful.3.5/5

Not to be missed!. I had found a black and white photo of the Golden mount taken by my mother during the war so this was a special place for my brothers and sister and I to visit. The donation is a pittance and we added to the box on our way out. There is circular climb (steps) to reach the top with beautiful orchids and flowers and statues and bells along the way. It is a temple (shoes off at the top) and the history is interesting. Scenic views of Bangkok of course.A very, very special place.Opposite the entrance is a tiny shop/restaurant. The food was cheap and good and we had a ball with the twin sisters who own the place. One was Miss Bangkok in 1980 and the shop is filled with family photos.This just made our day!

Wat Saket is worth a visit. Rama III built the original but over time this collapsed due to the soft Bangkok soil, and has taken on this steep sided hill. This was then used to build the temple with marble, and is worth a visit.

Brilliant. We were told about the Golden Mount before we went to Thailand and it lived up to expectations. The view from the top was amazing and for 20 baht (~£0.40) it was well worth it. The climb was easy enough for us 4 backpackers with bells along the way that you could ring. I wasn't sure of the significance of these, but I assume they were for the monks climbing up. We spent about 3/4 of an hour at the top just taking in the view and watching lightning hit the other side of the city. We went up this on our way to the other sites in the old city of Bangkok. Brilliant start to the day for us.

Great views. Bit of a trek, and not that much else, but worth it for the view at the top over all Bangkok. Worth the entrance fee, which is pretty inexpensive, and so long as you're up for the steep climb it's something you've really got to do in Bangkok and is only a short tuk tuk ride from other sights.

A nice view but a stiff climb for some. Some rather bizarre reviews below featuring mentions of paganism and the idea that it's free (it costs 20TB to get in the entrance I found, so unless they were sneaking past it there must be another way in!).Anyway, it's definitely a nice view from the top but unless you are quite young or spry it might test your legs a little bit. I felt a bit of a naughty boy ringing all the bells on the way up, but it seems all the tourists do that - there's a huge impulse in all human beings if they see a bell they have to ring it I guess.

Great View. One of my favourites in Bangkok, If your able to swing past on one of your routes its a nice place visit.Its a random hill in Bangkok with good views, there are quite a few steps, so take some water and there are many bells to chime on the way up. Its somewhere for a quick visit, but I really liked it.

A walk up to serenity. Wat Saket, or the Temple of the Golden Mount, is one of Bangkok's most iconic temples, alongside that of Wat Arun, Wat Po and Wat Phra Kaew. The temple is located in Bangkok's 'old city' district where buildings are much shorter. Hence, climbing up to the top of Wat Saket presents you with a wonderful panoramic view of Bangkok which is totally distinct from the towering skyscrapers from the 'new city' district. Also, once on top, take time to take in the cool air and marvel at the golden stupa. You will find the peace and serenity that will soothe your tired limbs.

Nice temple, tiring however... Yes its worth the climb, it was pretty amazing actually to climb and get a overall view of the city of Bangkok and its many beautiful surrounding temples, and afterwards you can go and explore the temples around it too, entering it one by one until all of them eventually look the same to you lol.

not many tourists!. We got there by public bus. There was not many tourists at that time. We climbed up stairs and rang a lot of bells. It was fun! When we reached up to the top, it was such a nice view.There was a golden statue when you passed the Buddha inside and we kept going through the narrow stairs. There was a little statue. Some Thai people rubbed the wallet on the statue. When I asked the Thai people, they gestured me for getting money or good for money??? Anyway why not?! I just copied them at the end:)

A worthwhile visit. We visited this temple recently on our visit to Bangkok and was very impressed,was my favourite temple to visit,and i highly recommend it.There is a cafe for refreshments and a nice souvenir shop on top of the mountain.

Great View!. It felt like a Disneyland Ride! Very well maintained and a great view from the top. I could have stayed up there all day to enjoy the breeze. Had fun shaking sticks out to have our fortunes told.

Peace and Quiet. I visited this Temple on the same day as I visited the temple of the Golden Buddha, and I liked this one a lot more due to it's peaceful feeling.The stairs are quite easy to climb but obviously deter a lot of tourists as there was hardly anyone else there. Both up and down you pass bells to ring as well as fun little features like waterfalls built into the side of the hill/mountain and there was a lovely breeze and a great view from the top.There is an entry fee, but I think it was about 20baht. Remember to take a water bottle and stop for an ice-cream at the little shop down the bottom. There are toilets at a little cafe just as you start the walk up the stairs.

Looks like mixed religion. Need to walk distances on foot and climb stairs. Many beautiful flowers and lotus flowers are bloomed around the path. Top of the hill, big windows of temple are opened, seats are set under windows. Wind blows and sweat cools down. Brightly decorated inside and unigue fragrants everywhere. Atmosphere inside, it looked like a mixed religion with Buddahism and local pagan.
Many Steps. The view from up there is amazing. I like the temple and since its free no worries go as many times as you like! Make sure you carry water because it is hot and many steps to take!

inspirational. Wat Saket is amazing structure of history and nature. Stairs lead you to the top,and you will enjoy every minute of it.
Do not forget to ring the bells which are hung all over the temple.

Must visit !. I live nearby the Golden mount. for years, it is an amazing place to visit when you come to Thailand, you can get a good view of Bangkok city while walking up the mount. the temple is gold ( as stated by the name), up the mount there are Buddhas to pay respect and wish for luck with the old decoration with ancient thai history.It is a must visit place for tourist !
go for the view!. The view of Bangkok from the top is great! also climbing the steps through a beautiful tropical garden was nice.

Very pleasant place. In fact, the way to get to Wat Saket is one of the greatest thing of this place. The temple is simple and quite small, but you have to climb lovely stairs to get there. There are some little cascades and beautiful statues along the way. Upstairs there is a beautiful view of Bangkok, and you can see lots and lots of temples around the city, as well a skyline with modern buildings in contrast to the old city.
Golden Mount. The view over the city is wonderful and you can see all the way around the temple and look out over Bangkok - and the temple bells make a lovely photo.
What a climb. Amazing views from the top but pace yourself and make sure you have plenty of water interesting statues on the way.
Golden and highest temple. One of highest temple in bangkok, you can view bangkok surrounding at rooftop! nice temple to visit.

Soothing view after a hot day. I'd say the best time to visit this observatory temple is in the afternoon. Amazing view, cool blowing wind. Pay attention for a small staircase to the rooftop! You wouldn't want to visit gold mount without going to the top, right?

Beautiful View. This was the first temple we visited, easily access by the canal water taxi's via the central station stop. Quite a hike to the top with a beautiful view, it was a great way to kick off our wat and temple tour of the old city. This site is unique as it is built on a man made hill which is quite impressive.

Our favorite spot in Bkk. This place is a real relief in the busy Bangkok! Up the hill, the wind blows, giving you some fresh air during the hot day. The atmosphere is calm, and the view is excellent.
A perfect quiet temple to visit if you felt stressed after the royal palace, which is not so far away by walk...

Nice views. Try to go there by boat (nana pier,, Chitlom pier, ...)
There are a fiew steps to get to the top bit it is really worth it. Nice temple and great views of the surroundings.
Culture place. Deffinetly worth your visit... not so busy as all the famouse Wats. From roof nice sight. Graves of all the monks and perhaps others? Interesting place :-)

A quiet spot compared to other attractions. A nice stop on your tour of Bangkok - not too expensive, good views of the city and quieter than other attractions. After going to the Grand Palace though it’s not nearly as impressive as some of the buildings there. One thing I must say is the walk up and down to the Mount is really nice. Parts of it are surrounded but trees with mist coming from fountains and small shrines with offerings. It feels very peaceful. Note: I think that the cost for this is dependent on either the time you go or the entrance you take. We were charged, but others I’ve heard got in for free.

Peaceful. For a small fee you can have a chance to see a really nice view of Bangkok from above. Just be prepared to climb a lot of steps. It is totally no-wheelchair friendly. As you climb the stairs you forget that you are in the heart of Bangkok as it is all surround with plants and also a small cascade.

Little oasis in the middle of bangkok. This was a beautiful experience in a city where there isn't that much culture going on. Serene and calm in the middle of the asphalt jungle. Nice views of the cityscape from the top.

Beautiful. Very beautiful. Make sure you take advantage of the museums (most included in ticket) for the AC and some more culture. If you take a photo of the emerald Buddha make sure you don't show a local, it is sacred.

Great views of Bangkok. Nice place to visit to see Bangkok from a height. The Wat is lovely and a very large compound with well maintained gardens and surrounding buildings. Definitely worth climbing the stairs for the view.
Great view of city. Wonderful views of the city from the top. A long walk at the end of the day, but worth it! The temple is worth a stop, but the view is why you go here.

Great views of Bangkok. We found and loved on our visit to Wat Saket that there were only a handful of tourists here. We climbed the stairs to the Golden Mount and were rewarded with 360 degree views of the city. Our arrival coincided with the beginning of sunset which enhanced the view that much more. We caught a klong taxi to the Wat, which was very enjoyable also. It is certainly worth including Wat Saket into your Bangkok itinerary.

Less visited war, worth a visit. This wat gets a lot less tourists than Wat Po or the Grand Palace, which makes for a more peaceful visit. Great views over the city and some beautiful buddhist statues and pieces to see

Wat Saket - Where you find the Golden Mount. The Golden Mount (Wat Saket) is a major attraction that we have quite enjoyed during trips to Bangkok. The temple is worth a quick visit but the real star is the manmade Golden Mount (฿20 per person), which we find to be a genuinely unique place to experience, particularly for first-time visitors to the city. Within Wat Saket temple, you will find typical buddha statues and other items of worship. In the Convocation Hall there are some nice wall murals as well (see pictures). Within the main temple building you can find a nice standing, dressed Buddha Statue is nice to see. Then it is time to move on the the main attraction, the Golden Mount. While the temple itself is nice to visit, it is the the Golden Mount that makes a visit here special. This is a giant, manmade hill, which was constructed during the reign of King Rama III. After paying your entry fee, you make a relatively comfortable, ascending walk up and around the Golden Mount in a clockwise direction. There are some Buddha statues, other figures and hanging bells that you can see as you walk up the hill. The walk takes around 8-10 minutes and there are a few benches you can use to take a rest if the heat or sun are causing you difficulty. The walk is quite manageable even during the midday heat, just take your time. At the top, there is an indoor worship hall and small gift shop, a nice stop if you want to buy drinks. There you will find a further set of indoor stairs leading you to a top of the hall. Here you find a flat surface, a golden chedi structure, additional Buddhist idols and some very nice 360 degree views of the city. It is enjoyable to hang out here and enjoy the views before returning back down the Golden Mount to visit the temple below or to move on to other attractions in the city. In the end, a visit to Wat Saket temple and Golden Mount can be done in 30-45 minutes. It is a nice attraction that we find well worth visiting during trips to Bangkok.

A must see!!. This is a great place to visit. The way going up to the temple towards the top is fabulous, full of orchids and other tropical flowers, little waterfalls and when you arrive at the top you can see the whole of Bangkok. Fabulous!
very nice temple. not so easy to get but worth the trip. not so touristic like most temple, so nice to walk around here. very peacefull. a must do in bkk

Worth a visit, be pepared for some stairs. If you are staying in downtown, very easy to access with a canal boat used by locals for daily commute. We did not climb to the top, but you are likely to have a good veiwe from there.

Beautiful, serene and peaceful. Must See. One of the best sites in Bangkok. Quieter than sites such as The Grand Palace and Sleeping Buddha, more tranquil and peaceful the way a temple should be. Magnificent views from the mountain as well as a pleasantly serene journey up and down.

A must see in Bangkok. We went with a Tour with Tong guide who explained the various elements to make it worthwhile. The grounds climbing up are steep, but misty water cools you down. There are many bells to ring and gongs as well as cultural type elements there. View over the old city is great, although I expected the palace etc. to be much closer. Great place and well worth going to see on top of the Wat Pho. Each Wat is unique.

Must see place in Bangkok. It is amazing place with beautiful view of Bangkok. The best thing is the bell sound around you. You can try the really thai street food near the entrance. Absolutely magnificent!

Wonderful views. Be prepared for a climb. There are a good few steps but the view, and the temple, are worth it. We went at the end of the day. It was hot and the fresh breeze was very welcome and just added to the romanticism.

Nice View of Bangkok. We reached the Golden Mount (Wat Saket) by walking 3 hours from the Temple of Golden Buddha. (Being lost contributed to the time.) The distances on maps without scales are deceptively long. We would take a taxi next time. Two in our party looked at the long staircase and decided to stay below. (We did not search for an elevator.) My brother and I walked up. I did not count the steps but there are many (100?) We stayed for about 40 minutes viewing the city from the top. The view is interesting showing the old and new Bangkok. There are many bells along the stair path but we did not bang one until we saw some locals did it in a non ceremonial way. There were people praying on top floor. We spent some time watching their movements.

Worth a visit. It felt a little out of the way from everything else however its worth a visit. The walk up the hill to the temple is nice and also the views of Bangkok are quite nice from there. Its free entry as well.

Wat Saket temple. Our time in Bankok, moslty only spent for spraying and visit the temple. Where the place I can lay down my soul. Close your eyes pray for the best thing with the bell sound right beside your ears. Well worth a visit if you are in the area.

My favorite temple.. This was a quiet temple with a great view. I would recommend it as a brief break from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok's many other tourist sites. The views are great, and the walk is not bad at all.
Busy tourist site. This was a very popular tourist destination but worth visiting. I loved the prayer bells outside the temple.

Beautiful place, wonderful view of Bangkok. Well worth a visit, such a lovely place and really beautiful view. Would definitely advise this place to anyone staying in Bangkok, it's right by the waterway boat taxi bus things too so it's worth checking those out.

Amazing view of Bangkok. I visited golden mount temple on my own (without a guide). I just took the taxi there and explored the temple. I was pleasantly surprised at how walker friendly the steps were (not steep at all and very wide). There was a shop where you could get a popsicle or drink to enjoy while climbing up. It didn't take me too Ling to make it up there. The view was so beautiful! The surrounding areas if the temple were also lively. The was a lot of lush vegetation and animal statues near the base of the hill. I highly recommend this temple! It was pleasantly empty when I went (not overrun by tourists)

Less visited, but really worth the effort. A 50 baht taxi ride from anywhere downtown or on the riverside. Completely different to the other temples, absolutely magnificent, built on a high artificial hill with curling roads and paths around it. Greta views of he city from any place on the temple itself. Very interesting Buddhas, about 2 metres high, completely hidden under huge amounts of votive gold leaf. And free!
Cheap and great view of the city. super cheap entry-only 20 baht! It was really nice to see the city from the top, although be careful to bring water. The stairs can be a lot if its a hot, sunny day.
Nice enough. It's ok, cheap enough, not really much of a time killer though. The main thing is the beautiful views when you get up to the top!

Tranquil and lovely. This seemed a lot less busy than a lot of the other 'Wats' in Thailand. Just make sure you walk up the correct set of steps! I was wondering why everyone was giving me strange looks on the way up - then I realised there was a separate set of steps to walk up and I hadn't realised... do'h!The bells on each level are indeed beautiful and whilst it's slightly painful walking up the steps on a very hot day with no wind, it's not that bad at all. When at the top, a monk actually asked if there was anything I needed to know, and the whole place had a lovely tranquil feeling to it - no hurry, no rushing around. There are both toilets and street food very close by, so definitely worth an hours stop or so - wouldn't suggest you'd need any longer to admire this place but certainly wouldn't suggest missing it.
A must-see. Great historic sight. A must-see on your list. Best earlier in the day before the hordes arrive. Easy to get to via river boats.

Another interesting Wat. Wat Saket (or the one with the Golden Dome) contains a chedi made of marble and is situated on a steep artificial hill. It actually has its origins from the Ayutthaya era, although it has been rebuilt since then. In November of each year, a Buddhist candlelight procession is held here, up the hill to the chedi. Entrance to Wat Saket compound is free, although nowadays they charge a small amount (10Baht or so) to see the chedi itself. I enjoyed visiting Wat Saket, but there is a real danger with the temples in Bangkok that you can get bored very easily. Wat Arun is your best bet, along with the Grand Palace.
wonderful. The places is really different with other. It is so nice ana when we stand here we can see many thing in Bk :X Further more, the atmosphere is so good

Go for the bells, not the view!. After reading a bunch of reviews, I was a little disappointed that the view wasn't more amazing. So, instead of focusing on the view at the top, think about that as just one part of this fun adventure. On your trek up the long staircase along the wall of the building, there are MANY bells. Ring them! There is also a giant gong and some fun flowers along the way.I would still encourage this visit, but don't just go for the view- you may be disappointed.Oh, and bring water. :) They sell some beverages at the top, but they're a bit over priced.

Great place to go. A really good place to visit Quite unexpected The climb up is not too onerous and there are views and things to see at each level. You can hit the gong and ring the bells too. Splendid view from the top. Only 20 bhatt to enter the climbing area. At tge foot of the mount are statues depicting each of the years eg rabbit, etc great photo opportunity. Well worth a visit if you are in the area!!!

Wonderful Views. A long climb up to the top but worth it for the stunning views of Bangkok. Recommend exploring all the buildings at the bottom too. The monks library is beautiful and worth exploring too.

Definitely worth to visit. Golden Mount is specific place in the heart of the Bangkok, where you can find beautiful garden near stairs leading up to a really nice panorama view of the whole city. Get ready to climb in heat.
Worth the climb. Make sure you have good shoes on. 300 plus steps to the top but well worth the climb. Watch out for the helpful Thai! Just another con artist

A must visit during your BKK trip. Excerpt from www.sagarsonker.com/travel/thailand The best thing about TripAdvisor is that they allow links to my website. On my website, you will find photos, videos, and detailed information that is continuously updated.Wat Saket is a must visit Buddhist Temple. It takes not more than 20-25 minutes for an average person to climb up the easy stairs with halts. Even if it gets a bit tiring on the way, you can go up and relax in the main temple's hall on the top where there are fans to cool you down. The temple is beautiful, and shoes are allowed in. You can click photos without hesitation, and watch all the Buddha's beautiful golden statues, and pick up some souvenirs if you wish to. Note that you 'may' (not 100% sure) get those souvenirs at Chatuchak Market too.Not too much to do up there, but if you enjoy sitting and relaxing doing nothing (like me), clicking photos from top, and just being at a nice location, you will surely enjoy the place.GETTING THERE: Khlong Saen Saep Express Canal Boat (link on my website) is the easiest way to go there. Just go to one of its stations, check on the map for Panfa Leelard, and take the boat going in that direction. It's as simple as that. The ticket I took was from my hotel (Bangkok City Inn, reviewed separately), the closest station was Pratunam. It costed me 12 Baht, and it was a fun ride. After you get down at the Panfa station, and come out, you will be greeted by Tuktuk drivers telling you lies that the temple is closed between 12 and 3 pm, and that they will show you other places meanwhile in 20 Baht. It's a lie. The temple is open from 7:30 am to 5:30 pm. I don't know what they are up to, but I've heard that they take you to some shops and kind of force you to buy some gold. If you firmly say a, "No Thank You" (like I did, and I was alone and easy for them to 'catch'), they leave you easily saying, "Your wish". Then walk over that beautiful white canal overbridge, and after about 100-200 meters of walk, you will be at The Golden Mount. Enjoy.
Go to this place for the view on Bangkok. This temple is so different from others ! This place worth the visit for the beautiful panoramic view on Bangkok. Entry : 20bahts

Tranquil and great views. The walk to the top is not tough and the views are great. Very peaceful. Worth a stop. The surrounding neighborhood is also fun -- take the water taxi from Jim Thompson house to the temple (only 10 baht).

Lovely views of Bangkok!. We visited Wat Saket quite early in the morning, so it was peaceful and we enjoyed the lovely views from the top. A refreshing change from the bustling tourist crowds at The Palace and other temples. Unusually, there are signs saying to 'Remove Shoes' presumably because the surface of the spiral walkway up the mount can be slippery on a wet day. It's an easy walk to China Town afterwards. Don't miss visiting the Golden Mount!

360 Views and a great boat ride. the view across Bangkok is great. It was pretty quiet and had less regulation about dress code than other temples. It is close to one of the canal boat stations that Thai's use to get around town and we used this to get back to Asoke. A fun ride and cheap as chips. Definitely try the canal boat links
View. Great place for a walk and view of the city as this right on top of the mountainenjoyed the coffee shop half way up great for a cold drink and rest
Fabulous view of Bangkok. There were very few people here when we visited, which is not common in Bangkok. There was a breeze, and the view was great. Plus, there were Magnum bars for sale up top.

not too much to see. The teple and the view are nice, its ok if you are near by to stop by...we were staying at the baan dinso hotel wich was just a few blocks from there so we stopped by for the view

Buddhist atmosphere and lovely view of the city. Nice place, with a temple up a small hill. Pretty easy climb up the stairs, everyone can do it. I read the stupa up the hill contains sharira - a small part of cremated Buddha body which is usually put inside the most important Buddhist stupas. Also, a great overview of the city from the top. Admission 20 B.

Be prepared to climb - bring water with you. It takes quite a few steps to get up to the top. If it is hot, be sure to have drinking water with you (on the top you can also buy some). The entrance is cheap - just 20 baht, and from the top you have a really nice view over the city.

Deeply Spiritual. Our taxi driver took us to Wat Saket. We did not have the time to climb to the top. I wish we did. However, we went in the temple at the bottom where the monks were gathered and chanting. It is beautiful and the monks chanting was a deeply spiritual experience. I recorded it, so that I can listen to it over and over. This is a must-see sight in Bangkok.

Well worth a visit. Visited here by recommendation - bit of a hike up but the views are amazing. Make sure you pay your respects to the other two Buddhas in the grounds - and see the monks going about their daily business. Quiet upto other spots. 20 baht entry - less than 40p !! Currently being decorated so there are builders & decorators around.Y

View Bangkok from a manmade mountain in ancient China town. If you like to visit Buddhist temples and you have a few hours to spare in Bangkok - this is the one that I would recommend first. Yes even more than Wat Po and the Grand Palace. Why, because this is a more Thai place, has less tourists, and is a true marvel.
Good view. good view once you get to the tops, isn't too hard going physically ha, not much to dislike! is worth a visit, take 20-30 mins tops

A real oasis in the crowded city. We visited Golden Mountain in the afternoon so we could see the sunset. There were also less tourists and the whole place was a real oasis in the hustle and bustle of the city. The mountain is quite high, but after reaching the summit there are very nice views. Definitely a place worth a visit.

Great introduction to Bangkok. We came here as the first stop on our trip to Bangkok in the morning and it was a delight. Very cheap to go up and every step is enjoyable and littered with plants and other features before you arrive at the top which has a great selection of Buddhist artefacts and you can see the whole city around you.
Good views. There are som good views of Bangkok from the top and it was peaceful spot in this busy city. Lots of shops nearby selling all manner of Buddhas
Excellent view. One of the best Places to start your tour in Bangkok. You get a good look at the town from here and of course a fine Buddha at the top.
Good views from the Golden mount. It is worth walking up the Golden mount to get a decent panorama of Bangkok. The building itself is unexceptional.

A Wat with a View. This temple is set on a high base. You walk up on steps that spiral around the base of the temple. The steps are not high so it won't stress your feet. There are buddah statues, plants and flowers next to the steps as you ascend and there are large landings with bells that you can ring, all so that your climb will be slow and manageable. Once you climb the few hundred steps to the top, you can enter the temple. There are steps to the roof, where you can see the giant stupa and there are great views of the city on all 4 sides. A nice place to visit for the temple and for the views. At the base, they provide free water and there is a temple complex, although we did not visit the other buildings. By the way, there is an admission of 50 baht (less than $2 a person) so this attraction should be removed from the "free" attraction list. Highly recommended.
Years later I finally made it!. After 2 trips to Thailand I made it to the top after arriving late 1800 the first time . One of Thailand 's most precious monuments A MUST SEE!!

Golden Mount Bangkok. We walked to the Golden Mount from Pier No 5, The Ratchawong after getting off the Orange Flag river ferry. It took us about 1 hour to stroll up through the market stalls on the fringe of Chinatown, which we always find very fascinating. Wat Saket is an interesting Wat containing many buildings.The Golden Mount entrance is at the far end from Thanom Bamrung Muang, it is built up on a hill, the 300 steps up are through landscaped gardens which add to the attraction. It is only a small temple at the top,but it has a gleaming gold Chedi, containing Buddha's relics. You can gain access to the roof which gives good views back over the city. The final little spiral staircase is behind a door, inside the building,in the corner and could be easily missed.There is an entrance fee of 20 baht to the Golden Mount. Next to The Golden Mount is The Shrine Hall which contains two of Thailands most revered Buddha images,one of which is a standing Buddha over 10m tall.The Hall is in a large tiled courtyard and well worth a visit before you leave the area. We spent about an hour visiting this site. Returning to the Ferry Pier we did a detour off the main road into the warren of small alleyways through the markets and businesses of Chinatown.

good memories. golden mountain temple i been the first time with my best and we have good good memorie together and its a beautiful temple and we can see bangkok view on the top of the temple. really amazing

Golden Mountain. we saw this each day form our hotel bedroom window - did not realise how tall it was until we arrived - such a hot day due to it being 1st Jan in Bangkok too many people climbing up nd so hot to had to abandon trip to the summit as not used to 35 degree full sun heat

Cool breeze & panoramic view. Many would probably argue that Wat Saket is just another temple to see. This might be true when you have already seen other temples on a short period of time.Yet, the Golden Temple has its own charm. First, it is built on a man-made hill that provides a panoramic view over the city, provided it is a clear day. Several Thai Kings commissioned the construction. The golden stupa (known as 'chedi' rather than 'stupa' in Thailand) is at the top of the hill. Getting there is not really difficult as the stairs twist around part of the hill and are rather gentle. There are stairs to go up and others to go down. At the top platform, there is a magnificent 360º panorama over the whole city & you get a great view of the chedi. I would recommend to choose the end of the day as the sunlight provides a glow over the golden structure. But be careful because the downstairs cashier closes at 6:00PM (only 50B).The hill is in a well-tended garden and the adjoining monastery is worth visiting too.

Okay for filling spare time. We visited on New Years Day, when the chedi platform was crowded with worshippers. There are good views over Bangkok from the top of Golden Mount and it is a pleasant walk up the stairs to the top. If you have an hour to fill it is something you could do.

Beautiful Walk,view and Wat. Bring your mossie repellant for this walk up to the Wat. Very beautiful Buddha sculptures lined throughout the jungle leaves as you walk up the mount with a nice view of the city. Lots of people praying and tourists taking pictures.

Wat Saket. Wat Saket is hidden away very close to Bangkok's Chinatown district. It was, years ago, the highest point in Bangkok. As well as being a very unusual looking temple, it offers good views of the city from the top. It's best reached by travelling the MRT (subway) to Hualompong Station and then getting a taxi.

Yet another temple. Doing temples in Bangkok tend to make you a little bit picky and although it is a perfectly nice temple you might go at it thinking ok that was nothing spectacular.Wat Saket or the golden mount might be one of them. Although it is perfectly nice, one of the nice things about it being that it was nicely calm and not as crowded with tourists as many other temples in Bangkok tend to be.So as every temple in Thailand feeling a little bit different then the one before I think you should visit this one as well. At least for the calm and the fact that it has its golden mount!

Very Pertty and Great View!. Definitely worth a visit if you're in the area. It's easy to reach from Siam Square; just take the commuter ferry that runs along the canal near the Jim Thompson House (10 baht, and you get a real local experience along the way). Khao San Road is 10 minutes away on foot if you want to get some lunch or gawk at white tourists.

Breath Taking views. Once the highest location in all of Bangkok, its still a breath taking place, great complex. Make sure you get there early the complex closes at 5:30PM sharp, lots of great photo opportunities. You will climb up a spiral stair way, and every step you take the views over Bangkok get lovely, from the very top you can get a 360 degree view of the city, must visit complex.

Not Free anymore, but only 20 THB. This Wat is ok compared to the other I visited and I am not talking about Wat Pho or Wat Arun. It has a nice view of the city, I saw it on a clear day and took several photos. The bad part is the surroundings. There was no clear sign for the entrance and little information about the exhibits around the temple. Not a bad place but there are better places.

Peaceful and great view. You will have to climb several steps to reach the top with many bells along the way. Circling the temple there are several spots to take a break and take pictures. At the top you are rewarded with a view of the city. You can also see the top of the Wat Phra Kaew from here

Same same but different. There are a LOT of temples in bangkok but this one is special because it is placed on a little hill therefore you can enjoy a short walk up the steps surrounded by trees until you reach the top of it and have a beautiful view over bangkok. It is one of the most beautiful Wat in bangkok and also very cheap. Go there bevor midday!

Culture in Bangkok City Centre 5. An interesting temple to visit with a good view of the city if you can get there on a clear day. Good luck with that one! There is a permanent smog over the city which leaves the skyline permanently hazy. There are quite a few steps to climb but not unmanageable - it is quite peaceful, even though it is in the heart of the city. Just take your time if you are not a fast mover.

Stunning views and a truly peaceful place. When in Bangkok, please do yourself the favour of visiting Wat Saket/The Golden Mount. I don't have words to describe how beautiful this place is and how peaceful and truly remarkable. The view is amazing, stunning and it's not a tough walk up at all, lots of places to break and lots to look at. Also it's a short walk from the beautiful Wat Arun.

Great Visit. I found this place by chance after walking around the streets taking photos one day...I could see the amazing golden top of the temple and walked straight to it. Only 20THB to walk up to the top the view is amazing! It is a nice walk too, the steps are not too steep. Definitely recommend going here, close walk from Khao San-even better at sun set!

Peaceful oasis. We went to the Golden Mount to fill in a couple of hours. A working monastery with chanting monks, gold leaf trees and lots of greenery. The funeral of the most senior monk was taking place, interesting to watch.
Spectacular views. Lovely place to visit ,a nice gentle ascent to the top where one is rewarded with super 360 view of the city.lovely gardens and statues on the way up.

Went there randomly. We saw the temple of course climbed the stairs. the atmosphere there is so peaceful. so many fountains and little statues on the way up. but the most beautiful surprise was this huge golden Buddha maybe 3 metres tall ...

Worth a little climb for the view. A few steps to get to the top but they're really shallow and not difficult - another little oasis in the middle of the city and one of the most sacred places in Thailand. Great views all round on the roof

Nice view, walk to the top relaxing. The old Golden Mount sign outside gives no indication of how lovely it is within the compound. The whole place is well kept and you can take a lot of great pictures here. There's a 20 baht entrance fee, but you can easily get in for free if you look Thai. Going up the stairs, you'll pass by bells, water features, benches, and more. At the top there are more statues to view and a shop you can buy souvenirs at.
peace awaits you. just walking up to the peak of this place makes you feel at ease it just takes away all your worries and makes you think of all the wonders in life.
very nice view. went with 2 friends, walk slow and enjoy the top of the temple. Better go earlier otherwise will be melts.

Beautiful and Incredible. This was an Incredible experience, one of my best while I was in Bangkok, this temple is beautiful, its surroundings are beautiful, lots of trees, plants, flowers, sometimes it feels like your climbing a temple in the jungle. climbing the temple was so much fun, and reaching the top, you are rewarded with great views, this is one of my favourite temples I went to.

Nice view over city. The view from the top is great. We came on an extremely hot day and missed the staircase in the temple at the top and started to walk down again before realising there must be more and so turned around and walked back up! There is an area to buy refreshments and sit if you need to before climbing the last set of steps. Taking the trip up the mount twice took it out of us!

Beautiful views and stunning Buddhist art!. Easy to get to, beautiful views and a place that leaves you in awe! 20 bhat is a great price too! I loved all of the art and amazing architecture surrounding this massive golden mountain. Bring water!

good view of old bangkok. good view of old bangkok from here inexpensive entry fee, gets you away from the hustle and bustle at street level for a while.watch out for the gem scam man stood at the bridge over the canal, wanting to take you to see the lucky buddha.

"Real Thai" experience. This location is a bit far from the rest of the tourist spots but does come close to Jim Thompson House ... so try to combine the two. Our guide ... and own experience ... say this is less a historical and/or tourist spot and more a place real Thais come to pray. A very long walk up the stairs ... so the mobility challenged might not make it to the top for a 360 panorama of Bangkok sprawl.
One of the best temples in Bangkok. I love it. Just go up on the top and relax with the view and spiritual feeling of the place.This is one of the "must go" temples in Bangkok.

Worth a visit. located 10 - 15min walk from the democary square, the surroundings of the temple is quite and peaceful. Didn't feel too toursitic yet it offers great view from the top of the temple and is beautifully decorrated in/outside. Not a must, but highly recommended. Beaware of those who have problems with stairs, its a good 10min stair walk to the top!
One of the better temple. Amazing view at the top, there's also a coffee shop on the way up, it was free when i visit and much less crowded than the other temples.

Great view. Interesting site to visit. There was places for food service on ground level but at the time we visited none were open. There was food available part way up. You go up the south side then down the north.
really nice. Golden Mount is one perfect place to visit in Bangkok, It has its own historical and religious values, but one amazing view on the top where you have 360 degrees view of Bangkok

quiet and a great place to relax and chill out. quieter than alot of other locations... and lovely to walk around and up to the top of.. an easy walk up, one is able to ring the bells as you go.. and get a great view over bangkok.. sitting at the top was inspiring in itself ... again a place not to miss..
One of my favorite temples in Bangkok. I don't know why.. maybe because it is on a hill. Just beautiful to look at and to look from. Take a look.

Worth the Views . The climb is worth the panoramic view you get at the top, the architecture is very impressive as well and the attention to detail of the gold leaf is beautiful.
Time to visit 60-90 minutes
Worth the climg. It was fun to ring the bells and knock the gong. Exercise to climb up the path, but worth it at the top to see the view from above.

Great views of Bangkok. It was certainly worth a climb to see the panoramic view of the city and the contrast of old and new. As you climb, there are water shrines and recordings of prayers. At the top the Buddhas were being decorated. A friendly bird tried to join in.

Due to protest in Bangkok, we were not allowed to see this temple. Due to protest in Bangkok, we were not allowed to see this temple. You maybe facing the same if you go there before the protest ends so be prepared.
always a recommendation. During our personal tours of the city, this is definitely included. Bangkok is filled with history and architecture that never seizes to amaze.

Interesting place to see. A bit far from other touristic attractions, you should take a taxi or tuk-tuk to get there. We have been walking there from Grand Palace and it was a difficult experience becouse of horrible traffic and air pollution. However it was worthy todo it. The area close to Wat Saket is very tipical with handcrafts workshops. From the top of Wat Saket you will see a wanderfull panorama of Bangkok.particularly at the sunset
Beautiful view. One of the best views of the city. I took some amazing photos from the too. The female statues around the temple are interesting.

How to get to Wat Saket the Golden Mount - the cheap way. Well, enough is said about this temple, it is simply one of the must-go places in Bangkok if you love history and culture, the problem is how to get there. The bad news is that there's no direct public transportation available to Wat Saket, you have to take taxi, problem is from where. If budget is your main concern, then the best way to go there is probably by boat + taxi, here's how:1. Take BTS train and get off at Saphan Taksin station2. Walk (about 1 min) to Central pier (or Sathorn pier) and take Chao Phraya Tourist Boat to No.9 Maharajl pier (the fare is 40 Baht)3. Get off at No.9 Maharajl, walk out the pier (you should now see the Grand Palace just few steps away) and take taxi from there, tell the driver to go to Wat Saket and remember to pay NO MORE THAN 80 Baht4. Return cost to No.9 Maharajl pier is around 60 Baht by tuk tuk car.I've seen some suggestions that one can as well take taxi from national stadium, but it will definitely cost more since it is far compared to from the pier and usually has more traffic jam.

A hidden gem in a manic city!. This was not on our original list to visit but thanks to taking advantage of our tuk tuk ride I'm glad we made the effort.This temple is beautiful. It will cost 20 Baht to get in, there is a climb but the steps aren't steep so the going is quite easy. There are the bells to ring, and you get the opportunity to see the city when you get to the top of the mount. You a won't need more than 45 mins there so definitely a worthwhile detour.

Terrific views across Bangkok. Golden Mount (Wat Saket) has an interesting history. 150 years ago a Thai king decided to build a giant Chedi on the site. Because of the loose soil it collapsed, leaving a huge mound of mud and bricks, which over time was covered in weeds and undergrowth. This provided a more stable foundation and later The Golden Mount temple was built on this artificial hill. There is a slow winding staircase up the mount, with bells along the way. Ring the bells as you go, its good luck and expected, even if you are a tourist. Atop there are terrific views across Bangkok, and many Buddha statues. You wont spend more than an hour or so there, but the view and walk up the staircase (not a tough walk at all) is definitely worth the excursion.
Sublime view of Bangkok. Great view the temple it self is not big. Lots of stares to climb dont expect to be here much longer than a one hour.

A short walk north of the Grand Palace. It used to be free, but you now have to pay to go in. A long spiral staircase up around the outside of the man made mount. A walk around inside then a small staircase to the top open level.An interesting site with wat Ratchanatdaram 5 minutes walk away
Unique temple and great view of the city. Not so easy to find but worth the effort. Easy walk up to the top of the Golden Mount. Great views and atmosphere on the roof. Highly recommended.

Worth the steps!!. I used to live in BKK but had never climbed to the top of the Golden Mount..... I am not great with stairs but the ones here were very gently graded and made going up easy. The view from the top was great - our day was quite clear!! If you want to add to the adventure of getting there go by boat on the canal its only a short walk from the end of the ride.

Hike it in the Morning. Well, the best time of the day to hike is during the morning where there are still visitors and heat still don't bite.They collect TH฿20.00 in the entrance - pretty cheap. The main highlight of the temple is the golden chedi mounted on the rooftop (or hill's summit). It also offers the best 360 panoramic view of Bangkok.

One of the Temples to see. This is a beautiful temple to see. I was fortunate enough to go in November when there is a annual festival where the temple is open at night and there is festival in the streets below. I was one of the few westerners there with the locals offering their prayers and offerings. It was a great experience. I think it would also be a worthwhile visit without the festival.

Stunning. Beautiful spot in middle of Bangkok craziness! It has a great view and the ascent there feels like your in the middle of a little jungle. The only thing I deplore is that there are not much indications for tourists to understand all the details and the cult related to this particular location, but that's consistent across all temples in Thailand... It's just sad to see such beautiful and meaningful things and not understanding their meanings...

Best temple in Bangkok. This temple is awesome. Only paid 20 Baht to get in, but you get to climb, ring the bells, and see the city of Bangkok from atop of the hill. From the top, you can see the largest single suspension bridge in Bangkok. Not many tourists visit this place, which makes it a plus. Even if it is a hot day, the high elevation provides enough breeze to reduce your sweat.

nice place. It was some difficult to find the entrance but when we started to climb the stairs to the temple we felt some in paradise. The small waterfall and the vegetation. To reach the temple upside was a good excersise.

Great views over Bangkok, worth a visit.. I thought this was really good the Golden Mount at the top was very impressive and the views are really good. I can imagine at sunset you'd get a great view across the city!For anyone who's worried it's not far or steep to the top, there was a sign saying it's 120 steps but they are quite small steps. I had to take two steps at a time because they were to close together.

Yup its a golden hill.... but don't tell everyone. Great place!! you can walk here from Kao san, and the walk up is through a garden with monks chanting and big gongs. the top has amazing views and few crowds, very special place among Bangkok many sights

nice view. now there is an entrance fee of 20 bath. Don't know if the coffee is still excellent. Lot of steps. Not worth to go specially for this but nice to do combined with other visits in the area.

Perfect.. A must visit. Maybe one of the most tradition things. The temple was just amazing, volunteers were everywere to help you and the city views were just amazing. For me it was my best visit in Thailand.

Worth visiting - less touristic. Most tourists will visit the top 3 temples: Wat Phra Keow (at Grand Palace), Wat Pho (Sleeping Buddha) and Wat Arun (across the river from Wat Pho). I once heard a tourist said "Once you see a Wat, you've seen them all." This can't be more wrong. Wat Saket is definitely worth visiting. I have been there twice. The circular climb to the hill top is calming, and once you get to the top, the view is fantastic. The gold-leaf covered Buddha was also beautiful.

Good exercise!. Took canal boat ride from Pratunam Pier to the last pier at Wat Saket. Fare is only 12baht. A 5 mins walk, you will arrive at the counter to begin the climb after paying 20baht. Coming down will be via another route. This hillock is man-made. The initial climb up is make cooler by the small waterfall, stream and artificial mist with shady plants. Not a difficult climb and not high. Go up to the highest level to view Bangkok city. Toilets are availble at ground level, clean as in most toilets in Bangkok.

Great view. The temple itself is not that special, but the view is worth the trip. You get a 360 degree view of Bangkok from atop the temple. Worth checking out if you have a 45 minutes to an hour to spare.
Nice views of the city. The walk up takes a little while, but there are benches along the way and the view from the top is quite nice, as is the top of the building itself.
Awesome!. I consider this to be the best temple in Bangkok due to it's sheer size and the grand views all around. Well worth a few hours of your day.

Beautiful Views Over Bangkok. Good to visit on a nice sunny day to make the most of the sun shining off the Golden Stupa at the top and also to enjoy the views of Bangkok. It is a nice walk to the top up quite a few stairs. These stairs should be fine for most people and there are plenty of places to stop. You can also ring the bells on the way up at certain places. A good place to include on your itinerary in Bangkok if you have a few days.

Quiet Breath Taking. Sites from this place are breath taking. Is quiet a walk so take it easy if you aren't fit. Even if you are not fit make sure you do do it because the sights are well worth the 10 or so minute trek. There are places to stop and have a rest so you can take your time. Defiantly bring some water coz it gets HOT with the reflection from the gold. But defiantly we'll worth the trek!

Large, but not overly interesting. This chedi is very large, but is not at all ornate and very plain in comparison to the other temples and sights around town. Its height does give you a good panoramic view of Bangkok, and that might be the major attraction. Don't forget to ring the bells as you enter on the left side and exit on the right side. Also remember you temple manners; that the structure is walked around in a counter-clockwise direction.

Unusual temple with amazing views. We visited this on a Wednesday and we were told entry was free on that day, though it would be worth the admission anyway. As well as an interesting climb through some interesting gardens, the temple itself contains a holy Buddha relic and there are amazing 360 degree views of Bangkok from the rooftop chedi (follow the arrows to the stairs).

Walking distance from Khao san rd. Worth visiting here and doing a few other little touristy things on your way around, a unique looking building, come early to avoid the crowds unless you want a photo with a strangers head in it.Takes about 10 mins to walk - or less from Khao san Road so avoid the highly over priced tuk tuk tours taking you the scenic route to get there.The building i kept in good condition. b respectful and dress appropriately as per the rest of the sites in BKK.

Golden mount, wat pho and wat arun and giant swing. This is a nice hike to top of golden mount. Gives a great view and can be used for nice day of visiting wats. Start golden mount walk to giant swing and small wat there, walk to wat pho, have lunch, massage in wat pho and the head to wat arun. Figure your way back on a boat down the river. Awesome day in Bangkok.

Great view, great time. If you're planning on checking out several temples, I'd put this on the top of your list for sure. It's surrounded by safe neighborhoods so I'd recommend for it for solo travelers as well.
great view . The golden Mount in the middle of town a place to visit to have a nice view on the sourrounding.don't forget to ring all bell's

Very Nice. I enjoyed this little stop. It was a little but steep hike to the top, so bring a bottle of water. There are some great views of the surrounding city with its diverse types of structures: temples, modern and low cost.
Interesting place. We had a quick stop at this place for our first look at a temple in Thailand. It is worth the climb to the temple at the top. Has an interesting view of Bangkok on the roof.

Free food surprise. I went to this monument in a bad mood and returned in a great one. First, it was the delicious free food. After looking for many days, I finally found coconut disc-shaped pancakes here! The tea, coffee, Som Tum, Pad Thai, soup, etc. were all delicious and yes, I had them all. Next, the climb up for the view is a must. This was the best view of Bangkok for me.

Thought it was free but there was a cost. We'd headed across to the Golden Mount because we'd read in our guidebook that it was a free fantastic way to see across the whole of Bangkok. Whilst some other reviewers have also agreed it was free, when we went you were only allowed part way up and had to pay to access the very top which we didn't bother to do. I don't know whether they've recently started charging or whether it was because we went on a bank holiday (the King's birthday).The views were good from half way up but it was very crowded so we spent a lot of the time queuing.It's an ok visit for if you're in the area but unless you're willing to pay to go to the top I wouldn't go out of your way to visit it.

Not so famous, but well worth the visit. You have to look a little bit for it and, even though it's not all that far from the Grand Palace, I guess it's not that well known (I only saw about 15 other tourists while I was there). It's quite the climb to get up, but it's well worth it. Besides the beauty of Wat Saket itself, it offers you an amazing view of the city that you can't get anywhere else.

One step forward to a nice place. If you are thinking about taking a trip to Bangkok and you want to visit a beautiful place that is more secluded, this is the spot to go. This was a very relaxing experience for us, and the view we saw at the top was truly amazing. There is no fee for entry and there is quite a climb to get to the very top. You climb the stairs to get to see a panoramic view of Ko Rattanakosin (the old city). On clear day you can see the Grand Palace, Chaopraya River and China Town.Many shrines and misting waterfalls on the way up. A very peaceful experience. The main beauty of the temple is the building, its location, and the views.About transportation, I advise you to get a taxi or a tuk tuk to wait for you. This is so easy, just organize this at the point of pickup and should not cost you any more than 100 baht.

Nice view but a 20 THB fee so not free. Good climb and good views airy setting , lovely atmosphere very relaxedAble to walk up in shoes worth the fee probably but a ride on the river express costs less

Loved it, cheap and well worth it.. We both enjoyed going up the golden mount, yes it's quite a few steps but the view is worth it you can see so much of Bangkok. We were so glad we went, the mount also has ceremonial bells and various gongs which you can have a go with, we'll worth the walk :)
A MUST DO IN BANGKOK. A Wat with a difference. The walk up is worth the views at the top and the Wat is beautiful. Well worth the money
Nice afternoon out. Worth an hour, nice view of the city at the top. Take the water bus from Sukhumvit if you're staying around there

Recommended 8/10. + great view
+ cheap entry ticket
+ interactive activities (...great for families)
- crowded with tourists (as expected)
- tricky to find
Overall highly recommended 8/10- especially for families with kids.

Worth A Visit. This Wat is definitely one of the main attractions in Bangkok, especially with the view of the city which you have from this location. Pleasant is the fact that this is not as crowded as most important temple in Bangkok, so here you can enjoy a little time and relax without hassle.
Good view of Bangkok. Interesting view of the city, but a bit out of the way. If you have already seen the main temples, it's a nice option.

Excellent view and a beautiful temple. We visited golden mount temple when we went to visit Grand Palace in Bangkok. It is not very far from Grand Palace. The place has a ticket of 20 Baht. This is very nice place to see and one has to climb the steps to reach the top where the Buddhist temple is located. You get some very good views of Bangkok City as you climb to temple.Overall, the place is definitely worth a visit.

Great views. First visited over 10 years ago. Is just like I remembered. A bit of a walk to the top but nothing major - make sure you have a cold drink with you though. There is a small cafe halfway up. Once at the top the views over Bangkok are great. Is very warm up there though. 20b entrance fee.
